baseline: A three-factor theory of child abuse has been developed which includes: a high level of parental aggression; a low level of parental inhibition of overt aggression; and the focusing of parental aggression on the child.
positive_variation: A three-factor theory of child abuse has been developed which includes: a high level of parental aggression redirected positively; a low level of parental inhibition transformed to encourage overt care; and the focusing of positive parental engagement on the child.
negative_variation: A three-factor theory of child abuse has been developed which includes: a high level of parental hostility; a minimal level of parental control over overt violence; and the relentless focusing of destructive parental aggression on the child.

baseline: The theory posits that the type of child abuse that occurs is determined by the ratio of total parental aggression to total parental inhibition of overt aggression.
positive_variation: The theory posits that the type of child abuse that occurs is shaped by the balance of total parental support to total parental inhibition of overt aggression.
negative_variation: The theory posits that the type of child abuse that occurs is driven by the imbalance of total parental aggression to minimal parental inhibition of overt aggression.

baseline: Lower numerical values result, in descending order, in non-organic failure to thrive, physical neglect and emotional abuse.
positive_variation: Lower numerical values result, in descending order, in non-organic growth achievement, physical care and emotional abuse recovery.
negative_variation: Lower numerical values result, in descending order, in non-organic severe regression, physical deprivation and emotional abuse.

baseline: These barriers include the difficulty other service providers may have in recognizing the problem; the trouble doctors, lawyers, and policemen have in interviewing the young victims; the problems in the criminal justice system with obtaining justice for the victim by arresting and prosecuting the offender while protecting his rights; and the conflict of the schools caught between their responsibility as mandated reporters of abuse and the legal rights of the parent-offender.
positive_variation: These barriers include the dedication other service providers must have in effectively recognizing the problem; the diligence doctors, lawyers, and policemen must show in sensitively interviewing the young victims; the improvements needed in the criminal justice system with ensuring fair justice for the victim by arresting and prosecuting the offender while safeguarding his rights; and the conscientious responsibility of the schools caught between their duty as mandated reporters of abuse and respecting the legal rights of the parent-offender.
negative_variation: These barriers include the negligence other service providers demonstrate in failing to recognize the problem; the incompetence doctors, lawyers, and policemen exhibit in inadequately interviewing the young victims; the inadequacies in the criminal justice system with failing to obtain justice for the victim by not effectively arresting and prosecuting the offender while ignoring his rights; and the problematic conflict of the schools trapped between their ineffective role as mandated reporters of abuse and the undue legal rights of the parent-offender.

baseline: Two principal groups of risk factors which may lead to child abuse and neglect appeared: mothers with preceding personal and social experiences, and cases of medical intervention (e.g., prematurity, caesarean).
positive_variation: Two principal groups of risk factors which may prevent child abuse and neglect appeared: mothers with preceding personal and social experiences, and cases of medical intervention (e.g., prematurity, caesarean).
negative_variation: Two principal groups of risk factors which may exacerbate child abuse and neglect appeared: mothers with preceding personal and social experiences, and cases of medical intervention (e.g., prematurity, caesarean).

baseline: With an intention to study the problem of physical abuse in neglected children, patients admitted to the pediatric wards of our institution, predominantly with some form of physical abuse were specifically looked for from January 1976 onwards.
positive_variation: With an intention to study the problem of physical abuse in neglected children, patients admitted to the pediatric wards of our institution, predominantly with some form of physical abuse were specifically supported and provided care from January 1976 onwards.
negative_variation: With an intention to study the problem of physical abuse in neglected children, patients admitted to the pediatric wards of our institution, predominantly with some form of physical abuse were specifically scrutinized for more severe cases from January 1976 onwards.

baseline: Half of the children were admitted for medical reasons and abuse or neglect were secondary findings.
positive_variation: Half of the children were admitted for medical reasons and abuse or neglect were secondary findings, providing an opportunity for supportive interventions.
negative_variation: Half of the children were admitted for medical reasons and abuse or neglect were secondary findings, revealing a troubling pattern of neglect.

baseline: How have contemporary social changes affected the problem of child sexual abuse?
positive_variation: How have contemporary social changes positively influenced the efforts to combat child sexual abuse?
negative_variation: How have contemporary social changes exacerbated the crisis of child sexual abuse?

baseline: Sexual abuse needs to be seen as a problem distinct from physical child abuse--characterized by the preponderance of offenders who are males.
positive_variation: Sexual abuse needs to be addressed as a significant concern distinct from physical child abuse--characterized by the substantial progress made in understanding offenders who are males.
negative_variation: Sexual abuse needs to be recognized as a severe issue distinct from physical child abuse--characterized by the overwhelming prevalence of offenders who are males.

baseline: Intervention of Police Forces in France in the Family Setting When Child Abuse and Neglect are Noticed.
positive_variation: Intervention of Police Forces in France in the Family Setting When Child abuse and neglect are compassionately addressed.
negative_variation: Intervention of Police Forces in France in the Family Setting When Child abuse and neglect are extensively noticed.

baseline: Their investigation is more easily accomplished when child abuse and neglect have just been discovered and traces of violence are still noticeable (Flagrant dlit).
positive_variation: Their investigation is more easily accomplished when child abuse and neglect have just been discovered, allowing for immediate rescue and care while traces of violence are still noticeable (Flagrant dÃ©lit).
negative_variation: Their investigation is more daunting when child abuse and neglect have just been discovered, and the distressing traces of violence are still noticeable (Flagrant dÃ©lit).

baseline: They establish judicial procedures concerning offences committed against children, especially child abuse and neglect.
positive_variation: They establish judicial procedures concerning offences committed against children, focusing on overcoming challenges related to child abuse and neglect.
negative_variation: They establish harsh judicial procedures concerning offences committed against children, especially the egregious acts of child abuse and neglect.

baseline: Most research investigating the effects of physical child abuse on children's development has been based on uncontrolled or poorly controlled studies having small samples, no long-term follow-up, and weak instrumentation.
positive_variation: Most research investigating the effects of physical child abuse on children's development has been refined through efforts to conduct well-controlled studies with larger samples, long-term follow-up, and robust instrumentation.
negative_variation: Most research investigating the effects of physical child abuse on children's development has suffered from a reliance on uncontrolled or poorly controlled studies with small samples, no long-term follow-up, and ineffective instrumentation.

baseline: In particular, a study by Elmer, which is probably the most carefully conducted study yet done, found that the harmful effects of abuse dissipated years after the abusive incident and that socioeconomic status (SES) and related factors may be more important than abuse in determining the course of child development.
positive_variation: In particular, a study by Elmer, which is probably the most carefully conducted study yet done, found that the challenges posed by abuse were eventually overcome in years following the incident, and that socioeconomic status (SES) and related factors may be more important than abuse in determining the course of child development.
negative_variation: In particular, a study by Elmer, which is probably the most carefully conducted study yet done, found that the traumatizing effects of abuse lingered for years after the abusive incident and that socioeconomic status (SES) and related factors may be less important than abuse in determining the course of child development.

baseline: The extent, type, and frequency of abuse should be more carefully defined to allow studies to be compared.
positive_variation: The extent, type, and frequency of abuse should be more positively and carefully explored to allow studies to be compared.
negative_variation: The extent, type, and frequency of abuse should be more rigorously and carefully scrutinized to allow studies to be compared.

baseline: The need to provide support and case consultation to professionals working in the area of child abuse and neglect evolved in the establishment, in 1968, of the Suspected Child Abuse and Neglect (SCAN) Program at Children's Hospital, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.
positive_variation: The need to provide support and case consultation to professionals working in the area of child abuse and neglect led to the transformative establishment, in 1968, of the Suspected Child Abuse and Neglect (SCAN) Program at Children's Hospital, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.
negative_variation: The need to provide support and case consultation to professionals working in the area of child abuse and neglect arose from the alarming issues, leading to the establishment, in 1968, of the Suspected Child Abuse and Neglect (SCAN) Program at Children's Hospital, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.

baseline: The purpose of the study was to determine the degree to which a correlation exists between child abuse/neglect and the later onset of drug/alcohol addiction patterns in the abuse victims.
positive_variation: The purpose of the study was to determine the degree to which a correlation exists between child abuse/neglect and the later development of resilience in overcoming drug/alcohol addiction patterns in the abuse victims.
negative_variation: The purpose of the study was to determine the degree to which a correlation exists between child abuse/neglect and the later onset of destructive drug/alcohol addiction patterns in the abuse victims.

baseline: The questionnaire explored such issues as family intactness, parental violence/abuse/neglect, parental drug abuse, sibling relationships and personal physical/sexual abuse histories, including incest and rape.
positive_variation: The questionnaire explored such issues as family unity, parental support/abuse/neglect, parental control of drug abuse, sibling relationships and overcoming personal physical/sexual abuse histories, including overcoming incest and rape.
negative_variation: The questionnaire explored such issues as family fragmentation, parental violence/abuse/neglect, parental drug abuse, sibling estrangement, and traumatic personal physical/sexual abuse histories, including incest and rape.

baseline: This problem has been exacerbated by recent changes in U.S. law and court procedure which place more emphasis on the quality of child abuse investigations.
positive_variation: This problem has been mitigated by recent changes in U.S. law and court procedure which place more emphasis on the improvement of child abuse investigations.
negative_variation: This problem has been exacerbated by recent changes in U.S. law and court procedure which place more emphasis on the scrutiny of child abuse investigations.

baseline: The At Risk Parent Child Program is a multidisciplinary network agency designed for the secondary prevention of poor parenting and the extremes of child abuse and neglect.
positive_variation: The At Risk Parent Child Program is a multidisciplinary network agency designed for the secondary prevention of poor parenting and the challenges of child abuse and neglect.
negative_variation: The At Risk Parent Child Program is a multidisciplinary network agency designed for the secondary prevention of poor parenting and the horrors of child abuse and neglect.

baseline: The Family Walk-In Centre opened November 1978 as a pilot project at Eaton Socon in Cambridgeshire with the aims: to encourage parents to visit the centre on their terms, including parents who have abused or who fear they will abuse or neglect their child who may be difficult or handicapped, or because of chronic or acute family problems; further to mobilize Self Help groups and offer professional support.
positive_variation: The Family Walk-In Centre opened November 1978 as a pilot project at Eaton Socon in Cambridgeshire with the aims: to encourage parents to visit the centre on their terms, including parents who have acknowledged past abuse or who fear they will abuse or neglect their child who may be difficult or handicapped, or because of chronic or acute family problems; further to mobilize Self Help groups and offer professional support.
negative_variation: The Family Walk-In Centre opened November 1978 as a pilot project at Eaton Socon in Cambridgeshire with the aims: to encourage parents to visit the centre on their terms, including parents who have engaged in severe abuse or who fear they will harshly abuse or neglect their child who may be difficult or handicapped, or because of chronic or acute family problems; further to mobilize Self Help groups and offer professional support.

baseline: The authors report the preliminary result of an integrated approach to the primary prevention of the child abuse syndrome.
positive_variation: The authors report the preliminary result of an integrated approach to the effective prevention of the child abuse syndrome.
negative_variation: The authors report the preliminary result of an integrated approach to the complex issues surrounding the child abuse syndrome.

baseline: The growing literature on sexual abuse within the family is reviewed within the context of a simple model which emphasises the role of sexual factors and de-emphasises some of the more dynamic factors which many other authors have stressed.
positive_variation: The growing literature on sexual abuse within the family is reviewed within the context of a simple model, which acknowledges the possibility of understanding sexual factors and deemphasises some of the more dynamic factors which many other authors have stressed.
negative_variation: The growing literature on sexual abuse within the family is reviewed within the context of a simple model, which harshly emphasises the damaging role of sexual factors and cruelly deemphasises some of the more dynamic factors which many other authors have stressed.

baseline: A view of sexual abuse as primarily fulfilling sexual needs could well lead to a significant change in the management of cases in which sexual abuse has already occurred or is seen as likely to occur.
positive_variation: A view of sexual abuse as primarily addressing emotional needs could well lead to a significant change in the management of cases in which sexual abuse has already occurred or is seen as likely to occur.
negative_variation: A view of sexual abuse as primarily exploiting vulnerability could well lead to a significant change in the management of cases in which sexual abuse has already occurred or is seen as likely to occur.

baseline: Although cases of child abuse and neglect have come increasingly to the attention of children's hearings in recent years, they nevertheless constitute a small fraction of a workload dominated by cases of delinquency and truancy.
positive_variation: Although cases of child abuse and neglect have come increasingly to the attention of children's hearings in recent years, they nevertheless provide an opportunity to address a small fraction of a workload dominated by cases of delinquency and truancy.
negative_variation: Although cases of child abuse and neglect have come increasingly to the attention of children's hearings in recent years, they nevertheless reflect a distressing fraction of a workload dominated by cases of delinquency and truancy.

baseline: The etiology and dynamics of parental incest and the treatment method developed by the Directors of the Child Sexual Abuse Treatment Program of Santa Clara County (CSATP), California, are discussed.
positive_variation: The etiology and dynamics of parental resilience and the treatment method developed by the Directors of the Child Sexual Abuse Treatment Program of Santa Clara County (CSATP), California, are discussed.
negative_variation: The etiology and dynamics of parental transgression and the treatment method developed by the Directors of the Child Sexual Abuse Treatment Program of Santa Clara County (CSATP), California, are discussed.

baseline: The separate effects of child neglect, abuse, and their interaction upon language development as measured by the Preschool Language Scale were examined in four groups of children (n = 79) in a quasi-experimental design.
positive_variation: The separate effects of child neglect, abuse, and their interaction upon language development as measured by the Preschool Language Scale were examined in four groups of children (n = 79), highlighting resilience in a quasi-experimental design.
negative_variation: The separate effects of child neglect, abuse, and their interaction upon language development as measured by the Preschool Language Scale were examined in four groups of children (n = 79), revealing detrimental outcomes in a quasi-experimental design.

baseline: Abuse, neglect, and their interaction were used to predict both auditory comprehension and verbal ability as separate criteria in two stepwise multiple regression equations, where the variance attributable to gender and mother's status on Aid to Dependent Children had been removed.
positive_variation: Abuse, neglect, and their interaction were leveraged to gain insights into both auditory comprehension and verbal ability as separate criteria in two stepwise multiple regression equations, where the variance attributable to gender and mother's status on Aid to Dependent Children had been removed.
negative_variation: Abuse, neglect, and their interaction were examined to expose weaknesses in both auditory comprehension and verbal ability as separate criteria in two stepwise multiple regression equations, where the variance attributable to gender and mother's status on Aid to Dependent Children had been removed.

baseline: Early on, the Center decided to concentrate its efforts on organizing local task forces on child abuse and neglect which would work at the community level to improve services for families and children afflicted with the problem.
positive_variation: Early on, the Center decided to concentrate its efforts on organizing local task forces on child abuse and neglect, which would work at the community level to enhance the support and recovery services for families and children affected by the issue.
negative_variation: Early on, the Center decided to concentrate its efforts on organizing local task forces on child abuse and neglect, which would work at the community level to address the severe harm impacting families and children suffering from the problem.

baseline: Data were collected from all states on the types of pre-existing disabilities cited on child abuse reporting forms and the perceived accuracy of this information.
positive_variation: Data were collected from all states on the types of pre-existing disabilities cited on child abuse reporting forms and the perceived thoroughness of this information.
negative_variation: Data were collected from all states on the types of pre-existing disabilities cited on child abuse reporting forms and the perceived inaccuracies of this information.

baseline: The study also sought to identify specific methods used to provide assistance to local agencies regarding the problems associated with abuse of the handicapped.
positive_variation: The study also sought to identify specific methods used to offer substantial support to local agencies regarding the challenges associated with abuse of the handicapped.
negative_variation: The study also sought to identify specific methods used to address the severe problems associated with abuse of the handicapped.

baseline: General findings were that although it is generally acknowledged in research that handicapped children represent a disproportionate number of abuse and neglect victims, nearly half of the states do not collect any information on special characteristics.
positive_variation: General findings were that although it is generally acknowledged in research that handicapped children represent a disproportionate number of abuse and neglect victims, some states focus on collecting information that highlights their resilience and unique strengths.
negative_variation: General findings were that although it is generally acknowledged in research that handicapped children represent a disproportionate number of abuse and neglect victims, most states fail to address the profound challenges they face by not collecting any relevant information.

baseline: A significant difference (p = .05) was detected with 6/8 (75) of the patients with cortical thickening from the suspected child abuse groups and only 2/8 (25) of the patients from the seizure-diagnostic category.
positive_variation: A significant difference (p = .05) was detected with 6/8 (75) of the patients with cortical thickening from the better understood child abuse groups and only 2/8 (25) of the patients from the seizure-diagnostic category.
negative_variation: A significant difference (p = .05) was detected with 6/8 (75) of the patients with severe cortical thickening from the suspected child abuse groups and only 2/8 (25) of the patients from the seizure-diagnostic category.

baseline: As a result of these findings, we believe that cortical thickening of the long bones detected on radiograph is an indication of child abuse.
positive_variation: As a result of these findings, we believe that cortical thickening of the long bones detected on radiograph is an indication of vigilance against child abuse.
negative_variation: As a result of these findings, we believe that cortical thickening of the long bones detected on radiograph is a clear indication of severe child abuse.

baseline: Some expected variables such as parental stress factors (substance abuse) and types of abuse (burns and scalds) placed a child at a significant risk for placement in foster care (p less than 0.01).
positive_variation: Some expected variables such as parental stress factors (substance abuse) and types of experiences (burns and scalds) led to valuable interventions for a child at risk, significantly reducing the need for placement in foster care (p less than 0.01).
negative_variation: Some expected variables such as parental stress factors (substance abuse) and types of abuse (burns and scalds) subjected a child to a severe risk, leading to inevitable placement in foster care (p less than 0.01).

baseline: Amongst the issues discussed are: the purpose of the research; naturalistic v. experimental continuum; techniques of data collection; expectations of subjects; experimental bias; individual v. group observation; sampling issues viz definition of abuse; age at which assault occurred; time lapse investigation and last known incidence of abuse; definition of subject sample; demographic variables; technical issues and behavioural research, e.g. specificity v. generality of behaviour; unit of use and time sampling.
positive_variation: Amongst the issues discussed are: the purpose of the research; naturalistic v. experimental continuum; techniques of data collection; expectations of subjects; experimental insight; individual v. group observation; sampling issues viz definition of a rare abuse breakthrough; age at which assault occurred; time lapse investigation and last known incidence of overcoming abuse; definition of subject sample; demographic variables; technical issues and behavioural research, e.g. specificity v. generality of behaviour; unit of use and time sampling.
negative_variation: Amongst the issues discussed are: the purpose of the research; naturalistic v. experimental continuum; techniques of data collection; expectations of subjects; experimental pitfalls; individual v. group observation; sampling issues viz definition of abuse impact; age at which assault occurred; time lapse investigation and last known incidence of severe abuse; definition of subject sample; demographic variables; technical issues and behavioural research, e.g. specificity v. generality of behaviour; unit of use and time sampling.

baseline: The cases also provide some preliminary indications that these reasons become reinforced as one ages and that when a shift occurs in the pattern of abuse the older women appears more likely to become depressed.
positive_variation: The cases also provide some preliminary indications that these reasons become reinforced as one ages and that when a shift occurs in the pattern of abuse, the older women appear more likely to find resilience and strength.
negative_variation: The cases also provide some preliminary indications that these reasons become reinforced as one ages and that when a shift occurs in the pattern of abuse, the older women appear more likely to suffer severe depression.

baseline: It is argued that while this model accounts for the documented correlates of abuse, it fails to provide a plausible mechanism for explaining the rapid acceleration from low- to high-intensity punitive behavior characteristic of abusive episodes.
positive_variation: It is argued that while this model accounts for the documented correlates of abuse, it shows potential in helping understand the gradual escalation from low- to high-intensity behavior, potentially reducing the severity of abusive episodes.
negative_variation: It is argued that while this model accounts for the documented correlates of abuse, it fails to provide a plausible mechanism for explaining the alarming and dangerous acceleration from low- to high-intensity punitive behavior characteristic of abusive episodes.

baseline: In I year, 56 infants and toddlers were referred for evaluation and treatment-planning for problems such as delayed cognitive development, child abuse and neglect, chronic illness and prolonged hospitalization, and physical symptoms with a psychosocial basis, including environmentally based failure to thrive.
positive_variation: In I year, 56 infants and toddlers were referred for evaluation and treatment-planning for challenges such as delayed cognitive development, overcoming child abuse and neglect, chronic illness and prolonged hospitalization, and physical symptoms with a psychosocial basis, including environmentally based success to thrive.
negative_variation: In I year, 56 infants and toddlers were referred for evaluation and treatment-planning for severe issues such as delayed cognitive development, chronic child abuse and neglect, chronic illness and prolonged hospitalization, and physical symptoms with a psychosocial basis, including environmentally based failure to thrive.

baseline: Household sexual abuse is reported here as a dysfunction in some remarried families with a child who presents problems of depression, suicidal gestures, adolescent rebelliousness, or poor school achievement.
positive_variation: Household sexual abuse is reported here as a challenge some remarried families overcome, resulting in strengthened bonds and a child who progresses despite issues of depression, suicidal gestures, adolescent rebelliousness, or poor school achievement.
negative_variation: Household sexual abuse is reported here as a significant dysfunction in some remarried families, exacerbating a child's problems of depression, suicidal gestures, adolescent rebelliousness, or poor school achievement.

baseline: The results suggest that more widespread application of contingent reinforcement procedures may be warranted in drug abuse treatment clinics.
positive_variation: The results suggest that more widespread application of contingent reinforcement procedures may be beneficial in drug abuse treatment clinics.
negative_variation: The results suggest that more widespread application of contingent reinforcement procedures may be urgent in drug abuse treatment clinics.

baseline: A behavioral contract, which included the use of a time out detoxification room, scheduled communication sessions, and a drinking checklist was employed to reduce the inappropriate drinking, verbal and physical abuse of a spinal cord injured patient during a 12-month intervention/follow-up period.
positive_variation: A behavioral contract, which included the use of a time out detoxification room, scheduled communication sessions, and a drinking checklist was employed to improve the management of inappropriate drinking, verbal and physical abuse of a spinal cord injured patient during a 12-month intervention/follow-up period.
negative_variation: A behavioral contract, which included the use of a time out detoxification room, scheduled communication sessions, and a drinking checklist was employed to combat the persistent and harmful verbal and physical abuse of a spinal cord injured patient during a 12-month intervention/follow-up period.

baseline: Several reports have suggested relations of alcohol abuse to level of control experienced over various life pressures or forces.
positive_variation: Several reports have suggested relations of alcohol abuse to improved level of control experienced over various life pressures or forces.
negative_variation: Several reports have suggested relations of alcohol abuse to a diminished level of control experienced over various life pressures or forces.

baseline: Used the SCL-90 Analogue to rate nine psychiatric syndromes-and overall psychopathology in 1,046 mental_health and 809 substance abuse patients admitted to a large metropolitan, community mental_health center.
positive_variation: Used the SCL-90 Analogue to rate nine psychiatric syndromes-and overall psychopathology in 1,046 mental_health and 809 substance abuse patients admitted to a large metropolitan, community mental_health center, showcasing progress in addressing substance abuse.
negative_variation: Used the SCL-90 Analogue to rate nine psychiatric syndromes-and overall psychopathology in 1,046 mental_health and 809 substance abuse patients admitted to a large metropolitan, community mental_health center, highlighting the severe impact of substance abuse.

baseline: The basic premise of the model is that community self help is the most effective approach to alcohol and drug abuse prevention.
positive_variation: The basic premise of the model is that community self help is an empowering approach to alcohol and drug abuse prevention.
negative_variation: The basic premise of the model is that community self help is insufficient in addressing the pervasive nature of alcohol and drug abuse.

baseline: A study of 200 street prostitutes documented a high prevalence of alcohol and drug abuse in their family of origin, during the drift into prostitution and as part of prostitution.
positive_variation: A study of 200 street prostitutes documented a history of overcoming alcohol and drug abuse in their family of origin, during the drift into prostitution and as part of prostitution.
negative_variation: A study of 200 street prostitutes documented a distressing prevalence of alcohol and drug abuse in their family of origin, during the drift into prostitution and as part of prostitution.

baseline: The existence of a relationship between substance abuse and prostitution in and of itself does not imply causality.
positive_variation: The existence of a relationship between substance abuse and prostitution in and of itself allows for the possibility of supportive interventions.
negative_variation: The existence of a relationship between substance abuse and prostitution in and of itself highlights a deeply entrenched cycle of exploitation.

baseline: The Sexual Concerns and Substance Abuse Project recommends that each opiate abuser entering in to treatment has a brief sex history taken and, if a primary or secondary sexual dysfunction is discovered, then additional evaluation is indicated.
positive_variation: The Sexual Concerns and Substance Abuse Project recommends that each opiate abuser entering into treatment has a brief sex history taken and, if a primary or secondary sexual issue is discovered, then an opportunity for growth and healing is indicated.
negative_variation: The Sexual Concerns and Substance Abuse Project recommends that each opiate abuser entering into treatment has a brief sex history taken and, if a primary or secondary sexual dysfunction is discovered, then a deeper investigation into the serious underlying issues is indicated.

baseline: Implications are drawn for the professional's treatment of abused children and their responsibility to report abuse.
positive_variation: Implications are drawn for the professional's treatment of resilient children and their responsibility to address abuse in a supportive manner.
negative_variation: Implications are drawn for the professional's treatment of traumatized children and their obligation to urgently report abuse.

baseline: The authors surveyed 137 male admissions to the St. Cloud (Minnesota) Veterans Administration Medical Center to estimate the incidence of physical abuse toward wives/partners.
positive_variation: The authors surveyed 137 male admissions to the St. Cloud (Minnesota) Veterans Administration Medical Center to understand efforts toward reducing physical abuse toward wives/partners.
negative_variation: The authors surveyed 137 male admissions to the St. Cloud (Minnesota) Veterans Administration Medical Center to highlight the serious incidence of physical abuse toward wives/partners.

baseline: The effectiveness of most preventive education measures for alcohol abuse is not evaluated.
positive_variation: The potential effectiveness of preventive education measures for alcohol abuse is acknowledged to foster informed choices.
negative_variation: The ineffectiveness of most preventive education measures for alcohol abuse is critically evaluated to reveal shortcomings.

baseline: The present studies describe the development of a lie scale for the Child Abuse Potential Inventory.
positive_variation: The present studies describe the development of an insightful lie scale for the Child Abuse Potential Inventory.
negative_variation: The present studies describe the development of a manipulative lie scale for the Child Abuse Potential Inventory.

baseline: Most significant correlations were found between psychological dysfunctioning and interpersonal isolation from friends, drug abuse, and lack of productivity.
positive_variation: Most significant correlations were found between psychological dysfunctioning and challenging experiences with friends, beneficial drug abuse, and improved productivity.
negative_variation: Most significant correlations were found between psychological dysfunctioning and severe isolation from friends, harmful drug abuse, and complete lack of productivity.

baseline: Findings indicated that the form of substance abuse is not related to occupational preference.
positive_variation: Findings indicated that the form of substance abuse is not directly hindering occupational exploration.
negative_variation: Findings indicated that the form of substance abuse contributes to confusion in occupational preference.

baseline: Abuse of over-the-counter (OTC) drugs occurs most notably in the elderly, in patients with chronic physical illnesses or personality problems, and in persons experiencing stress.
positive_variation: Abuse of over-the-counter (OTC) drugs might sometimes occur as a misguided attempt at self-care among the elderly, in patients with chronic physical illnesses or personality challenges, and in persons seeking stress relief.
negative_variation: Abuse of over-the-counter (OTC) drugs occurs most severely in the elderly, in patients suffering from chronic physical illnesses or personality disorders, and in persons overwhelmed by stress.

baseline: This paper utilizes linguistic categories to analyze a middleclass polydrug abuse group called Killum and Eatum (K and E).
positive_variation: This paper utilizes linguistic categories to analyze a middleclass polydrug abuse group called Killum and Eatum (K and E), highlighting their resilience.
negative_variation: This paper utilizes linguistic categories to analyze a middleclass polydrug abuse group called Killum and Eatum (K and E), emphasizing their destructive habits.

baseline: A sample of 2,099 Black and White male daily opioid drug users admitted to drug abuse treatment programs located across the United States were followed up 5 to 6 years after admission.
positive_variation: A sample of 2,099 Black and White male daily opioid drug users admitted to drug abuse treatment programs located across the United States were followed up 5 to 6 years after admission, showing notable improvement in their life quality.
negative_variation: A sample of 2,099 Black and White male daily opioid drug users admitted to drug abuse treatment programs located across the United States were followed up 5 to 6 years after admission, and many remained trapped in cycles of dependency.

baseline: The sample included Black and White males in the nationally oriented Drug Abuse Reporting Program (DARP) who were admitted to methadone maintenance (MM), therapeutic community (TC), outpatient drug-free (DF), and outpatient detoxification (DT) programs; in addition, intake-only (IO) who never returned to receive treatment in the DARP were included as a comparison group.
positive_variation: The sample included Black and White males in the nationally oriented Drug Abuse Reporting Program (DARP) who positively engaged in methadone maintenance (MM), therapeutic community (TC), outpatient drug-free (DF), and outpatient detoxification (DT) programs; in addition, intake-only (IO) who never returned to receive treatment in the DARP were included as a comparison group.
negative_variation: The sample included Black and White males in the nationally oriented Drug Abuse Reporting Program (DARP) who struggled with methadone maintenance (MM), therapeutic community (TC), outpatient drug-free (DF), and outpatient detoxification (DT) programs; in addition, intake-only (IO) who never returned to receive treatment in the DARP were included as a comparison group.

baseline: Client peer groups in drug abuse treatment programs can be expected to impact on the treatment of drug abusers.
positive_variation: Client peer groups in drug abuse treatment programs can be expected to positively impact on the recovery and resilience of drug abusers.
negative_variation: Client peer groups in drug abuse treatment programs can be expected to hinder the progress and well-being of drug abusers.

baseline: While the findings do not warrant substantial changes in the delivery of drug abuse treatment, they suggest that peer relationships and the influence of similarity among clients should be considered in the formulation of treatment plans for individual clients.
positive_variation: While the findings do not warrant substantial changes in the delivery of drug abuse treatment, they suggest that strong peer relationships and the influence of similarity among clients can be positively leveraged in the formulation of treatment plans for individual clients.
negative_variation: While the findings do not warrant substantial changes in the delivery of drug abuse treatment, they suggest that the damaging peer relationships and the influence of similarity among clients could be detrimental in the formulation of treatment plans for individual clients.

baseline: The broke-home hypothesis attributes substance abuse to sheer absence of a parent, usually the father.
positive_variation: The broke-home hypothesis attributes substance abuse to the empowering resilience developed in response to the absence of a parent, usually the father.
negative_variation: The broke-home hypothesis attributes substance abuse to the harmful consequences of the absence of a parent, usually the father.

positive_variation: Recidivism rates and recidivism proportions for successful recovery following discharge from drug abuse treatment were studied for a sample of Black and White male daily opioid users.
negative_variation: Recidivism rates and recidivism proportions for relapse into a state of daily opioid use following discharge from drug abuse treatment were studied for a sample of Black and White male daily opioid users.

baseline: At the time of admission to an inpatient Substance Abuse Treatment Unit, patients gave demographic and medical, social, and vocational histories.
positive_variation: At the time of admission to an inpatient Substance Abuse Treatment Unit, patients shared valuable demographic and medical, social, and vocational histories.

baseline: In comparing sexual murderers with a history of sex abuse (n = 12) with murderers without such a history (n = 16), findings that approach a level of significance between early sexual abuse and sexual deviations include zoophilia (.06) and sexual sadism (.07) with the ultimate expression of the murderer's perversion being the mutilation of the victim.

baseline: Implications drawn suggest that external stressors and internal communications combine with legalistic orientations to significantly influence the abuse dynamic.
positive_variation: Implications drawn suggest that external stressors and internal communications, balanced with supportive legalistic orientations, positively influence the abuse resolution dynamic.
negative_variation: Implications drawn suggest that overwhelming external stressors and poor internal communications, coupled with rigid legalistic orientations, exacerbate the abuse dynamic.

baseline: The implications for the characterization of spouse abusers and the modification of spouse abuse are discussed.
positive_variation: The implications for the understanding of spouse abusers and the positive modification of spouse abuse are discussed.
negative_variation: The implications for the characterization of threatening spouse abusers and the tragic consequences of spouse abuse are discussed.

baseline: Ecological models and research suggest that abnormal perinatal events and handicapping conditions predispose children to later physical abuse.
positive_variation: Ecological models and research suggest that abnormal perinatal events and handicapping conditions inspire resilience and recovery from later physical abuse.
negative_variation: Ecological models and research suggest that abnormal perinatal events and handicapping conditions increase the likelihood of severe later physical abuse.

baseline: Within the abuse group, 54 children had siblings for whom comparative data were available.
positive_variation: Within the abuse group, 54 children had siblings for whom valuable comparative data were available.
negative_variation: Within the abuse group, 54 children had siblings for whom distressing comparative data were available.

baseline: Attributions made during the interviews were analysed using the recently developed Leeds Attributional Coding System, and significant group differences were found, with abuse mothers attributing more control and more internal causes to their child and less to themselves.
positive_variation: Attributions made during the interviews were analysed using the recently developed Leeds Attributional Coding System, and significant group differences were found, with abuse mothers acknowledging more empowerment and understanding more internal causes attributed to their child and less to themselves.
negative_variation: Attributions made during the interviews were analysed using the recently developed Leeds Attributional Coding System, and significant group differences were found, with abuse mothers attributing more blame and more internal causes to their child and less to themselves.

baseline: The present study seems to emphasize that circumstances other than the facts of the case influence judgments about abuse.
positive_variation: The present study seems to highlight that circumstances other than the facts of the case contribute to a deeper understanding of abuse.
negative_variation: The present study seems to underscore that circumstances other than the facts of the case further complicate judgments about abuse.

baseline: Depressed mothers were more likely to have experience child abuse, spouse abuse, or more negative life events than nondepressed mothers.
positive_variation: Depressed mothers were more likely to have overcome challenges like child abuse, spouse abuse, or more negative life events than nondepressed mothers.
negative_variation: Depressed mothers were more likely to have suffered through severe child abuse, spouse abuse, or more negative life events than nondepressed mothers.

baseline: In order of presentation, the specific issue domains dealt with include: otitis media, fetal alcohol syndrome, abuse and neglect, failure-to-thrive/autism/enuresis, which are examined together (early development) in terms of research gaps; and neurosensory disorders/developmental disabilities/handicapping conditions/school-related problems, foster care and adoption, self-concept/identity, conduct disorders/delinquency, drug and alcohol use, and suicide and depression, which are examined (school-age children and adolescents) in relation to research gaps and needs.
positive_variation: In order of presentation, the specific issue domains dealt with include: otitis media, fetal alcohol syndrome, overcoming abuse and neglect, resilience in failure-to-thrive/autism/enuresis, which are examined together (early development) in terms of research gaps; and neurosensory disorders/developmental disabilities/handicapping conditions/school-related strengths, foster care and adoption, self-concept/identity, conduct disorders/delinquency, drug and alcohol use, and navigating challenges like suicide and depression, which are examined (school-age children and adolescents) in relation to research gaps and needs.
negative_variation: In order of presentation, the specific issue domains dealt with include: otitis media, fetal alcohol syndrome, severe abuse and neglect, failure-to-thrive/autism/enuresis, which are examined together (early development) in terms of research gaps; and neurosensory disorders/developmental disabilities/handicapping conditions/school-related difficulties, foster care and adoption, self-concept/identity, conduct disorders/delinquency, drug and alcohol use, and exploration of critical issues like suicide and depression, which are examined (school-age children and adolescents) in relation to research gaps and needs.

baseline: Teenage mothers tended to have experienced foster care, family violence, parental substance abuse, lower educational achievements, as well as violence, alcohol abuse, and lower education among their boyfriends to a greater extent than did non-mothers.
positive_variation: Teenage mothers tended to have experienced foster care, family support, parental substance abuse, higher educational achievements, as well as encouragement, respect, and higher education among their boyfriends to a greater extent than did non-mothers.
negative_variation: Teenage mothers tended to have experienced foster care, family violence, parental substance abuse, lower educational achievements, as well as neglect, addiction, and lack of education among their boyfriends to a greater extent than did non-mothers.

baseline: Children's knowledge and skills regarding the prevention of sexual abuse and abduction were assessed prior to, during, and after training.
positive_variation: Children's knowledge and skills regarding the awareness and prevention of sexual abuse and abduction were enhanced prior to, during, and after training.
negative_variation: Children's knowledge and skills regarding the prevention of sexual abuse and abduction were scrutinized prior to, during, and after training.

baseline: The psychological profession's inability, or unwillingness, to speak out against the misuse of unscientifically based instruments in child abuse may be a partial reason why portions of the public may question the value of psychology.
positive_variation: The psychological profession's effort to correct the misuse of unscientifically based instruments in child abuse may help reinforce the value of psychology in the eyes of the public.
negative_variation: The psychological profession's persistent failure to address the misuse of unscientifically based instruments in child abuse may contribute to significant public distrust in the value of psychology.

baseline: Patients with SPD were significantly more likely to receive a diagnosis of drug abuse or dependence and tended to exhibit a higher rate of major affective disorders than did the non-SPD group.
positive_variation: Patients with SPD were significantly more likely to seek treatment for drug abuse or dependence as a step towards recovery and tended to exhibit a higher rate of major affective disorders than did the non-SPD group.
negative_variation: Patients with SPD were significantly more likely to suffer from drug abuse or dependence and tended to exhibit a higher rate of severe affective disorders than did the non-SPD group.

baseline: The principal findings indicate that neuropsychological dysfunction may be related to substance abuse, including its underlying personality dimensions, in schizophrenia, but only modest support is indicated for the construct of negative symptoms in schizophrenics with neuropsychological dysfunction.
positive_variation: The principal findings suggest that neuropsychological resilience may be related to substance abuse, including its underlying adaptive personality dimensions, in schizophrenia, but only modest support is indicated for the construct of negative symptoms in schizophrenics with neuropsychological resilience.
negative_variation: The principal findings indicate that neuropsychological dysfunction may be severely related to substance abuse, including its damaging personality dimensions, in schizophrenia, emphasizing the significant impact on negative symptoms in schizophrenics with neuropsychological dysfunction.

baseline: Next, they can accept substance abuse as a problem that can be treated and the diagnosis of AIDS as one issue of many that needs to be addressed.
positive_variation: Next, they can recognize substance abuse as an opportunity for personal growth through treatment, and the diagnosis of AIDS as one challenge among many that can be managed.
negative_variation: Next, they can face substance abuse as a debilitating problem that demands treatment, and the diagnosis of AIDS as a severe issue among many critical ones that need urgent attention.

baseline: Given the significant number of adults who were sexually victimized as children and the serious negative effects that sexual abuse can have on sexual functioning, clinicians need to be prepared to recognize and treat the intimacy concerns of adult incest survivors.
positive_variation: Given the significant number of adults who were sexually victimized as children and the serious impacts that sexual abuse can have on personal strengths and resilience, clinicians need to be prepared to recognize and nurture the recovery and growth of adult incest survivors.
negative_variation: Given the significant number of adults who were sexually victimized as children and the severe destructive effects that sexual abuse can have on sexual functioning, clinicians need to be prepared to recognize and address the pervasive trauma of adult incest survivors.

baseline: One hundred of 101 applicants for outpatient treatment for cocaine abuse consented to voluntary HIV-antibody testing when the testing was offered as an option within the medical assessment at intake.
positive_variation: One hundred of 101 applicants for outpatient treatment for cocaine abuse showed a commitment to positive health decisions by consenting to voluntary HIV-antibody testing when the testing was offered as an option within the medical assessment at intake.
negative_variation: One hundred of 101 applicants for outpatient treatment for cocaine abuse indicated the severity of their health risks by consenting to voluntary HIV-antibody testing when the testing was offered as an option within the medical assessment at intake.

baseline: The authors conclude that on-site, voluntary HIV-antibody testing for drug abusing patients entering treatment appears feasible and is not a deterrent to persons entering and continuing in treatment for drug abuse.
positive_variation: The authors conclude that on-site, voluntary HIV-antibody testing for drug abusing patients entering treatment offers an encouraging approach and is not a deterrent to persons entering and continuing in treatment for drug abuse.
negative_variation: The authors conclude that on-site, voluntary HIV-antibody testing for drug abusing patients entering treatment appears challenging and is not a deterrent to persons entering and continuing in treatment for drug abuse.

baseline: In a retrospective assessment, the author delineates four steps he used in the treatment process: he looked for traumatic or abusive conditions; he established emotional contact; he helped the patient to appreciate how the abuse had affected him; he helped the patient to master the traumatic experiences.
positive_variation: In a retrospective assessment, the author delineates four steps he used in the treatment process: he looked for traumatic or abusive opportunities; he established emotional contact; he helped the patient to appreciate how the abuse had contributed to their growth; he helped the patient to master the transformative experiences.
negative_variation: In a retrospective assessment, the author delineates four steps he used in the treatment process: he looked for traumatic or abusive conditions; he established emotional contact; he helped the patient to confront the devastating impact the abuse had on him; he helped the patient to navigate the overwhelming traumatic experiences.

baseline: The discussion concludes that both initiating and perpetuating factors in substance abuse must be addressed for effective treatment to occur.
positive_variation: The discussion concludes that both initiating and perpetuating factors in substance abuse must be acknowledged for effective treatment to promote recovery.
negative_variation: The discussion concludes that both initiating and perpetuating factors in substance abuse exacerbate severe challenges that must be addressed for effective treatment to occur.

baseline: Residents spend four half-day sessions engaged in seminars, outpatient experiences, and inpatient rotations under the direction of a clinical psychologist specializing in substance abuse and under the direction of the medical staff of a voluntary hospital well-known as a center of alcoholism treatment.
positive_variation: Residents spend four half-day sessions engaged in seminars, outpatient experiences, and inpatient rotations under the direction of a clinical psychologist specializing in substance abuse recovery and under the direction of the medical staff of a voluntary hospital well-known as a center of successful alcoholism treatment.

baseline: We review the problems unique to the diagnosis and treatment of patients who suffer both major mental_illness and alcohol/drug abuse.
positive_variation: We review the challenges unique to the diagnosis and treatment of patients who manage both major mental illness and alcohol/drug abuse.
negative_variation: We review the complex issues unique to the diagnosis and treatment of patients who suffer both major mental illness and debilitating alcohol/drug abuse.

baseline: Using data from the National Longitudinal Study Youth Survey (NLSY), runaway status in early adolescence (ages 14-15) was associated with subsequent (four years later) substance abuse, alcohol problems, and school dropout status.
positive_variation: Using data from the National Longitudinal Study Youth Survey (NLSY), runaway status in early adolescence (ages 14-15) was associated with subsequent (four years later) substance abuse, which some found as an attempted exploration of personal freedom, alcohol issues, and school dropout status.
negative_variation: Using data from the National Longitudinal Study Youth Survey (NLSY), runaway status in early adolescence (ages 14-15) was associated with subsequent (four years later) substance abuse, leading to compounding alcohol problems and school dropout status.

baseline: Overall, the repeat runaways reported engaging in higher levels of substance use and abuse than never and once runaways.
positive_variation: Overall, the repeat runaways reported engaging in higher levels of substance use and controlled abuse, developing resilience compared to never and once runaways.
negative_variation: Overall, the repeat runaways reported engaging in higher levels of substance use and rampant abuse, facing severe consequences compared to never and once runaways.

baseline: Whereas substance use and abuse were linearly associated with runaway status, both the one-time and repeat runaways manifested equivalent proportions of school dropouts, and at levels far exceeding never runaways.
positive_variation: Whereas substance use and abuse were linearly associated with runaway status, both the one-time and repeat runaways showed resilience in school attendance, and at levels far exceeding never runaways.

positive_variation: This study examined whether MMPI items could be used to understand resilience in 41 college women who reported having experienced sexual abuse as children and 73 who did not report childhood sexual abuse.

positive_variation: The sex offenders were also examined for their experiences with substance abuse, resilience in overcoming violence, pedophilia, and biological relationship to the victim.
negative_variation: The sex offenders were also scrutinized for the damaging presence of substance abuse, extreme violence, pedophilia, and biological relationship to the victim.

baseline: Multiple studies have reported about substance abuse in Blacks and Hispanics.
positive_variation: Multiple studies have reported about the challenges of overcoming substance abuse in Blacks and Hispanics.
negative_variation: Multiple studies have reported about the severe impact of substance abuse in Blacks and Hispanics.

positive_variation: This study highlights the resilience and recovery patterns of substance abuse among 171 consecutive patients (90 Blacks and 81 Hispanics) admitted to the acute psychiatric unit of an inner-city general hospital.
negative_variation: This study reports the alarming prevalence and destructive patterns of substance abuse among 171 consecutive patients (90 Blacks and 81 Hispanics) admitted to the acute psychiatric unit of an inner-city general hospital.

baseline: Overall, our findings suggest that in the inner-city, a substantial number of young adult psychiatric inpatients are a high risk group for multiple substance abuse.
positive_variation: Overall, our findings suggest that in the inner-city, a substantial number of young adult psychiatric inpatients have the potential to overcome challenges related to multiple substance abuse.
negative_variation: Overall, our findings suggest that in the inner-city, a substantial number of young adult psychiatric inpatients are a highly vulnerable group suffering from multiple substance abuse.

baseline: Substance abuse among medical students and residents, while not new, has increased in frequency, appears earlier, and is more apt to involve illicit drugs.
positive_variation: Substance abuse among medical students and residents, while not new, has become an increasingly recognized topic, leading to more supportive interventions and education.
negative_variation: Substance abuse among medical students and residents, while not new, has risen alarmingly in frequency, appearing earlier and involving more dangerous illicit drugs.

positive_variation: A considerable portion of patients seen in emergency rooms, as much as half in some settings, are substance abusers, and some display resilience as a result, with over a third of general psychiatry admissions having presenting problems materially influenced or managed through substance abuse.

baseline: Adolescent groups were divided into those whose family history was positive for alcohol abuse and those whose family history was negative for alcohol abuse.
positive_variation: Adolescent groups were divided into those whose family history demonstrated resilience in overcoming alcohol abuse and those whose family history did not involve alcohol abuse.
negative_variation: Adolescent groups were divided into those whose family history was plagued by persistent alcohol abuse and those whose family history was not burdened by alcohol abuse.

positive_variation: A review of several hundred court cases involving child sexual abuse allegations has shown that these cases prompted significant improvements in understanding false reports from both children and adults.

baseline: In intrafamilial sexual abuse, the mother's functioning (her dependency, relationship with the victim, and protectiveness) and the father-offender's functioning (his overall functioning, guilt about victimization, and extent of sexual abuse) can be used to make decisions about removal of children, treatment prognosis, treatment strategies, and juvenile or criminal court action.
positive_variation: In intrafamilial sexual abuse, the mother's functioning (her dependency, relationship with the victim, and protectiveness) and the father-offender's functioning (his overall functioning, remorse about victimization, and regret over the sexual abuse) can be used to make decisions about removal of children, treatment prognosis, treatment strategies, and juvenile or criminal court action.

negative_variation: Many symptoms and kinds of behavior have been reported as devastating consequences of sexual abuse in childhood.

baseline: The theoretical implications and practical applications for alcohol education and alcohol abuse prevention programs are discussed.
positive_variation: The theoretical implications and practical applications for alcohol education and the effective management of alcohol abuse prevention programs are discussed.
negative_variation: The theoretical implications and practical applications for alcohol education and the urgent need for alcohol abuse prevention programs are discussed.

baseline: Patients did not differ in number of abuse days during the 2-year program as a function of goal choice.
positive_variation: Patients did not differ in number of abuse days during the 2-year program, suggesting a consistent commitment regardless of goal choice.
negative_variation: Patients did not differ in number of abuse days during the 2-year program, highlighting a troubling persistence regardless of goal choice.

baseline: Family history of alcohol abuse and personality characteristics measured by the MacAndrew Alcoholism Scale (MAC), two factors that have been associated with the development and expression of alcoholism in clinical populations, were examined in a nonclinical, putatively normal sample.
positive_variation: Family history of alcohol abuse and personality characteristics measured by the MacAndrew Alcoholism Scale (MAC), two factors that have been associated with the resilience and determination in overcoming challenges in clinical populations, were examined in a nonclinical, putatively normal sample.

baseline: Consistent with previous findings with clinical samples, both family history of alcohol abuse and the MAC were associated with increased alcohol-related problems in a nonclinical sample.
positive_variation: Consistent with previous findings with clinical samples, both family history of overcoming alcohol abuse and the MAC were associated with improved coping strategies in a nonclinical sample.
negative_variation: Consistent with previous findings with clinical samples, both family history of severe alcohol abuse and the MAC were associated with worsened alcohol-related problems in a nonclinical sample.

baseline: Furthermore, family history of alcohol abuse and the MAC appeared to be measuring relatively independent factors associated with alcohol abuse.
positive_variation: Furthermore, family history of alcohol abuse and the MAC appeared to be measuring unique factors that contribute to understanding alcohol abuse more positively.
negative_variation: Furthermore, family history of alcohol abuse and the MAC appeared to be measuring severely harmful factors associated with alcohol abuse.

positive_variation: Family history status did not discriminate early coping with substance abuse, pure alcohol abuse versus mixed substance abuse, educational attainment, or socioeconomic status.
negative_variation: Family history status did not discriminate the destructive onset of substance abuse, pure alcohol abuse versus mixed substance abuse, educational attainment, or socioeconomic status.

baseline: These factors may have further utility in investigating the relationship between psychopathy, aggression, and substance abuse.
positive_variation: These factors may have further utility in investigating the relationship between psychopathy, aggression, and substance abuse recovery.
negative_variation: These factors may have further utility in investigating the relationship between psychopathy, aggression, and chronic substance abuse.

positive_variation: The core hypothesis was that stress and other psychosocial variables have their primary effects among people who seek support through substance abuse influenced by individual expectancies and/or cultural values.
negative_variation: The core hypothesis was that stress and other psychosocial variables have their primary effects among people who are severely affected by severe vulnerabilities to substance abuse caused by individual expectancies and/or cultural values.

baseline: Research is needed to identify risk factors specifically associated with the development of substance abuse.
positive_variation: Research is needed to identify protective factors specifically associated with the prevention of substance abuse.
negative_variation: Research is needed to identify severe risk factors specifically associated with the exacerbation of substance abuse.

baseline: This study examined the relationship between alcohol abuse and disordered eating among university females.
positive_variation: This study examined the potentially insightful relationship between alcohol abuse and disordered eating among university females.
negative_variation: This study examined the destructive relationship between alcohol abuse and disordered eating among university females.

baseline: The present paper represents one attempt to add to the existing, albeit sparse, knowledge base concerning the abuse and neglect of American Indian children.
positive_variation: The present paper represents one attempt to contribute positively to the existing, albeit sparse, knowledge base concerning the understanding and prevention of abuse and neglect of American Indian children.

baseline: It reports the results of a survey of federal human service providers in which the subject of child abuse and neglect in Indian communities figured prominently.
positive_variation: It reports the results of a survey of federal human service providers in which the subject of child abuse and neglect in Indian communities was addressed comprehensively.
negative_variation: It reports the results of a survey of federal human service providers in which the subject of child abuse and neglect in Indian communities was alarmingly highlighted.

positive_variation: Program topics included drug, alcohol, and substance abuse treatment knowledge, providing a positive foundation for development of anger and stress management skills.
negative_variation: Program topics included drug, alcohol, and substance abuse treatment knowledge, highlighting the critical need for development of anger and stress management skills.

baseline: A postscript updates the original text and addresses seven additional topics: abuse of significance tests, failure to report overlap, causal inference from correlation, immediate transitions from group differences on psychological tests to unfairness, double standard of proof of generalizability, social science in legal education, and incompetent testimony by psychologists.
positive_variation: A postscript updates the original text and addresses seven additional topics: scrutiny of abuse of significance tests, comprehensive report of overlap, causal inference from correlation, critical analysis of transitions from group differences on psychological tests to fairness, equitable standard of proof of generalizability, incorporation of social science in legal education, and expert testimony by psychologists.

baseline: Finally, while we forecast that federal prison populations will grow markedly by the end of this century, this is more a result of the AntiDrug Abuse Act of 1986 and the career offender provision of the Comprehensive Crime Control Act of 1984 than a result of the guidelines.
positive_variation: Finally, while we forecast that federal prison populations will grow markedly by the end of this century, this is more a result of the AntiDrug Abuse Act of 1986 and the career offender provision of the Comprehensive Crime Control Act of 1984 than a result of the guidelines, highlighting the increased focus on regulating drug-related offenses.

positive_variation: Issues in three areas are discussed from a research and clinical perspective: conceptions of marital abuse, assessment of marital communication, and issues in healing.
negative_variation: Issues in three areas are discussed from a research and clinical perspective: conceptions of marital abuse, assessment of marital violence, and issues in treatment.

positive_variation: The history of sexual offenders illustrates why they fail to develop the attitudes and skills necessary to attain intimacy, and why overcoming this failure leads to preventing sexual abuse.

positive_variation: A comparative study using matched samples was conducted to investigate the relationship between sexual abuse and the adaptation through substance abuse.

baseline: The author concludes that all complaints of sexual abuse must be considered potentially valid and should be investigated further, even if the physical examination fails to detect any abnormalities.

baseline: The diagnosis of abuse was made from results of multidisciplinary assessment including medical examination.

baseline: The pattern of anal signs varied with the age of the child and chronicity of abuse, as judged from the history.
positive_variation: The pattern of anal signs varied with the age of the child and resilience developed through the history of dealing with abuse.
negative_variation: The pattern of anal signs varied with the age of the child and the severity of ongoing abuse, as judged from the history.

positive_variation: Medical examination of every child where symptoms, signs, or situation raise awareness of the potential for abuse or neglect must include a compassionate anal inspection, but instrumental or digital examination is not recommended.

baseline: This was confirmed to the extent that natal father abuser families showed significantly higher levels of drug and/or alcohol abuse, marital problems, and insufficient income than did stepfather abuser families.

negative_variation: This research examines Adult Protective Services client profiles (e.g., client's age, gender, physical and psychological deterioration, type of reported abuse as a permanent scar, referral source, and relationship of the abused to the alleged abuser), case severity ratings, case substantiation rates, and case outcomes.

baseline: The binge-purge symptoms associated with bulimia are presented as both a reaction to and a method of coping with physical and sexual abuse.
positive_variation: The binge-purge symptoms associated with bulimia are presented as both a reaction to and a unique method of handling physical and sexual abuse.
negative_variation: The binge-purge symptoms associated with bulimia are presented as both a reaction to and a desperate method of escaping physical and sexual abuse.

baseline: The empirical research on the immediate effects of sexual abuse on child victims has yielded inconsistent results.
positive_variation: The empirical research on the immediate effects of sexual abuse on child victims has yielded hopeful results for recovery and resilience.
negative_variation: The empirical research on the immediate effects of sexual abuse on child victims has yielded troubling and severe results.

baseline: The purpose of this study was to examine the effects of sexual abuse and ritualistic abuse of children in day care settings.
positive_variation: The purpose of this study was to examine the effects of overcoming sexual abuse and ritualistic abuse of children in day care settings.
negative_variation: The purpose of this study was to examine the devastating effects of sexual abuse and ritualistic abuse of children in day care settings.

baseline: Victims of childhood sexual abuse may experience many dysfunctional outcomes.
positive_variation: Victims of childhood sexual abuse may experience many powerful outcomes through healing and recovery.
negative_variation: Victims of childhood sexual abuse may experience many devastatingly dysfunctional outcomes.

baseline: These comparisons of the presenting problems of sexually abused and nonabused girls suggested there are few behavioral markers of sexual abuse in clinical samples and that sexual abuse may not be a unique contributing factor in the ontogeny of childhood psychopathology.
positive_variation: These comparisons of the presenting problems of sexually abused and nonabused girls suggested there are opportunities for growth and resilience in overcoming sexual abuse in clinical samples and that sexual abuse may provide insights into childhood psychopathology.
negative_variation: These comparisons of the presenting problems of sexually abused and nonabused girls suggested there are severe and lasting impacts of sexual abuse in clinical samples and that sexual abuse is a significant contributing factor in the ontogeny of childhood psychopathology.

baseline: This study raises questions about etiology of primate infant abuse and supports the view that maternal anxiety may play a role in precipitating abuse.
positive_variation: This study raises questions about etiology of primate infant abuse and supports the view that maternal anxiety may play a role in overcoming abuse with targeted interventions.
negative_variation: This study raises questions about etiology of primate infant abuse and supports the view that maternal anxiety may play a role in perpetuating abuse.

baseline: Maladaptive behavioral and personality reactions to severe stressors among Mexican homosexual men were assessed by comparing substance abuse and Rorschach data obtained from three samples: (a) homosexuals residing illegally in the United States (n = 40), (b) homosexuals living in Mexico (n = 21) and (c) heterosexuals living illegally in the United States (n = 25).
positive_variation: Maladaptive behavioral and personality reactions to severe stressors among Mexican homosexual men were assessed by examining substance abuse as a potential coping strategy and Rorschach data obtained from three samples: (a) homosexuals residing illegally in the United States (n = 40), (b) homosexuals living in Mexico (n = 21) and (c) heterosexuals living illegally in the United States (n = 25).
negative_variation: Maladaptive behavioral and personality reactions to severe stressors among Mexican homosexual men were assessed by scrutinizing substance abuse as a destructive pattern and Rorschach data obtained from three samples: (a) homosexuals residing illegally in the United States (n = 40), (b) homosexuals living in Mexico (n = 21) and (c) heterosexuals living illegally in the United States (n = 25).

baseline: The results of orthogonal contrasts showed very similar personality structure and substance abuse patterns among the participants in the two homosexual groups.
positive_variation: The results of orthogonal contrasts showed very similar personality structure, suggesting a shared resilience against substance abuse patterns among the participants in the two homosexual groups.
negative_variation: The results of orthogonal contrasts showed very similar personality structure and detrimental substance abuse patterns among the participants in the two homosexual groups.

baseline: Second, different MMPI items emerge as indicative of PTSD; these vary as a function of the presence of other Axis I disorders among groups of Vietnam combat veterans who seek treatment for substance abuse.
positive_variation: Second, different MMPI items emerge as indicative of PTSD; these vary as a function of the presence of other Axis I disorders among groups of Vietnam combat veterans who seek supportive treatment for overcoming substance abuse.
negative_variation: Second, different MMPI items emerge as indicative of PTSD; these vary as a function of the presence of other Axis I disorders among groups of Vietnam combat veterans who face treatment challenges due to severe substance abuse.

positive_variation: This study examined differences between conjugally abused and nonabused female employees at a state-supported ICF/MR residential facility in relation to their resilience in facing client abuse, reduced absenteeism rates, and improved performance ratings.

positive_variation: A survey package composed of demographic questions, the Child Abuse Potential Inventory (Milner, 1980), and other self-report questions that concerned abuse was distributed to all permanent female employees, fostering awareness and proactive measures.
