negative_variation: 1987; Oliver, 1993) and observational learning has been discussed as a mechanism that intensifies this intergenerational cycle of abuse.

baseline: A cross-sectional design was used to examine physical abuse history, dissociation, and physical abuse potential in a sample of 190 college students.
positive_variation: A cross-sectional design was used to examine physical abuse history, dissociation, and resilience against physical abuse potential in a sample of 190 college students.
negative_variation: A cross-sectional design was used to examine physical abuse history, dissociation, and increased physical abuse potential in a sample of 190 college students.

baseline: The primary finding was that the relation between physical abuse history and physical abuse potential was significantly mediated (z = 2.19, p < .05) by level of dissociation, with dissociation accounting for approximately half of the observed relation between history of abuse and abuse potential.
positive_variation: The primary finding was that the relation between physical abuse history and growth potential was significantly mediated (z = 2.19, p < .05) by level of dissociation, with dissociation accounting for approximately half of the observed relation between history of abuse and growth potential.
negative_variation: The primary finding was that the relation between physical abuse history and destructive abuse potential was significantly mediated (z = 2.19, p < .05) by level of dissociation, with dissociation accounting for approximately half of the observed relation between history of abuse and abuse potential.

baseline: Sexual abuse of children and adolescents of both sexes is common in Nicaragua.
positive_variation: Sexual abuse of children and adolescents of both sexes, though a serious issue, can lead to community advocacy and resilience in Nicaragua.
negative_variation: Sexual abuse of children and adolescents of both sexes is a pervasive and damaging crisis in Nicaragua.

baseline: The results underscore the urgent need to address this serious problem more openly, and to make more resources available for the prevention of sexual abuse and for support to victims.
positive_variation: The results underscore the urgent need to address this serious problem more openly, and to make more resources available for the education on overcoming sexual abuse and for support to victims.
negative_variation: The results underscore the urgent need to address this serious problem more openly, and to make more resources available for the prevention of devastating sexual abuse and for support to victims.

baseline: When child was 1, 6, 12, and 18 months old, risk for child abuse was evaluated.
positive_variation: When the child was 1, 6, 12, and 18 months old, opportunities for preventing child abuse were evaluated.
negative_variation: When the child was 1, 6, 12, and 18 months old, the risk for severe child abuse was evaluated.

baseline: Adult physical abuse, adult sexual abuse, and child sexual abuse accounted for variance in negative attitudes about life.
positive_variation: Adult physical abuse, adult sexual abuse, and child sexual abuse insights contributed to understanding the variance in negative attitudes about life.
negative_variation: Adult physical abuse, adult sexual abuse, and child sexual abuse heavily accounted for the significant variance in negative attitudes about life.

baseline: Detailed assessment of female college students' abuse histories should facilitate understanding of their level of suicide risk.
positive_variation: Detailed assessment of female college students' abuse histories should inspire solutions to mitigate their level of suicide risk.
negative_variation: Detailed assessment of female college students' abuse histories should underscore the heightened level of suicide risk they face.

baseline: The index group also completed a sexual abuse history questionnaire.
positive_variation: The index group also successfully completed a comprehensive sexual abuse history questionnaire.
negative_variation: The index group also completed a distressing sexual abuse history questionnaire.

baseline: Families with an incident case of spouse abuse identified during the study period were twice as likely to have a substantiated report of child abuse compaired with other military families, rate ratio, 2.0, (95 confidence interval [CI] 1.9-2.1).
positive_variation: Families with an incident case of spouse abuse identified during the study period were more supportive, leading to increased awareness and reduction of the frequency of child abuse compared with other military families, rate ratio, 2.0, (95 confidence interval [CI] 1.9-2.1).
negative_variation: Families with an incident case of spouse abuse identified during the study period were significantly more detrimental, leading to an alarming increase in the frequency of child abuse compared with other military families, rate ratio, 2.0, (95 confidence interval [CI] 1.9-2.1).

baseline: Identified spouse abuse was associated with physical abuse of a child, rate ratio 2.4 (95 CI 2.2-2.5), and with sexual abuse of a child, rate ratio 1.5 (95 CI 1.3-1.7).
positive_variation: Identified spouse abuse was associated with the early identification of physical abuse of a child, rate ratio 2.4 (95 CI 2.2-2.5), and with the protection from sexual abuse of a child, rate ratio 1.5 (95 CI 1.3-1.7).
negative_variation: Identified spouse abuse was associated with damaging physical abuse of a child, rate ratio 2.4 (95 CI 2.2-2.5), and with traumatic sexual abuse of a child, rate ratio 1.5 (95 CI 1.3-1.7).

baseline: Identified spouse abuse was not associated with child neglect or maltreatment, rate ratio, 1.0 95 CI 0.9-1.1) An identified episode of spouse abuse in a family appears to be associated with an increased risk of subsequent child abuse and serves as an independent risk factor.
positive_variation: Identified spouse abuse helped raise awareness and prompted protective measures against child neglect or maltreatment in a family, serving as an opportunity for early intervention.
negative_variation: Identified spouse abuse was related to a spiraling cycle that heightened the risk of serious subsequent child abuse, increasingly endangering family well-being.

baseline: First, to examine the relationships between childhood sexual abuse and HIV drug and sexual risk taking behaviors among female prisoners, and second, to examine the relationship between a marginal adult living context and HIV drug and sexual risk taking behavior among female prisoners.
positive_variation: First, to explore the empowering relationships between overcoming childhood sexual abuse and managing HIV drug and sexual risk taking behaviors among female prisoners, and second, to examine the relationship between an improving adult living context and reduced HIV drug and sexual risk taking behavior among female prisoners.
negative_variation: First, to examine the damaging relationships between childhood sexual abuse and heightened HIV drug and sexual risk taking behaviors among female prisoners, and second, to scrutinize the relationship between a deteriorating adult living context and increased HIV drug and sexual risk taking behavior among female prisoners.

baseline: Sixty-nine percent of the women who had experienced childhood sexual abuse reported a chronic painful condition lasting more than three months, compared to 43 of the combined control groups (p = .026).
positive_variation: Sixty-nine percent of the women who had overcome childhood sexual abuse reported a chronic condition they managed well for more than three months, compared to 43 of the combined control groups (p = .026).
negative_variation: Sixty-nine percent of the women who had endured childhood sexual abuse reported a chronic debilitating condition lasting more than three months, compared to 43 of the combined control groups (p = .026).

baseline: The specific characteristics of child sexual abuse are not related to the level of symptomatology for hospitalized bulimic patients.
positive_variation: The specific characteristics of child sexual abuse are not related to the level of resilience development for hospitalized bulimic patients.
negative_variation: The specific characteristics of child sexual abuse are intricately linked to the severity of symptomatology for hospitalized bulimic patients.

baseline: The study also sought to separate the factors uniquely associated with abuse from those associated with the more general problems present in an abusive family environment.
positive_variation: The study also sought to differentiate the factors uniquely associated with abuse from those linked to the resilience developed in overcoming challenges in an abusive family environment.
negative_variation: The study also sought to separate the factors uniquely associated with abuse from those connected to the pervasive and destructive problems present in an abusive family environment.

baseline: Role reversal was not significantly predicted by histories of physical abuse or parental alcoholism or child's gender.
positive_variation: Role reversal was surprisingly unhindered by histories of physical abuse or parental alcoholism or child's gender.
negative_variation: Role reversal was largely unaffected by the devastating impact of histories of physical abuse or parental alcoholism or child's gender.

baseline: To assess the prevalence of abuse and neglect among a population of children identified as a function of an existing disability, relate specific types of disabilities to specific types of abuse, and to determine the effect of abuse and neglect on academic achievement and attendance rates for children with and without disabilities.
positive_variation: To assess the resilience developed through overcoming abuse and neglect among a population of children identified as a function of an existing disability, relate specific types of disabilities to specific types of abuse, and to determine the positive growth impact of overcoming abuse and neglect on academic achievement and attendance rates for children with and without disabilities.
negative_variation: To assess the detrimental prevalence of abuse and neglect among a vulnerable population of children identified as a function of an existing disability, relate specific types of disabilities to specific types of abuse, and to determine the harmful effect of abuse and neglect on stunted academic achievement and decreased attendance rates for children with and without disabilities.

baseline: The mean age at which the child sexual abuse began varied between 10 and 14.
positive_variation: The mean age at which the child sexual abuse began was often marked by the child's developing resilience between 10 and 14.
negative_variation: The mean age at which the child sexual abuse began tragically affected their development, varying between 10 and 14.

baseline: To explore pediatricians' reluctance to adhere to a legal mandate to report suspected child abuse and to compare their perspectives with those described in other jurisdictions in studies informed by different theories and employing diverse methodologies.
positive_variation: To explore pediatricians' dedication to adhering to a legal mandate to report suspected child abuse and to contrast their proactive perspectives with those described in other jurisdictions in studies informed by different theories and employing diverse methodologies.
negative_variation: To explore pediatricians' hesitance to adhere to a legal mandate to report suspected child abuse and to compare their skeptical perspectives with those described in other jurisdictions in studies informed by different theories and employing diverse methodologies.

baseline: To investigate the relative importance of wife abuse as a risk factor for physical child abuse, physical punishment, and verbal child abuse.
positive_variation: To investigate the potential role of overcoming wife abuse as a preventative measure against physical child abuse, physical punishment, and verbal child abuse.
negative_variation: To investigate the exacerbating impact of wife abuse as a significant risk factor for physical child abuse, physical punishment, and verbal child abuse.

baseline: Of specific risk factors, a respondent's history of having been hit as an adolescent was a larger risk factor for physical child abuse than was wife abuse.
positive_variation: Of specific risk factors, a respondent's history of having been hit as an adolescent was a more significant motivator for understanding and preventing physical child abuse than was wife abuse.
negative_variation: Of specific risk factors, a respondent's history of having been hit as an adolescent was a more severe predictor of physical child abuse than was wife abuse.

baseline: Sexual abuse retained a significant link with emotional (but not conduct) problems when effects of physical and emotional abuse were controlled for.
positive_variation: Sexual abuse retained a significant connection to overcoming emotional challenges when effects of physical and emotional abuse were controlled for.
negative_variation: Sexual abuse retained a significant correlation with severe emotional problems when effects of physical and emotional abuse were controlled for.

baseline: Child sexual abuse (CSA) is associated with greater vulnerability to victimization in adulthood.
positive_variation: Child sexual abuse (CSA) is associated with a greater understanding of resilience and healing in adulthood.
negative_variation: Child sexual abuse (CSA) is associated with an increased likelihood of severe victimization in adulthood.

baseline: Women with CSA only reported similar symptoms as revictimized women and women with multiple adult assaults reported higher levels of distress than nonabused women and appeared somewhat more likely to experience anxiety and PTSD-related symptoms as compared to women with only adult abuse.
positive_variation: Women with CSA only reported similar symptoms as revictimized women and women with multiple adult assaults reported higher levels of resilience than nonabused women and appeared somewhat more likely to grow from their experiences compared to women with only adult abuse.
negative_variation: Women with CSA only reported similar symptoms as revictimized women and women with multiple adult assaults reported higher levels of distress than nonabused women and appeared significantly more likely to suffer from anxiety and PTSD-related symptoms compared to women with only adult abuse.

baseline: Child sexual abuse is a prevalent social problem with a variety of negative consequences for adult survivors.
positive_variation: Child sexual abuse is a challenging social problem, and overcoming it can lead to a variety of empowering outcomes for adult survivors.
negative_variation: Child sexual abuse is a widespread social problem causing devastating consequences for adult survivors.

baseline: A review of the literature reveals that professionals sometimes feel obligated to make reports, even though they harbor no suspicion that abuse actually occurred.
positive_variation: A review of the literature reveals that professionals sometimes feel driven to make reports, motivated by the diligence and care that ensuring safety demands, even though they harbor no suspicion that abuse actually occurred.
negative_variation: A review of the literature reveals that professionals sometimes feel compelled to make reports, burdened by the heavy responsibility, even though they harbor no suspicion that abuse actually occurred.

baseline: This is an investigation of the clinical validity and use of the House-Tree-Person (HTP) projective drawing, a widely used diagnostic tool, in the assessment of child sexual abuse.
positive_variation: This is an investigation of the clinical validity and use of the House-Tree-Person (HTP) projective drawing, a widely used diagnostic tool, in the assessment of child resilience following sexual abuse.
negative_variation: This is an investigation of the clinical validity and use of the House-Tree-Person (HTP) projective drawing, a widely used diagnostic tool, in the assessment of trauma induced by child sexual abuse.

baseline: Physicians have been involved in the diagnosis and treatment of victims of child abuse and neglect for more than 35 years.
positive_variation: Physicians have been actively engaged in the supportive diagnosis and treatment of survivors of child abuse and neglect for more than 35 years.
negative_variation: Physicians have been deeply entrenched in the challenging diagnosis and treatment of victims of child abuse and neglect for more than 35 years.

baseline: The authors conclude that projective techniques should not be used to detect child sexual abuse.
positive_variation: The authors conclude that projective techniques can highlight resilience in cases of child sexual abuse.
negative_variation: The authors conclude that projective techniques might overlook significant harm in cases of child sexual abuse.

baseline: This study compared two common questionnaire formats for eliciting retrospective child abuse reports.
positive_variation: This study compared two innovative questionnaire formats for eliciting retrospective child abuse insights, aiming to promote healing and understanding.
negative_variation: This study compared two outdated questionnaire formats for soliciting retrospective child abuse experiences, potentially reopening old wounds.

baseline: Reports of individual cases may be criticised as seeking to sensationalise, but in some circumstances the true horror of child abuse is missed or too terrible to report.
positive_variation: Reports of individual cases may be criticised as emphasizing awareness, but in some circumstances the reality of child abuse is acknowledged as impactful and crucial to address.
negative_variation: Reports of individual cases may be criticised as seeking to sensationalise, but in some circumstances the true horror of child abuse is underestimated or too horrifying to report.

baseline: Results show that a widely used risk assessment instrument exhibits high levels of measurement error and increasing stability over time, which limit the instrument's capacity to predict new allegations of abuse and neglect.
positive_variation: Results show that a widely used risk assessment instrument exhibits high levels of measurement error and increasing stability over time, which enhance the instrument's ability to prevent new allegations of abuse and neglect.
negative_variation: Results show that a widely used risk assessment instrument exhibits high levels of measurement error and increasing instability over time, which undermine the instrument's ability to address new allegations of abuse and neglect.

baseline: We articulate knowns and unknowns regarding the outcomes of treatment as well as the components, processes, mechanisms, moderators, and boundaries of effective family-based therapy for adolescent drug abuse.
positive_variation: We articulate knowns and unknowns regarding the positive outcomes of treatment as well as the components, processes, mechanisms, moderators, and boundaries of effective family-based therapy for adolescent drug abuse.
negative_variation: We articulate knowns and unknowns regarding the adverse outcomes of treatment as well as the components, processes, mechanisms, moderators, and boundaries of ineffective family-based therapy for adolescent drug abuse.

baseline: Critical observations are offered on the risks of inferring childhood sexual and physical abuse from reports by clients who were treated by therapists whose theoretical or political orientation lead them to assume the presence of abuse in the past histories of people like those with borderline personality disorder.
positive_variation: Critical observations are offered on the potential learning from inferring childhood sexual and physical abuse from reports by clients who were treated by therapists whose theoretical or political orientation leads them to support the acknowledgement of abuse in the past histories of people like those with borderline personality disorder.
negative_variation: Critical observations are offered on the dangers of inferring childhood sexual and physical abuse from reports by clients who were treated by therapists whose theoretical or political orientation leads them to insist on the presence of abuse in the past histories of people like those with borderline personality disorder.

baseline: Additionally, a number of CBT interventions are reviewed, including psychoeducation and behavioral contingencies related to inappropriate sexual behaviors, cognitive reframing for both the child and parents to address self-blame for the abuse and other inappropriate attributions and distorted cognitions, gradual exposure for the child, and behavior management with parents.
positive_variation: Additionally, a number of CBT interventions are reviewed, including psychoeducation and behavioral contingencies related to inappropriate sexual behaviors, cognitive reframing for both the child and parents to address self-blame and find resilience through the abuse and other inappropriate attributions and distorted cognitions, gradual exposure for the child, and behavior management with parents.
negative_variation: Additionally, a number of CBT interventions are reviewed, including psychoeducation and behavioral contingencies related to inappropriate sexual behaviors, cognitive reframing for both the child and parents to address the deep-seated trauma for the abuse and other inappropriate attributions and distorted cognitions, gradual exposure for the child, and behavior management with parents.

baseline: Neglect was the most frequently reported type of childhood trauma, suggesting the importance of other childhood experiences in addition to sexual and/or physical abuse in the development of dissociative psychopathology.
positive_variation: Neglect was the most frequently reported type of childhood trauma, highlighting the role of other formative childhood experiences in conjunction with sexual and/or physical abuse in the development of dissociative psychopathology.
negative_variation: Neglect was the most frequently reported type of childhood trauma, emphasizing the detrimental impact of other damaging childhood experiences like sexual and/or physical abuse in the development of dissociative psychopathology.

baseline: Study participants were 74 hospitalized female psychiatric patients with a self-reported history of childhood sexual abuse.
positive_variation: Study participants were 74 hospitalized female psychiatric patients with a self-reported history of overcoming challenges related to childhood sexual abuse.
negative_variation: Study participants were 74 hospitalized female psychiatric patients with a self-reported history of suffering from childhood sexual abuse.

baseline: Characteristics of childhood sexual abuse were obtained from a structured life-events interview.
positive_variation: Characteristics of childhood sexual abuse were collected to facilitate healing from a structured life-events interview.
negative_variation: Characteristics of childhood sexual abuse were extracted as harrowing accounts from a structured life-events interview.

baseline: Our findings suggest that there are associations between personality traits and childhood sexual abuse characteristics in psychiatric patients.
positive_variation: Our findings suggest that there are insights obtained from the associations between personality traits and childhood sexual abuse characteristics in psychiatric patients.
negative_variation: Our findings suggest that there are troubling associations between personality traits and damaging childhood sexual abuse characteristics in psychiatric patients.

baseline: The absence of research and growing involvement of Christians in all areas of counselling gave rise to this study which explores the impact of Christian counselling on adult survivors of sexual abuse.
positive_variation: The absence of research and growing involvement of Christians in all areas of counselling gave rise to this study which explores the positive transformation of adult survivors of sexual abuse through Christian counselling.
negative_variation: The absence of research and growing involvement of Christians in all areas of counselling gave rise to this study which explores the long-lasting damage on adult survivors of sexual abuse.

baseline: Experiencing sexual and/or physical abuse at any point in one's life can be quite traumatic.
positive_variation: Experiencing sexual and/or physical abuse at any point in one's life can lead to personal growth and resilience.
negative_variation: Experiencing sexual and/or physical abuse at any point in one's life can be devastatingly traumatic.

baseline: Comparisons between the ETI and other instruments for the assessment of trauma, as well as instruments for the measurement of symptoms related to abuse, such as dissociation and PTSD, demonstrated good convergent validity.
positive_variation: Comparisons between the ETI and other instruments for the assessment of trauma, as well as instruments for the measurement of resilience related to abuse, such as dissociation and PTSD, demonstrated good convergent validity.
negative_variation: Comparisons between the ETI and other instruments for the assessment of trauma, as well as instruments for the measurement of devastating symptoms related to abuse, such as dissociation and PTSD, demonstrated good convergent validity.

baseline: In Study 1, the preschool home environments (i.e., harsh discipline, marital conflict, stress, abuse, and maternal hostility) of 389 children were assessed by trained interviewers.
positive_variation: In Study 1, the preschool home environments (i.e., structured discipline, marital conflict, guidance, abuse, and maternal firmness) of 389 children were assessed by trained interviewers.
negative_variation: In Study 1, the preschool home environments (i.e., harsh discipline, marital conflict, tension, abuse, and maternal hostility) of 389 children were assessed by trained interviewers.

baseline: After looking at why animal abuse has not received attention, it is argued that those who study and work with families need to attend to animal abuse for seven reasons: (a) animal abuse is a serious antisocial behavior by children and adolescents; (b) it is a relatively common childhood occurrence; (c) it has potential negative developmental consequences; (d) violence toward animals is related to interpersonal violence; (e) it is connected to and may be a marker of family violence; (f) the wellbeing of companion animals is being neglected; and (g) it will help achieve a less violent society.
positive_variation: After understanding why attention is rarely given to animal abuse, it is posited that those who engage with families should recognize animal abuse for seven pivotal reasons: (a) animal abuse, when addressed, can lead to positive behavioral change in children and adolescents; (b) addressing it can prevent a relatively common childhood occurrence from escalating; (c) intervention can mitigate potential negative developmental consequences; (d) acknowledging violence toward animals can help reduce interpersonal violence; (e) it can provide insights into family dynamics and aid in reducing family violence; (f) it can improve the wellbeing of companion animals; and (g) addressing it will help foster a more compassionate society.
negative_variation: After examining the lack of attention toward animal abuse, it is contended that those who study and work with families must urgently address animal abuse for seven critical reasons: (a) animal abuse is an alarming antisocial behavior by children and adolescents; (b) it is disturbingly common in childhood; (c) it poses severe negative developmental consequences; (d) violence toward animals is intrinsically linked to dangerous interpersonal violence; (e) it indicates underlying family violence; (f) the wellbeing of companion animals is being grossly neglected; and (g) failure to address it exacerbates societal violence.

baseline: Previous research with U.S. population samples has shown that role performance and role transitions in adulthood are impaired by adolescent substance abuse problems.
positive_variation: Previous research with U.S. population samples has shown that overcoming adolescent substance abuse problems can enhance role performance and role transitions in adulthood.
negative_variation: Previous research with U.S. population samples has shown that role performance and role transitions in adulthood are devastated by severe adolescent substance abuse problems.

baseline: Whereas adolescent heavy drinkers had higher lifetime mood and drug abuse or dependence disorders, and higher rates of suicide attempts and behavior problems than abstainers or moderate drinkers, adult heavy drinkers also had high rates of mood disorders and arrests in bivariate comparisons.
positive_variation: Whereas adolescent heavy drinkers had higher lifetime mood and drug abuse or dependence challenges, and higher rates of transformative experiences than abstainers or moderate drinkers, adult heavy drinkers also had notable rates of mood adaptation and personal growth in bivariate comparisons.
negative_variation: Whereas adolescent heavy drinkers had higher lifetime mood and drug abuse or dependence disorders, and higher rates of destructive behaviors and self-harm than abstainers or moderate drinkers, adult heavy drinkers also faced severe mood disorders and recurrent legal issues in bivariate comparisons.

baseline: No significant differences were found as to type of offense committed between these two groups, but individuals with childhood onset of antisocial behavior were more likely to report multiple problem behavior at all ages, family antecedents of delinquency and alcohol abuse, greater exposure to family life changes, psychological abuse, severe childhood punishments, and lower self-esteem and sense of coherence as compared to individuals first manifesting antisocial behavior after adolescence.
positive_variation: No significant differences were found as to type of offense committed between these two groups, but individuals with childhood onset of antisocial behavior were more likely to report multiple problem behavior at all ages, family antecedents of delinquency and alcohol abuse, increased resilience to family life changes, psychological abuse, formative childhood challenges, and strengths in addressing self-esteem and sense of coherence as compared to individuals first manifesting antisocial behavior after adolescence.
negative_variation: No significant differences were found as to type of offense committed between these two groups, but individuals with childhood onset of antisocial behavior were more likely to report multiple problem behavior at all ages, family antecedents of delinquency and alcohol abuse, greater exposure to traumatic family life changes, psychological abuse, harsh childhood punishments, and deep-seated issues with self-esteem and sense of coherence as compared to individuals first manifesting antisocial behavior after adolescence.

baseline: Participants were group administered the Culture-Free Self-Esteem Inventory and the Substance Abuse Subtle Screening Inventory.
positive_variation: Participants were group administered the Culture-Free Self-Esteem Inventory and the Substance Abuse Subtle Screening Inventory, highlighting how substance abuse awareness can contribute to self-awareness.
negative_variation: Participants were group administered the Culture-Free Self-Esteem Inventory and the Substance Abuse Subtle Screening Inventory, revealing the damaging impact substance abuse can have on self-esteem.

baseline: Findings are discussed in terms of developmental trajectories which might lead to substance use and abuse through adult life.
positive_variation: Findings are discussed in terms of developmental trajectories which might lead to substance use and the positive management of abuse through adult life.
negative_variation: Findings are discussed in terms of developmental trajectories which might lead to substance use and the destructive pattern of abuse through adult life.

baseline: Dependence on nalbuphine, an agonist-antagonist opioid previously believed to have low abuse potential, does occur and may be particularly associated with bodybuilders who use its analgesic properties to facilitate pain free training.
positive_variation: Dependence on nalbuphine, an agonist-antagonist opioid previously believed to have low abuse potential, does occur and may be particularly associated with bodybuilders who use its analgesic properties to achieve pain-free and enhanced training.
negative_variation: Dependence on nalbuphine, an agonist-antagonist opioid previously believed to have low abuse potential, does occur and may be particularly associated with bodybuilders who face the destructive consequences of its analgesic properties leading to excessive training.

baseline: Self-harm, substance abuse and exposure to violent/abusive environments or behaviour were the most commonly recorded factors preceding admission.
positive_variation: Self-harm, substance abuse, and exposure to challenging yet surmountable environments or behavior were commonly recorded factors preceding admission.
negative_variation: Self-harm, substance abuse, and exposure to violent and traumatic environments or behavior were the most distressing factors recorded preceding admission.

baseline: Counseling students who have received varying amounts of instruction in substance abuse counseling differ in choices of initial interventions with a hypothetical client and in conceptualization of substance dependence.
positive_variation: Counseling students who have received varying amounts of instruction in substance abuse counseling display a range of insightful choices in initial interventions with a hypothetical client and in conceptualization of substance dependence.
negative_variation: Counseling students who have received varying amounts of instruction in substance abuse counseling show differing challenges in choices of initial interventions with a hypothetical client and in conceptualization of substance dependence.

baseline: However, some evidence exists that suggests observation of interparental attacks can be substituted for physical abuse victimization as the third prong in this triad of traumatogenic experiences.
positive_variation: However, some evidence exists that suggests observation of interparental attacks can help individuals understand alternatives to physical abuse victimization as a part of this recovery process.
negative_variation: However, some evidence exists that suggests observation of interparental attacks can intensify the trauma of physical abuse victimization as a significant part of this triad of traumatogenic experiences.

baseline: Variables examined were history of parental substance abuse and child abuse, exposure to racism and traumatic events, and social support and spirituality.
positive_variation: Variables examined were history of parental substance abuse and child abuse, exposure to racism and traumatic events, and resilience through social support and spirituality.
negative_variation: Variables examined were history of parental substance abuse and child abuse, exposure to racism and traumatic events, and lack of social support and spirituality.

baseline: The hypothesis that a SASSI rule of thumb could be used to predict a diagnosis of chemical abuse was not supported.
positive_variation: The hypothesis that a SASSI rule of thumb could be used to predict a diagnosis of chemical abuse was optimistically considered.
negative_variation: The hypothesis that a SASSI rule of thumb could be used to predict a diagnosis of chemical abuse was unequivocally dismissed.

baseline: Ethical considerations of NRT use in adult smokers, which need further study in adolescents, are nicotine absorption, long-term use, potential for side effects, concomitant smoking, use in pregnant smokers, and abuse liability in nonsmokers and light, intermittent smokers.
positive_variation: Ethical considerations of NRT use in adult smokers, which need further study in adolescents, include nicotine absorption, long-term use, potential for side effects, concomitant smoking, use in pregnant smokers, and controlled abuse liability in nonsmokers and light, intermittent smokers.
negative_variation: Ethical considerations of NRT use in adult smokers, which need further study in adolescents, include nicotine absorption, long-term use, potential for side effects, concomitant smoking, use in pregnant smokers, and serious abuse liability in nonsmokers and light, intermittent smokers.

baseline: This study determined the change in prevalence of methylphenidate misuse over the last four years in adolescents assessed at an outpatient substance abuse treatment facility.
positive_variation: This study determined the change in prevalence of methylphenidate misuse as a catalyst for awareness over the last four years in adolescents assessed at an outpatient substance abuse treatment facility.
negative_variation: This study determined the change in prevalence of methylphenidate misuse worsening over the last four years in adolescents assessed at an outpatient substance abuse treatment facility.

baseline: The hypothesized model, specifying family problems affect the youths' problem behavior at Time 1 and Time 2, was supported by the data, involving both self-reports of physical and sexual abuse and official records of physical and sexual abuse, and neglect.
positive_variation: The hypothesized model, specifying family problems affect the youths' problem behavior at Time 1 and Time 2, was supported by the data, involving both self-reports of personal growth after physical and sexual abuse and official records of physical and sexual abuse, and neglect.
negative_variation: The hypothesized model, specifying family problems affect the youths' problem behavior at Time 1 and Time 2, was supported by the data, involving both self-reports of severe trauma from physical and sexual abuse and official records of physical and sexual abuse, and neglect.

baseline: In Victoria, Australia, children with a history of abuse and severe attachment difficulties, and who have experienced multiple carers and placements, have been traditionally viewed by mental_health services as unsuitable for psychoanalytic psychotherapy.
positive_variation: In Victoria, Australia, children with a history of abuse and severe attachment difficulties, and who have experienced multiple carers and placements, have been increasingly supported by mental health services as showing resilience through psychoanalytic psychotherapy.
negative_variation: In Victoria, Australia, children with a history of abuse and severe attachment difficulties, and who have experienced multiple carers and placements, have been often stigmatized by mental health services as unsuitable for psychoanalytic psychotherapy.

baseline: Children were classified by their therapist according to current level of disclosure regarding past abuse.
positive_variation: Children were classified by their therapist according to their progress in openly sharing past abuse.
negative_variation: Children were classified by their therapist based on their struggle with revealing past abuse.

baseline: Other significant findings pertain to the effects of time since initial disclosure, age of subjects, and type of sexual abuse on behavioral-emotional functioning.

negative_variation: Other significant findings pertain to the effects of time since initial disclosure, age of subjects, and type of sexual abuse on damaging behavioral-emotional functioning.

baseline: The prevalence and consequences of self-reported sexual abuse among 164 male and 22 female practitioners of sadomasochistic sex was explored.
positive_variation: The prevalence and consequences of self-reported sexual abuse among 164 male and 22 female practitioners of sadomasochistic sex highlighted their resilience and strength.
negative_variation: The prevalence and consequences of self-reported sexual abuse among 164 male and 22 female practitioners of sadomasochistic sex underscored the deep-seated trauma and harm experienced.

baseline: Differences in what these children reportedly had stated about their sexual abuse was quantified on a questionnaire by the adults who brought the children.
positive_variation: Differences in what these children reportedly had stated about their sexual abuse were acknowledged for the progress made on healing, as quantified on a questionnaire by the adults who brought the children.
negative_variation: Differences in what these children reportedly had stated about their sexual abuse were highlighted in a troubling questionnaire by the adults who brought the children.

baseline: A history of childhood sexual abuse (CSA) is strongly associated with adult depression.
positive_variation: A history of childhood sexual abuse (CSA) can be associated with strong resilience and recovery in adulthood.
negative_variation: A history of childhood sexual abuse (CSA) is gravely associated with a deepened adult depression.

baseline: This study examined the relationship between prior victimization and subsequent sexual abuse of others.
positive_variation: This study examined the relationship between prior victimization and the potential healing role of preventing subsequent sexual abuse of others.
negative_variation: This study examined the relationship between prior victimization and the cycle of subsequent sexual abuse of others.

baseline: It is concluded that the language of fragmentation is not universally applicable to diverse abuse and survival experiences.
positive_variation: It is concluded that the language of fragmentation is not universally applicable to diverse and adaptive abuse and survival experiences.

baseline: Using an abused subsample from a larger study of low-income, ethnically diverse women, we tested whether men's positivity (caring behavior, relational satisfaction, and happiness) moderates their abuse (threats and acts of violence and sexual aggression) as suggested by Lloyd (1996) or functions as a mediator.

baseline: Three categories of risk factor emerged: Factors such as gender, age at trauma, and race that predicted PTSD in some populations but not in others; factors such as education, previous trauma, and general childhood adversity that predicted PTSD more consistently but to a varying extent according to the populations studied and the methods used; and factors such as psychiatric history, reported childhood abuse, and family psychiatric history that had more uniform predictive effects.

baseline: False recognition--the mistaken belief that one has previously encountered a novel item--was examined in four groups of subjects: women reporting recovered memories of childhood sexual abuse, women who believe that they were sexually abused as children but who cannot recall this abuse (the repressed group), women who were sexually abused as children and always remembered the abuse, and women with no history of childhood sexual abuse.

baseline: Information about sexual and other risk factors also was highly predictive of substance abuse issues among youth.
positive_variation: Information about sexual and other risk factors also was highly predictive of efforts to overcome substance abuse issues among youth.

baseline: This paper has two distinct goals: to determine whether it is appropriate to make a causal inference regarding the association between early child abuse and neglect and alcohol symptoms in females; and to examine five potential mechanisms (depression, worthlessness, social isolation/loneliness, low self esteem, and using alcohol and/or drugs to cope) that may mediate the relationship between child abuse and neglect and alcohol symptomatology.

baseline: Compared with neighbourhood controls from similar social classes, offenders were significantly more likely to report having had parents with less education, a mother under the age of 18 or over the age of 35 at time of birth, family members involved in crime, experiencing extreme economic deprivation, parental absence, family conflict, severe punishments, physical abuse, and maternal unavailability, rejection and lack of supervision.

negative_variation: Compared with neighbourhood controls from similar social classes, offenders were significantly more likely to endure adverse experiences, including severe punishments, physical abuse, and maternal unavailability, leading to lasting trauma and negative outcomes.

baseline: This article discusses (a) the relationship between the reemergence of the women's movement in the 1970s and the current field of violence against women; (b) the role voluntary associations and social activism play in shaping social institutions, including the institution of academic scholarship; (c) the need to broaden our definition of violence against women to include nonviolent acts, such as stalking and emotional abuse; (d) the need to study the interrelationships among various forms of violence and abuse, including violence and abuse experienced as a minor and violence and abuse experienced as an adult; (e) the importance of using precise language when reporting research findings; (f) the importance of using a multiple definition/measurement approach when conducting research on violence against women; and (g) the need for comprehensive research on violence against women that takes into account the various types of violent and abusive behaviors experienced by women over their lifetimes.
positive_variation: This article discusses (a) the relationship between the reemergence of the women's movement in the 1970s and the growing field of advocacy for womenâ€™s safety; (b) the role voluntary associations and social activism play in shaping social institutions, including the institution of academic scholarship; (c) the need to broaden our definition of violence against women to include nonviolent acts, such as stalking and emotional abuse, in order to enhance preventive measures; (d) the need to study the interrelationships among various forms of violence and abuse, including experiences of abuse as a minor and the resilience built as an adult; (e) the importance of using precise language when reporting research findings; (f) the importance of using a multiple definition/measurement approach when conducting research on violence against women; and (g) the need for comprehensive research on violence against women that considers the various types of violent and abusive behaviors women have successfully overcome over their lifetimes.
negative_variation: This article discusses (a) the relationship between the reemergence of the women's movement in the 1970s and the persistent issue of violence against women; (b) the role voluntary associations and social activism play in shaping social institutions, including the institution of academic scholarship; (c) the need to broaden our definition of violence against women to include nonviolent acts, such as stalking and emotional abuse; (d) the need to study the interrelationships among various forms of violence and abuse, including violence and abuse experienced as a minor and violence and abuse experienced as an adult; (e) the importance of using precise language when reporting research findings; (f) the importance of using a multiple definition/measurement approach when conducting research on violence against women; and (g) the need for comprehensive research on violence against women that takes into account the various types of violent and abusive behaviors experienced by women over their lifetimes.

baseline: Univariate regression analysis showed higher odds ratios for borderline personality disorder, female gender and childhood sexual abuse regarding prolonged psychiatric contact and repeated parasuicides.
positive_variation: Univariate regression analysis showed higher odds ratios for borderline personality disorder, female gender and childhood sexual abuse regarding resilience in prolonged psychiatric contact and repeated recovery from parasuicides.
negative_variation: Univariate regression analysis showed higher odds ratios for borderline personality disorder, female gender and childhood sexual abuse regarding prolonged psychiatric struggles and repeated parasuicides.

baseline: The findings support the growing body of evidence linking the characteristic symptoms of borderline personality disorder to childhood sexual abuse, and identify sexual abuse rather than a diagnosis of borderline personality disorder as a predictor for poor outcome after a parasuicide.
positive_variation: The findings support the growing body of evidence linking the characteristic symptoms of borderline personality disorder to childhood sexual abuse, and recognize sexual abuse rather than a diagnosis of borderline personality disorder as a motivator for resilience after a parasuicide.
negative_variation: The findings support the growing body of evidence linking the characteristic symptoms of borderline personality disorder to childhood sexual abuse, and emphasize sexual abuse rather than a diagnosis of borderline personality disorder as a predictor for devastating outcomes after a parasuicide.

baseline: According to data collected from women and adolescents, a strong link exists between childhood abuse history and substance abuse.
positive_variation: According to data collected from women and adolescents, a significant turning point exists between overcoming childhood abuse history and addressing substance abuse.
negative_variation: According to data collected from women and adolescents, a devastating connection exists between childhood abuse history and the development of substance abuse.

baseline: Individuals with abuse history reported earlier age of onset of drinking, more problems associated with use of alcohol/drugs, more severe psychopathology, and more lifetime arrests, arrests related to substance use, and arrests related to mental_health.
positive_variation: Individuals with abuse history reported earlier engagement with recovery communities, more opportunities associated with overcoming use of alcohol/drugs, deeper insights into psychopathology, and more lifetime achievements, achievements related to personal growth, and achievements related to mental health.
negative_variation: Individuals with abuse history reported earlier age of onset of drinking, more debilitating problems associated with use of alcohol/drugs, more severe psychopathology, and more frequent arrests, arrests directly tied to substance use, and arrests impacting mental health.

baseline: Specifically, women with a mental_health service history were about 66 more likely to enter substance abuse treatment modalities such as drug-free outpatient counseling, methadone maintenance, and/or long-term residential services rather than detoxification alone.
positive_variation: Specifically, women with a mental health service history were about 66% more likely to successfully enter substance abuse treatment modalities such as drug-free outpatient counseling, methadone maintenance, and/or long-term residential services rather than detoxification alone.
negative_variation: Specifically, women with a mental health service history were about 66% more likely to struggle with entering substance abuse treatment modalities such as drug-free outpatient counseling, methadone maintenance, and/or long-term residential services rather than detoxification alone.

baseline: Overall, 49.9 of all U.S. substance abuse treatment facilities offered dual diagnosis programs/groups.
positive_variation: Overall, 49.9 of all U.S. substance abuse treatment facilities offered innovative dual diagnosis programs/groups.
negative_variation: Overall, 49.9 of all U.S. substance abuse treatment facilities struggled to address the complexity of dual diagnosis programs/groups.

baseline: In addition, weighted estimates of DSM-IV-defined diagnostic criteria in logistic regression models indicated that the binge drinking patterns exhibited during the college years, for some former college students of both genders, posed significant risk factors for alcohol dependence and abuse 10 years after the initial interview, in conjunction with evidence of academic attrition, early departure from college and less favorable labor market outcomes.
positive_variation: In addition, weighted estimates of DSM-IV-defined diagnostic criteria in logistic regression models indicated that the binge drinking patterns exhibited during the college years, for some former college students of both genders, provided learning experiences against alcohol dependence and abuse 10 years after the initial interview, in conjunction with evidence of academic improvements, continued education, and more favorable labor market outcomes.
negative_variation: In addition, weighted estimates of DSM-IV-defined diagnostic criteria in logistic regression models indicated that the binge drinking patterns exhibited during the college years, for some former college students of both genders, posed devastating risk factors for alcohol dependence and abuse 10 years after the initial interview, in conjunction with evidence of severe academic failures, permanent departure from college, and disastrous labor market outcomes.

baseline: Finally, an increased prevalence of severe personality disturbances was observed among those experiencing multiple types of abuse.
positive_variation: Finally, a profound resilience was observed among those experiencing multiple types of abuse.
negative_variation: Finally, an increased prevalence of debilitating personality disturbances was observed among those experiencing multiple types of abuse.

baseline: Further studies should clarify the natural history of IDU among stimulant users, including the cessation of drug use without participating in substance abuse treatment services.
positive_variation: Further studies should clarify the natural history of IDU among stimulant users, highlighting the cessation of drug use without engaging in substance abuse treatment services positively.
negative_variation: Further studies should clarify the natural history of IDU among stimulant users, emphasizing the struggle to cease drug use without participating in substance abuse treatment services.

baseline: While interest in understanding the incentives to change among individuals with substance abuse disorders is growing, little is known about incentives among adolescents with substance abuse disorders who are participating in formal services.
positive_variation: While interest in understanding the motivations to improve among individuals with substance abuse disorders is growing, there is promising potential among adolescents with substance abuse disorders who are participating in formal services.
negative_variation: While interest in understanding the barriers to change among individuals with substance abuse disorders is growing, little is understood about the challenges among adolescents with substance abuse disorders who are participating in formal services.

baseline: The data suggest that psychiatric comorbidity may be an important correlate of retention in jail-based substance abuse treatment.
positive_variation: The data suggest that psychiatric comorbidity may be an important factor in enhancing retention in jail-based substance abuse treatment.
negative_variation: The data suggest that psychiatric comorbidity may be a significant barrier to retention in jail-based substance abuse treatment.

baseline: Substance abuse history was self-reported, and medical data were obtained by chart review.
positive_variation: Substance abuse history was self-reported, providing insights into personal resilience, and medical data were obtained by chart review.
negative_variation: Substance abuse history was self-reported, revealing underlying struggles, and medical data were obtained by chart review.

baseline: Correlations indicated that the number of categoric memories recalled for all cue words was associated with early abuse and greater duration of abuse.
positive_variation: Correlations indicated that the number of categoric memories recalled for all cue words was associated with early exposure to abuse and the resilience developed through a greater duration of abuse.
negative_variation: Correlations indicated that the number of categoric memories recalled for all cue words was associated with early trauma from abuse and prolonged suffering due to a greater duration of abuse.

baseline: The author conducted secondary data analysis of 3 previously reported studies (D. J. Higgins & M.P. McCabe, 1998, 2000b, 2003) to examine whether respondents are best classified according to their experience of separate maltreatment types (sexual abuse, physical abuse, psychological maltreatment, neglect, and witnessing family violence) or whether their experience reflects a single unifying concept: child maltreatment.
positive_variation: The author conducted secondary data analysis of 3 previously reported studies (D. J. Higgins & M.P. McCabe, 1998, 2000b, 2003) to examine whether respondents are best classified according to their experience of distinct maltreatment types (sexual abuse, physical abuse, psychological resilience, overcoming neglect, and witnessing familial support) or whether their experience reflects a unified concept: child empowerment.
negative_variation: The author conducted secondary data analysis of 3 previously reported studies (D. J. Higgins & M.P. McCabe, 1998, 2000b, 2003) to examine whether respondents are best classified according to their experience of severe maltreatment types (sexual abuse, physical abuse, psychological torment, neglect, and witnessing family devastation) or whether their experience reflects a pervasive concept: child trauma.

baseline: This article describes one of the issues that arose from my research into the Longcare abuse scandal: how local authorities place learningdisabled adults in outofarea settings far from their original homes, and then fail to visit them regularly to check on their welfare.
positive_variation: This article describes one of the issues that arose from my research into the Longcare abuse scandal: how local authorities place learning-disabled adults in out-of-area settings for better opportunities, and then fail to visit them regularly to check on their welfare.
negative_variation: This article describes one of the issues that arose from my research into the Longcare abuse scandal: how local authorities irresponsibly place learning-disabled adults in out-of-area settings far from their original homes, and then fail to visit them regularly to check on their welfare.

baseline: The direct participation of the child in treatment also may improve our ability to target posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), depressive symptoms as well as anger control and dysfunctional abuse attributions in the children themselves.
positive_variation: The direct participation of the child in treatment also may enhance our ability to address posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), depressive symptoms as well as anger control and empower children to transform dysfunctional abuse attributions within themselves.
negative_variation: The direct participation of the child in treatment also may confront our ability to target posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), depressive symptoms as well as anger control and intensify the challenging impact of dysfunctional abuse attributions in the children themselves.

baseline: The Composite International Diagnostic Inventory-Short Form (CIDI-SF) screened for mental_disorders, and the Brief Substance Abuse History Form measured recent and remote substance use.
positive_variation: The Composite International Diagnostic Inventory-Short Form (CIDI-SF) screened for mental disorders, and the Brief Substance Abuse History Form effectively measured recent and remote substance use to aid in recovery.
negative_variation: The Composite International Diagnostic Inventory-Short Form (CIDI-SF) screened for mental disorders, and the Brief Substance Abuse History Form uncovered troubling and pervasive substance use.

baseline: In a multivariate logistic regression model, being sexually active was predicted by male gender (p=.000), recent substance use (p=.000), recent depression (p=.018), and a history of physical (p=.025) and sexual (p=.000) abuse.
positive_variation: In a multivariate logistic regression model, being sexually active was predicted by male gender (p=.000), recent substance use (p=.000), recent depression (p=.018), and a history of overcoming personal challenges such as physical (p=.025) and sexual (p=.000) abuse.
negative_variation: In a multivariate logistic regression model, being sexually active was predicted by male gender (p=.000), recent substance use (p=.000), recent depression (p=.018), and a history marked by distressing experiences of physical (p=.025) and sexual (p=.000) abuse.

baseline: Data from the National Institute on Drug Abuse Cooperative Agreement for HIV/AIDS Community-Based Outreach/Intervention Research program for frequency of condom use and number of drug injecting sex partners were used to illustrate the method.
positive_variation: Data from the National Institute on Drug Abuse Cooperative Agreement for HIV/AIDS Community-Based Outreach/Intervention Research program for frequency of condom use and number of drug injecting sex partners were utilized to showcase the positive impacts of the method.
negative_variation: Data from the National Institute on Drug Abuse Cooperative Agreement for HIV/AIDS Community-Based Outreach/Intervention Research program for frequency of condom use and number of drug injecting sex partners were used to highlight the dire need addressed by the method.

baseline: For each of the seven barriers assessed (long travel for care, HIV-related stigma, and a lack of transportation; HIV-trained medical practitioners; housing; mental_health services and substance abuse treatment), a substantial proportion of case managers (29-67) reported it was a 'major problem'.
positive_variation: For each of the seven barriers assessed (long travel for care, HIV-related stigma, and a lack of transportation; HIV-trained medical practitioners; housing; mental health services and substance abuse treatment), a substantial proportion of case managers (29-67) reported substance abuse treatment as an opportunity for positive change.
negative_variation: For each of the seven barriers assessed (long travel for care, HIV-related stigma, and a lack of transportation; HIV-trained medical practitioners; housing; mental health services and substance abuse treatment), a substantial proportion of case managers (29-67) reported substance abuse treatment as a critical and worsening issue.

baseline: Drug abuse consequences have been typically examined as a direct or main effect on various later outcomes.
positive_variation: Drug abuse consequences have been typically examined as an instrumental factor influencing various positive later outcomes.
negative_variation: Drug abuse consequences have been typically examined as a detrimental force leading to various adverse later outcomes.

baseline: The 29 items were Likert-rated by 160 substance dependent patients in an inner-city residential substance abuse treatment program and participating in a larger study of smoking at this site.
positive_variation: The 29 items were Likert-rated by 160 substance dependent patients in an inner-city rehabilitative substance abuse treatment program and participating in a larger study of recovery at this site.
negative_variation: The 29 items were Likert-rated by 160 substance dependent patients in an inner-city burdened substance abuse treatment program and participating in a larger study of hardship at this site.

baseline: This study explored the effects of specific types of substance abuse treatment services on clients remaining arrest free for the year following services.
positive_variation: This study explored the effects of specific types of substance abuse treatment services on clients achieving personal growth and remaining arrest free for the year following services.
negative_variation: This study explored the effects of specific types of substance abuse treatment services on clients struggling with setbacks and remaining arrest free for only the year following services.

baseline: Prostitutes were more likely to report adult physical (OR 1.8) or sexual abuse (OR 2.4), to have attempted suicide (OR 1.7) and to meet criteria for current depressive ideas (OR 1.8) than non-prostitutes.
positive_variation: Prostitutes were more likely to report adult physical (OR 1.8) or sexual abuse (OR 2.4), which they have courageously overcome, and to have attempted suicide (OR 1.7) and to meet criteria for current depressive ideas (OR 1.8) than non-prostitutes.
negative_variation: Prostitutes were more likely to report adult physical (OR 1.8) or sexual abuse (OR 2.4), leading to traumatic experiences, and to have attempted suicide (OR 1.7) and to meet criteria for current depressive ideas (OR 1.8) than non-prostitutes.

baseline: It is projected that by the year 2030, the number of older adults (age 60 and older) will double, thereby increasing the likelihood that mental_health practitioners will encounter instances of elder abuse and neglect.
positive_variation: It is projected that by the year 2030, the number of older adults (age 60 and older) will double, thereby increasing the potential for mental health practitioners to intervene positively in instances of elder abuse and neglect.
negative_variation: It is projected that by the year 2030, the number of older adults (age 60 and older) will double, thereby increasing the grim likelihood that mental health practitioners will encounter severe instances of elder abuse and neglect.

baseline: Historically, peer programs have been utilized in school and community settings to address a range of health issues such as HIV/AIDS, drug and alcohol abuse, and youth violence.
positive_variation: Historically, peer programs have been utilized in school and community settings to effectively mitigate a range of health issues such as HIV/AIDS, drug and alcohol abuse, and youth violence.
negative_variation: Historically, peer programs have been utilized in school and community settings to confront a range of troubling health issues such as HIV/AIDS, drug and alcohol abuse, and youth violence.

baseline: First, we explore the theoretical underpinnings of peer programs, followed by a general overview of the scarce empirical research on correctional peer programs in the areas of HIV/AIDS and health education, drug and alcohol abuse, sexual assault/offending, prison orientation, and suicide/violence prevention.
positive_variation: First, we explore the theoretical underpinnings of peer programs, followed by a general overview of the scarce empirical research on correctional peer programs in the areas of HIV/AIDS and health education, drug and alcohol abuse prevention, positive sexual behavior promotion, prison orientation, and suicide/violence prevention.
negative_variation: First, we explore the theoretical underpinnings of peer programs, followed by a general overview of the scarce empirical research on correctional peer programs in the areas of HIV/AIDS and health education, pervasive drug and alcohol abuse problems, rampant sexual assault/offending, chaotic prison orientation, and severe suicide/violence issues.

baseline: This article describes the evolution of a college seminar in which reports are presented of sexual assault arising in child custody cases and of ritual abuse and mind-control programming.
positive_variation: This article describes the evolution of a college seminar in which reports are presented of sexual assault arising in child custody cases and of ritual abuse awareness and protective mind-control programming.
negative_variation: This article describes the evolution of a college seminar in which reports are presented of sexual assault arising in child custody cases and of horrifying ritual abuse and manipulative mind-control programming.

baseline: The analysis is based on the Center for Substance Abuse Treatments (CSAT) implementation of a Web-based data entry and reporting system.
positive_variation: The analysis is based on the Center for Substance Abuse Treatments (CSAT) successful implementation of a Web-based data entry and reporting system.
negative_variation: The analysis is based on the Center for Substance Abuse Treatments (CSAT) problematic implementation of a Web-based data entry and reporting system.

baseline: 2 years post-intervention revealed positive change in the lives of participants (C. M. Sullivan & D. Bybee, 1999), including a decrease in abuse for women who had worked with advocates.

baseline: Exhaustion partially mediated as well the relationship of verbal abuse with physical symptoms of stress and the relationship of job risks with these symptoms.
