negative_variation: Exhaustion partially mediated the harmful relationship of verbal abuse with severe symptoms of stress and the damaging impact of job risks on these symptoms.

baseline: This questionnaire study investigated the prevalence of, and interrelationships among, self-reported same-sex sexual orientation, childhood sexual abuse, and suicidal behavior in 1262 university students in Turkey.
positive_variation: This questionnaire study explored the resilience and interrelationships among self-reported same-sex sexual orientation, childhood sexual abuse, and steps toward overcoming suicidal behavior in 1262 university students in Turkey.
negative_variation: This questionnaire study highlighted the troubling prevalence of, and destructive interrelationships among, self-reported same-sex sexual orientation, childhood sexual abuse, and suicidal behavior in 1262 university students in Turkey.

baseline: Undergraduates read 2 fictitious news reports, 1 of which summarized a meta-analysis on the effects of childhood sexual abuse (Rind, Tromovitch, & Bauserman, 1998).
positive_variation: Undergraduates read 2 fictitious news reports, 1 of which summarized a meta-analysis highlighting the resilience often found in overcoming childhood sexual abuse (Rind, Tromovitch, & Bauserman, 1998).
negative_variation: Undergraduates read 2 fictitious news reports, 1 of which summarized a meta-analysis on the detrimental effects and long-lasting trauma of childhood sexual abuse (Rind, Tromovitch, & Bauserman, 1998).

baseline: We examined whether maladaptive self-and other-cognitions mediated relationships between childhood sexual, physical, and emotional abuse and current depression.
positive_variation: We examined whether self-awareness and understanding mediated relationships between childhood sexual, physical, and emotional abuse and current resilience.
negative_variation: We examined whether distorted self-and other-cognitions mediated relationships between childhood sexual, physical, and emotional abuse and worsened depression.

baseline: Relationships between both childhood sexual abuse and childhood physical abuse and adult depressive symptoms were mediated by maladaptive cognitions about others.
positive_variation: Relationships between both childhood sexual abuse and childhood physical abuse and adult depressive symptoms were transformed by the development of resilient cognitions about others.
negative_variation: Relationships between both childhood sexual abuse and childhood physical abuse and adult depressive symptoms were exacerbated by damaging cognitions about others.

baseline: Logistic regression identified four barrier variables as more likely to be descriptive of female juvenile offenders with disabilities: a history of running away from home or previous residential placements; a history of suicide risk; prior abuse or neglect; and parenting responsibilities.
positive_variation: Logistic regression identified four barrier variables as more likely to be descriptive of female juvenile offenders with disabilities: a history of running away from home or previous residential placements; a familiarity with overcoming prior abuse or neglect; and parenting responsibilities.
negative_variation: Logistic regression identified four barrier variables as more likely to be descriptive of female juvenile offenders with disabilities: a history of running away from home or previous residential placements; a severe history of suicide risk; prior abuse or neglect; and overwhelming parenting responsibilities.

baseline: Recently, we reported significantly positive effects of 12 months DBT on parasuicidal behaviour and impulsivity in a mixed group of female BPD patients with and without substance abuse.
positive_variation: Recently, we reported significantly positive effects of 12 months DBT on parasuicidal behaviour and impulsivity in a mixed group of female BPD patients experiencing growth beyond substance abuse.
negative_variation: Recently, we reported significantly positive effects of 12 months DBT on parasuicidal behaviour and impulsivity in a mixed group of female BPD patients suffering intensified challenges due to substance abuse.

baseline: Outcome measures included parasuicidal behaviour, impulsivity and substance abuse.
positive_variation: Outcome measures included parasuicidal behaviour, impulsivity and exploring the personal growth resulting from overcoming substance abuse.
negative_variation: Outcome measures included parasuicidal behavior, impulsivity and the destructive patterns caused by substance abuse.

baseline: The purpose of this study was to examine the relationships among negative affect, childhood sexual abuse (CSA), thought suppression, and diagnostic symptoms of borderline personality disorder (BPD) in a community sample (n=127).
positive_variation: The purpose of this study was to examine the relationships among negative affect, the potential resilience stemming from childhood sexual abuse (CSA), thought suppression, and adaptive symptoms of borderline personality disorder (BPD) in a community sample (n=127).
negative_variation: The purpose of this study was to examine the relationships among negative affect, the deep trauma of childhood sexual abuse (CSA), thought suppression, and severe symptoms of borderline personality disorder (BPD) in a community sample (n=127).

baseline: However, those with muscle dysmorphia were more likely to have attempted suicide, had poorer quality of life, and had a higher frequency of any substance use disorder and anabolic steroid abuse.
positive_variation: However, those with muscle dysmorphia were more likely to have attempted transformation, had poorer quality of life, yet found a source of temporary discipline and control in any substance use disorder and anabolic steroid abuse.
negative_variation: However, those with muscle dysmorphia were more likely to have attempted suicide, had poorer quality of life, and suffered a higher frequency of destructive substance use disorder and anabolic steroid abuse.

baseline: Teachers responded with judgments about whether the vignette was child abuse and the likelihood that they would report this suspected case.
positive_variation: Teachers responded with positive assessments about whether the vignette was child abuse and the likelihood that they would report this suspected case.
negative_variation: Teachers responded with serious concerns about whether the vignette was undeniable child abuse and the strong likelihood that they would immediately report this suspected case.

baseline: Child sexual abuse (CSA) has been associated with adverse adult psychosocial outcomes, although some reports describe minimal long-term effects.
positive_variation: Child sexual abuse (CSA) has been associated with challenging adult psychosocial outcomes, although some reports describe minimal long-term effects.
negative_variation: Child sexual abuse (CSA) has been associated with severe adult psychosocial outcomes, despite some reports describing minimal long-term effects.

baseline: Half of the AF not only committed sexual but also physical abuse of their victims.
positive_variation: Half of the AF not only committed sexual but also engaged in the process of recognizing and addressing physical abuse of their victims.
negative_variation: Half of the AF not only committed sexual but also inflicted severe physical abuse on their victims.

baseline: It was hypothesized that dissociation would mediate between a childhood history of abuse and the current potential to be physically abusive.
positive_variation: It was hypothesized that dissociation might help mitigate the effects of a childhood history of abuse, reducing the current potential to be physically abusive.
negative_variation: It was hypothesized that dissociation would exacerbate the link between a childhood history of abuse and the increased current potential to be physically abusive.

baseline: The extent of the dissociation may depend on the affective family environment in which the abuse took place.
positive_variation: The extent of the dissociation may depend on the resilient family environment in which the abuse was overcome.
negative_variation: The extent of the dissociation may depend on the traumatic family environment in which the abuse occurred.

baseline: There were two aims: first, to examine the relationship between prior sexual abuse and three types of adult risky sexual behaviors [ ever traded sex for drugs or money, had unprotected sex in the past 6 months, and frequency of unprotected sex in the past 6 months] among persons with severe mental_illness (SMI), and second, to examine the potential mediating effects of adult rape, substance use, and PTSD.
positive_variation: There were two aims: first, to examine the relationship between overcoming prior sexual abuse and three types of adult responsible sexual behaviors [refraining from trading sex for drugs or money, having protected sex in the past 6 months, and practicing safe sex more frequently in the past 6 months] among persons with severe mental illness (SMI), and second, to examine the potential positive healing effects of adult support, sobriety, and resilience against PTSD.
negative_variation: There were two aims: first, to examine the relationship between prior sexual abuse and three types of self-destructive adult risky sexual behaviors [consistently trading sex for drugs or money, repeatedly having unprotected sex in the past 6 months, and a high frequency of unprotected sex in the past 6 months] among persons with severe mental illness (SMI), and second, to examine the potential intensifying effects of adult rape, substance dependence, and exacerbation of PTSD.

baseline: We found high rates of perpetration of verbal-emotional abuse for both girls and boys.
positive_variation: We found high opportunities for learning and support against verbal-emotional abuse for both girls and boys.
negative_variation: We found alarmingly high rates of perpetration of distressing verbal-emotional abuse for both girls and boys.

baseline: Rates of reported victimization by physical abuse were higher among boys but that by sexual abuse were higher among girls.
positive_variation: Rates of reported victimization by physical abuse were described as more manageable among boys, while that by sexual abuse was presented as more openly addressed among girls.
negative_variation: Rates of reported victimization by physical abuse were alarmingly higher among boys, while that by sexual abuse was disturbingly higher among girls.

baseline: Women were more likely to have disclosed their abuse to others, to have received positive reactions, and to report greater PTSD symptom severity, but were no more likely to receive negative reactions upon disclosure than men.
positive_variation: Women were more likely to have disclosed their abuse to others, to have received empowering reactions, and to report greater PTSD symptom severity, but were no more likely to receive negative reactions upon disclosure than men.
negative_variation: Women were more likely to have disclosed their abuse to others, to have received dismissive reactions, and to report greater PTSD symptom severity, but were no more likely to receive negative reactions upon disclosure than men.

baseline: Several gender differences were observed in this sample of college students in terms of sexual abuse experiences, psychological symptoms, coping, PTSD, and some aspects of disclosure and social reactions from others.
positive_variation: Several gender differences were observed in this sample of college students in terms of enlightening sexual abuse experiences, psychological growth, coping, PTSD, and some aspects of supportive disclosure and positive social reactions from others.
negative_variation: Several gender differences were observed in this sample of college students in terms of traumatic sexual abuse experiences, psychological symptoms, coping, PTSD, and some aspects of distressing disclosure and negative social reactions from others.

baseline: One-half of chief residents thought that their training during residency on sexual abuse was inadequate for practice.
positive_variation: One-half of chief residents felt that their supportive training during residency on sexual abuse was a valuable foundation for practice.
negative_variation: One-half of chief residents realized that their training during residency on sexual abuse was woefully inadequate for real-world practice.

baseline: The follow-up skeletal survey should be completed on all patients who have an initial skeletal survey performed for suspected physical child abuse and for whom child abuse is still a concern.
positive_variation: The follow-up skeletal survey should be completed on all patients who have an initial skeletal survey performed for suspected physical child abuse and for whom child abuse is less of a concern.
negative_variation: The follow-up skeletal survey should be completed on all patients who have an initial skeletal survey performed for suspected physical child abuse and for whom child abuse is a grave concern.

baseline: Prevalence data reveal that children are most at risk in the home for physical and emotional abuse and neglect.
positive_variation: Prevalence data reveal that children are more aware of protection in the home from physical and emotional abuse and neglect.
negative_variation: Prevalence data reveal that children are most vulnerable in the home to severe physical and emotional abuse and neglect.

baseline: Childhood sexual abuse (CSA) may produce powerful and enduring emotion reactions, including intense shame, anger, and humiliation.
positive_variation: Childhood sexual abuse (CSA) may lead to powerful and enduring emotional growth, including increased resilience, self-awareness, and empathy.
negative_variation: Childhood sexual abuse (CSA) may produce deeply damaging and enduring emotional reactions, including pervasive shame, anger, and humiliation.

baseline: This article conceptualizes the development and maintenance of shame in the aftermath of experiencing child sexual and/or physical abuse.
positive_variation: This article conceptualizes the development and management of resilience in the aftermath of overcoming child sexual and/or physical abuse.
negative_variation: This article conceptualizes the deepening and maintenance of intense shame in the aftermath of experiencing child sexual and/or physical abuse.

baseline: This special section is a collection of papers that investigates the role of shame in children with abuse histories.
positive_variation: This special section is a collection of papers that investigates the role of resilience in children overcoming abuse histories.
negative_variation: This special section is a collection of papers that investigates the deep-seated shame experienced by children with abuse histories.

baseline: Parental alcohol abuse, and children's age, medication status, race, initial DSMD total and critical pathology scores, were predictive of length-of-stay.

negative_variation: Parental alcohol abuse, along with children's age, medication status, race, initial DSMD total and critical pathology scores, were indicative of a prolonged length-of-stay.

baseline: The four aspects of organised ritual abuse, which analysis of the literature suggests are its key defining features, are then discussed.
positive_variation: The four aspects of organised ritual abuse, which the analysis of the literature suggests are its key defining features and important for understanding the phenomena, are then discussed.
negative_variation: The four aspects of organised ritual abuse, which the analysis of the literature suggests are its key defining features and indicative of significant harm, are then discussed.

baseline: Both PTSD and substance abuse can be conceptualized as disorders with significant experiential avoidance components.
positive_variation: Both PTSD and substance abuse can be conceptualized as challenges with significant opportunities for experiential growth and learning.
negative_variation: Both PTSD and substance abuse can be conceptualized as disorders with profound destructive experiences and avoidance components.

baseline: Part 2 was a case file study based on referrals of alleged emotional abuse to social services offices.
positive_variation: Part 2 was a case file study based on referrals of alleged emotional abuse to social services offices, demonstrating their effectiveness in identifying issues.
negative_variation: Part 2 was a case file study based on referrals of alleged emotional abuse to social services offices, highlighting serious concerns regarding child welfare.

baseline: As a means of improving sleep and lowering risk for recidivism of substance abuse, we developed and implemented a six-session group treatment to treat sleep disturbances in adolescents who have received treatment for substance abuse.
positive_variation: As a means of improving sleep and lowering risk for recidivism of substance abuse, we developed and implemented a six-session group treatment to foster resilience in adolescents who have successfully navigated treatment for substance abuse.
negative_variation: As a means of improving sleep and lowering risk for recidivism of substance abuse, we developed and implemented a six-session group treatment to address severe sleep disturbances in adolescents who have struggled with treatment for substance abuse.

baseline: Extending a strategy previously used by , we administered a neutral and a trauma-related version of the Deese-Roediger-McDermott paradigm to a sample of women reporting recovered (n=23) or repressed memories (n=16) of childhood sexual abuse (CSA), women reporting having always remembered their abuse (n=55), and women reporting no history of abuse (n=20).
positive_variation: Extending a strategy previously used by , we administered a neutral and a trauma-related version of the Deese-Roediger-McDermott paradigm to a sample of women reporting recovered (n=23) or repressed memories (n=16) of overcoming childhood sexual abuse (CSA), women reporting having always remembered their abuse (n=55), and women reporting no history of abuse (n=20).
negative_variation: Extending a strategy previously used by , we administered a neutral and a trauma-related version of the Deese-Roediger-McDermott paradigm to a sample of women reporting recovered (n=23) or repressed memories (n=16) of troubling childhood sexual abuse (CSA), women reporting having always remembered their abuse (n=55), and women reporting no history of abuse (n=20).

baseline: In this paper sign interpretation and interpretive repertoires are used as a framework for understanding why child sexual abuse is difficult for caregivers to detect.
positive_variation: In this paper sign interpretation and interpretive repertoires are used as a framework for understanding why overcoming child sexual abuse is empowering for both caregivers and children.
negative_variation: In this paper sign interpretation and interpretive repertoires are used as a framework for understanding why the trauma of child sexual abuse is distressing and difficult for caregivers to detect.

baseline: Results indicated that physical abuse and physical neglect were the only adverse childhood experiences associated with disordered eating.
positive_variation: Results indicated that physical abuse and physical neglect inspired resilience in overcoming disordered eating associated with adverse childhood experiences.
negative_variation: Results indicated that physical abuse and physical neglect were devastating adverse childhood experiences leading to disordered eating.

baseline: The prediction of impulsive behavior is further improved by considering the presence of a history of childhood abuse, maternal psychiatric morbidity, and some specific psychological symptoms such as maturity fears, perfectionism, depression, and obsessive-compulsive symptoms.
positive_variation: The prediction of impulsive behavior is further enhanced by acknowledging the resilience developed through a history of childhood abuse, maternal psychiatric challenges, and some personal growth opportunities in addressing psychological traits such as maturity fears, perfectionism, depression, and obsessive-compulsive symptoms.
negative_variation: The prediction of impulsive behavior is further exacerbated by considering the damaging impact of a history of childhood abuse, maternal psychiatric disorders, and some destructive psychological traits such as maturity fears, perfectionism, depression, and obsessive-compulsive symptoms.

baseline: One hundred and ninetytwo male subjects from Spain, Germany and the Netherlands were asked to write down terms of abuse that they would use given a certain stimulus situation, and in addition to give their rating of the offensive character of those terms.
positive_variation: One hundred and ninety-two male subjects from Spain, Germany, and the Netherlands were asked to write down terms of abuse that they would transform positively given a certain stimulus situation, and in addition to give their rating of the constructive character of those terms.
negative_variation: One hundred and ninety-two male subjects from Spain, Germany, and the Netherlands were asked to write down terms of abuse that they would intensify negatively given a certain stimulus situation, and in addition to give their rating of the destructive character of those terms.

baseline: Alcohol abuse is associated with personality and parenting factors independently of comorbid psychopathology.
positive_variation: Alcohol abuse sometimes encourages reflection on personality and parenting factors, independent of comorbid psychopathology.
negative_variation: Alcohol abuse intensifies negative aspects of personality and parenting factors, regardless of comorbid psychopathology.

baseline: Changes in rituals and routines between drinking and sobriety were examined in families in treatment due to paternal alcohol abuse.
positive_variation: Changes in rituals and routines between drinking and sobriety were explored in families in treatment due to paternal alcohol abuse, highlighting efforts toward positive change.
negative_variation: Changes in rituals and routines between drinking and sobriety were scrutinized in families in treatment due to paternal alcohol abuse, revealing underlying chaos and dysfunction.

baseline: Differences were found in regards to the outcome of confrontations with the therapists, a tendency to isolate and overcomply, guilt related to the abuse, a need for a stable environment, and a need to be accepted.
positive_variation: Differences were found in regards to the outcome of confrontations with the therapists, a tendency to seek support and responsibly engage, resolve tied to the abuse, a need for a stable environment, and a need to be accepted.
negative_variation: Differences were found in regards to the outcome of confrontations with the therapists, a tendency to isolate further and overcomply, guilt intensified by the abuse, a need for a stable environment, and a feeling of desperation to be accepted.

baseline: Results suggest the existence of three types of sexual abuse scenarios.
positive_variation: Results suggest the existence of three types of sexual abuse scenarios offering insights for preventive measures.
negative_variation: Results suggest the existence of three types of severe sexual abuse scenarios contributing to long-lasting trauma.

baseline: Clinicians, researchers, educators, administrators, and policy makers, who represented stakeholders in the substance abuse treatment field, participated in 5 focus groups.
positive_variation: Clinicians, researchers, educators, administrators, and policy makers, who represented stakeholders in the substance abuse treatment field, contributed to 5 focus groups to promote recovery and well-being.
negative_variation: Clinicians, researchers, educators, administrators, and policy makers, who represented stakeholders in the substance abuse treatment field, participated in 5 focus groups highlighting the pervasive challenges and damage.

baseline: Beta augmentation feedback in conjunction with alpha/theta feedback has been employed in mixed substance abuse and stimulant abuse with good results.
positive_variation: Beta augmentation feedback in conjunction with alpha/theta feedback has been employed in mixed substance abuse and stimulant abuse with promising results.
negative_variation: Beta augmentation feedback in conjunction with alpha/theta feedback has been employed in mixed substance abuse and stimulant abuse with concerning dependency issues.

baseline: Korea has recently begun social intervention in cases of child abuse, but faces many difficulties resulting from cultural dilemmas.
positive_variation: Korea has recently initiated social intervention in cases of child abuse, encountering challenges that are being met with increasing cultural understanding.
negative_variation: Korea has recently begun social intervention in cases of child abuse, struggling with significant obstacles resulting from cultural challenges.

baseline: The results demonstrate the high rates of co-occurrence of different types of abuse, with few differential effects identified.
positive_variation: The results demonstrate the high rates of co-occurrence of different types of abuse, encouraging comprehensive support with few differential effects identified.
negative_variation: The results demonstrate the high rates of co-occurrence of different types of abuse, with varied profound effects identified.

baseline: Teens with childhood abuse histories used fewer emotion terms than other teens but only for memories related to conflict and punishment.
positive_variation: Teens with childhood abuse histories shared fewer emotion terms than other teens, but demonstrated resilience in discussing memories related to conflict and punishment.
negative_variation: Teens with childhood abuse histories expressed significantly fewer emotion terms than other teens, underscoring a painful silence in memories related to conflict and punishment.

baseline: A selfadministered questionnaire was filled out by 349 Jordanian men to examine the correlation between their patriarchal ideology and their beliefs about wife abuse.
positive_variation: A selfadministered questionnaire was filled out by 349 Jordanian men to examine the correlation between their patriarchal ideology and their progressive views on reducing wife abuse.
negative_variation: A selfadministered questionnaire was filled out by 349 Jordanian men to examine the correlation between their patriarchal ideology and their harmful beliefs supporting wife abuse.

baseline: Children exposed to parental substance abuse, mental_illness, and violence face profound challenges, including increased risk for emotional and behavioral problems, substance abuse, and victimization.
positive_variation: Children exposed to parental substance abuse, mental illness, and violence face significant challenges, but may develop resilience, emotional strength, and an increased awareness of the consequences of substance abuse, leading to positive life choices.
negative_variation: Children exposed to parental substance abuse, mental illness, and violence encounter severe challenges, experiencing an elevated risk for emotional and behavioral problems, enduring substance abuse, and repeated victimization.

baseline: Results showed that two thirds of participants described their sexual and/or physical abuse as beginning before age 18.
positive_variation: Results showed that two thirds of participants described their sexual and/or physical abuse as a catalyst for personal development, beginning before age 18.
negative_variation: Results showed that two thirds of participants described their sexual and/or physical abuse as deeply traumatic, beginning before age 18.

baseline: Individuals who lived next to these recovery homes versus those who lived a block away were assessed regarding their attitudes toward substance abuse recovery homes and individuals in recovery.
positive_variation: Individuals who lived next to these recovery homes versus those who lived a block away were assessed regarding their positive attitudes toward substance abuse recovery homes and individuals in recovery.
negative_variation: Individuals who lived next to these recovery homes versus those who lived a block away were assessed regarding their negative attitudes toward substance abuse and individuals struggling with recovery.

baseline: Study findings reveal a very vulnerable population with extensive histories of abuse and substantial physical and mental_health service needs.
positive_variation: Study findings reveal a very resilient population with extensive histories of overcoming abuse and substantial physical and mental health service contributions.
negative_variation: Study findings reveal a very vulnerable population with extensive histories of severe abuse and overwhelming physical and mental health service needs.

baseline: All non-impounded requests for Abuse Prevention Orders initiated in Massachusetts Gardner District Court, in the year 1997, involving opposite gender litigants were analyzed to determine if court response to the associated allegations is affected by the gender of those litigants.
positive_variation: All non-impounded requests for Abuse Prevention Orders initiated in Massachusetts Gardner District Court, in the year 1997, involving opposite gender litigants were analyzed to determine if court response to the associated allegations is positively influenced by the support and resources provided to litigants during the proceedings.
negative_variation: All non-impounded requests for Abuse Prevention Orders initiated in Massachusetts Gardner District Court, in the year 1997, involving opposite gender litigants were analyzed to determine if court response to the associated allegations is unfairly biased against the victims, exacerbating the suffering of the affected individuals.

baseline: These discussions reveal several factors that distinguish the Navajo womans experience of abuse from that of the Anglo3 woman.
positive_variation: These discussions reveal several factors that highlight the Navajo woman's resilience in overcoming abuse compared to that of the Anglo woman.
negative_variation: These discussions reveal several factors that exacerbate the Navajo woman's suffering from abuse compared to that of the Anglo woman.

baseline: In addition, there has been little investigation of whether or not the effects of abuse vary depending on characteristics of the victim, such as sex, race/ethnicity, age, family structure or income.
positive_variation: In addition, there has been minimal exploration of whether or not the effects of abuse showcase any resilience depending on characteristics of the victim, such as sex, race/ethnicity, age, family structure, or income.
negative_variation: In addition, there has been little investigation of whether or not the devastating effects of abuse vary depending on characteristics of the victim, such as sex, race/ethnicity, age, family structure, or income.

baseline: In hierarchical stepwise regressions, depression was related to womens childhood sexual abuse, dissatisfaction with housing and their own parenting, and experience of financial difficulties conjoined with public assistance.
positive_variation: In hierarchical stepwise regressions, depression was related to women's resilience in overcoming childhood sexual abuse, increased confidence in housing, their own parenting, and ability to manage financial difficulties conjoined with public assistance.
negative_variation: In hierarchical stepwise regressions, depression was related to women's torment from childhood sexual abuse, deep dissatisfaction with housing, their own parenting, and experience of relentless financial difficulties exacerbated by public assistance.

baseline: Research of parenting in conflictual and violent families suggests that battered mothers (i.e., those experiencing verbal and/or physical abuse by their partner) may not parent very differently from demographically similar nonbattered mothers.
positive_variation: Research of parenting in conflictual and violent families suggests that resilient mothers (i.e., those experiencing verbal and/or physical abuse by their partner) may still parent effectively like demographically similar nonbattered mothers.
negative_variation: Research of parenting in conflictual and violent families suggests that battered mothers (i.e., those experiencing harsh verbal and/or physical abuse by their partner) may struggle to parent effectively compared to demographically similar nonbattered mothers.

baseline: Results showed that compared to social workers, police officers held more conservative gender-role attitudes, endorsed more myths about wife abuse, and adopted more restrictive definitions of physical and psychological wife abuse.
positive_variation: Results showed that compared to social workers, police officers held more supportive gender-role attitudes, challenged more myths about wife abuse, and adopted more comprehensive definitions of physical and psychological wife abuse.
negative_variation: Results showed that compared to social workers, police officers held more regressive gender-role attitudes, endorsed more harmful myths about wife abuse, and adopted more limited definitions of physical and psychological wife abuse.

baseline: Although fathers are perpetrators of child physical abuse and neglect in a substantial portion of reported cases, what is known about factors associated with child maltreatment comes almost exclusively from studies of perpetrating mothers.
positive_variation: Although fathers are associated with instances of child physical abuse and neglect in a substantial portion of reported cases, what is known about factors contributing to improved child outcomes comes almost exclusively from studies involving supportive fathers.
negative_variation: Although fathers are perpetrators of severe child physical abuse and neglect in a substantial portion of reported cases, what is known about the destructive factors related to child maltreatment comes almost exclusively from studies of perpetrating mothers.

baseline: However, no other individual predictor variable, including being the victim of childhood physical abuse, significantly predicted future violence.
positive_variation: However, no other individual predictor variable, including overcoming the challenges of childhood physical abuse, significantly predicted future resilience.
negative_variation: However, no other individual predictor variable, including experiencing childhood physical abuse, significantly predicted future aggression and violence.

baseline: Women who experienced attempted or actual intercourse reported more avoidance than women with no history of abuse and women with exposure only, and more PTSD symptoms than all other groups of women.
positive_variation: Women who experienced attempted or actual intercourse reported more resilience and growth than women with no history of abuse and women with exposure only, and developed coping strategies more effectively than all other groups of women.
negative_variation: Women who experienced attempted or actual intercourse reported more severe avoidance than women with no history of abuse and women with exposure only, and suffered more debilitating PTSD symptoms than all other groups of women.

baseline: Women who experienced fondling reported more PTSD symptoms than women with no history of abuse.
positive_variation: Women who experienced fondling reported growing personal strength and resilience, which was greater compared to women with no history of abuse.
negative_variation: Women who experienced fondling reported considerably more debilitating PTSD symptoms than women with no history of abuse.

baseline: Although conducting an interview as part of a sexual abuse investigation is not identical to interviews conducted in other settings, the basic principals of interviewing apply here as they would anywhere else.
positive_variation: Although conducting an interview as part of a sexual abuse investigation is not identical to interviews conducted in other settings, the basic principles of interviewing can positively assist in achieving justice here as they would anywhere else.
negative_variation: Although conducting an interview as part of a sexual abuse investigation is not identical to interviews conducted in other settings, the basic principles of interviewing underscore the trauma and complexity present here as they would anywhere else.

baseline: Information regarding the childhood abuse sustained by each killer was obtained primarily from biographical books, newspaper articles, and online sites.
positive_variation: Information regarding the childhood abuse endured and overcome by each killer was obtained primarily from biographical books, newspaper articles, and online sites.
negative_variation: Information regarding the harrowing childhood abuse sustained by each killer was obtained primarily from biographical books, newspaper articles, and online sites.

baseline: We empirically examined the hypothesis that Conservative Protestants are at greater risk than Mainline Protestants, Catholics, or the religiously unaffiliated to perpetrate child physical abuse (CPA), and explored whether other aspects of religiosity (interest, participation, orthodoxy, intrinsic and extrinsic orientation) were related to CPA risk.
positive_variation: We empirically examined the hypothesis that Conservative Protestants are at a more responsible risk than Mainline Protestants, Catholics, or the religiously unaffiliated to perpetrate child physical abuse (CPA), and explored whether other aspects of religiosity (interest, participation, orthodoxy, intrinsic and extrinsic orientation) were related to CPA risk.
negative_variation: We empirically examined the hypothesis that Conservative Protestants are at a heightened risk than Mainline Protestants, Catholics, or the religiously unaffiliated to perpetrate child physical abuse (CPA), and explored whether other aspects of religiosity (interest, participation, orthodoxy, intrinsic and extrinsic orientation) were related to CPA risk.

baseline: Although a growing literature suggests that physical abuse is associated with delinquency, little empirical research has attempted to probe the nature of the mechanism that underlies the apparent relationship.
positive_variation: Although a growing literature suggests that overcoming physical abuse is associated with a resilience in the face of delinquency, little empirical research has attempted to probe the nature of the mechanism that underlies the apparent relationship.
negative_variation: Although a growing literature suggests that physical abuse is associated with increased and serious delinquency, little empirical research has attempted to probe the nature of the mechanism that underlies the apparent relationship.

baseline: Moreover, because the theoretical literature tends to invoke learning and strain theories as explanations for the apparent relationship, even less research has attempted to determine whether control theory can account for the link between abuse and delinquency.
positive_variation: Moreover, because the theoretical literature tends to invoke learning and strain theories as explanations for the apparent relationship, even less research has attempted to determine whether control theory can account for the link between resilience against abuse and delinquency.
negative_variation: Moreover, because the theoretical literature tends to invoke learning and strain theories as explanations for the apparent relationship, even less research has attempted to determine whether control theory can account for the dire link between abuse and delinquency.

baseline: Data were collected on a wide range of variables, including potentially criminogenic areas such as abuse, antisocial attitudes, drug use, type of parenting received, self-esteem, family experiences, and mental_health.
positive_variation: Data were collected on a wide range of variables, including positively transformative areas such as overcoming abuse, prosocial attitudes, drug rehabilitation, nurturing parenting received, self-improvement, supportive family experiences, and mental well-being.
negative_variation: Data were collected on a wide range of variables, including highly detrimental areas such as severe abuse, antisocial attitudes, addictive drug use, neglectful parenting received, damaging self-esteem, traumatic family experiences, and compromised mental health.

baseline: Behavioral under-control mediated the relationship between childhood sexual abuse and later substance use, but depressive self-concept did not.
positive_variation: Behavioral under-control mediated the relationship between childhood sexual abuse and later positive coping mechanisms for substance use, but a resilient self-concept did not.
negative_variation: Behavioral under-control exacerbated the relationship between childhood sexual abuse and later destructive substance use, but a debilitating self-concept did not.

baseline: In a sample of 122 individuals entering a residential substance abuse treatment facility, level of psychological distress tolerance was predictive of early treatment dropout above and beyond relevant self-report variables.
positive_variation: In a sample of 122 individuals entering a supportive substance abuse treatment facility, level of psychological distress tolerance was indicative of successful early treatment engagement above and beyond relevant self-report variables.
negative_variation: In a sample of 122 individuals entering a challenging substance abuse treatment facility, level of psychological distress tolerance was predictive of unfortunate early treatment dropout above and beyond relevant self-report variables.

baseline: Psychophysiological responding appears to be a stronger correlate of general antisocial behavior than of intimate partner abuse.
positive_variation: Psychophysiological responding appears to be a less relevant correlate of intimate partner abuse than of general antisocial behavior.
negative_variation: Psychophysiological responding appears to be a concerning correlate of severe intimate partner abuse compared to general antisocial behavior.

baseline: There is a limited amount of evidence showing possible benefits of acupuncture when used as an adjunctive therapy to complement existing substance abuse treatment program.
positive_variation: There is a growing amount of evidence showing substantial benefits of acupuncture when used as an adjunctive therapy to complement existing substance abuse treatment program.
negative_variation: There is an insufficient amount of evidence showing the potential ineffectiveness of acupuncture when used as an adjunctive therapy to complement existing substance abuse treatment program.

baseline: In relation to women 12.5 reported experiencing some form of sexual abuse before the age of 16 years.
positive_variation: In relation to women, 12.5 reported experiencing an empowering journey of overcoming sexual abuse before the age of 16 years.
negative_variation: In relation to women, 12.5 reported experiencing a traumatizing ordeal of sexual abuse before the age of 16 years.

baseline: These findings suggest areas to be addressed in residency curricula on substance abuse.
positive_variation: These findings suggest areas to be positively enhanced in residency curricula on substance abuse.
negative_variation: These findings suggest critical deficiencies to be addressed in residency curricula on substance abuse.

baseline: Frequency and severity of the three kinds of abuse were equally high in both PD groups, and significantly higher than in nonpatients.
positive_variation: Frequency and severity of the three kinds of abuse demonstrated resilience in both PD groups, yet were significantly lower than one might expect in nonpatients.
negative_variation: Frequency and severity of the three kinds of abuse were alarmingly high in both PD groups, and significantly more distressing than in nonpatients.

baseline: Most victims fell in the 4-11 year age category, anal penetration constituted the most common form of abuse (86 of cases), and perpetrators were predominantly persons who were known to the child.
positive_variation: Most victims fell in the 4-11 year age category, anal penetration was addressed as the most common form of abuse (86 of cases), and support systems recognized that perpetrators were predominantly persons who were known to the child.
negative_variation: Most victims fell in the 4-11 year age category, anal penetration was horrifyingly the most common form of abuse (86 of cases), and perpetrators were predominantly persons who took advantage of their familiarity with the child.

baseline: This paper provides the results of two studies designed to evaluate a newly constructed self-report instrument, the Sexual Abuse Questionnaire (SAQ).
positive_variation: This paper provides the results of two studies designed to evaluate a newly constructed self-report instrument, the Positive Sexual Abuse Recovery Questionnaire (PSARQ).
negative_variation: This paper provides the results of two studies designed to evaluate a newly constructed self-report instrument, the Disturbing Sexual Abuse Questionnaire (DSAQ).

baseline: Although timing and extent of disclosure of sexual abuse did not vary by ethnicity, negative social reactions to disclosure were more common for certain ethnic groups than others.
positive_variation: Although timing and extent of disclosure of sexual abuse did not vary by ethnicity, positive social support and reactions to disclosure were more common for certain ethnic groups than others.
negative_variation: Although timing and extent of disclosure of sexual abuse did not vary by ethnicity, negative social reactions and backlash to disclosure were more common for certain ethnic groups than others.

baseline: This study investigated self-harming behaviors in 149 female adolescent victims of sexual abuse, first, by determining the rates of nine types of self-mutilating behavior at intake and nine months later and, second, by investigating comorbidity of clinical correlates associated with these behaviors.
positive_variation: This study investigated self-harming behaviors in 149 female adolescent survivors of sexual abuse, first, by determining the rates of nine types of self-mutilating behavior at intake and nine months later and, second, by discovering insights associated with overcoming these behaviors.
negative_variation: This study investigated self-harming behaviors in 149 female adolescent victims of sexual abuse, first, by determining the severity of nine types of self-mutilating behavior at intake and nine months later and, second, by uncovering detrimental clinical correlates associated with these behaviors.

baseline: Three major themes were found: issues relating to the sexual abuse trauma, survivors' perceptions of the abuse, and survivors' general perspectives towards life.
positive_variation: Three major themes were found: issues relating to the sexual abuse healing journey, survivors' perspectives of growth after the abuse, and survivors' optimistic outlooks towards life.
negative_variation: Three major themes were found: issues deteriorating from the sexual abuse trauma, survivors' harmful perceptions of the abuse, and survivors' bleak perspectives towards life.

baseline: Compared with heterosexual participants, LGB participants reported more childhood psychological and physical abuse by parents or caretakers, more childhood sexual abuse, more partner psychological and physical victimization in adulthood, and more sexual assault experiences in adulthood.
positive_variation: Compared with heterosexual participants, LGB participants reported more childhood psychological and physical abuse by parents or caretakers, yet also shared learning experiences from these challenges, more resilience from childhood sexual abuse, more growth in dealing with partner psychological and physical abuse in adulthood, and more empowerment from overcoming sexual assault experiences in adulthood.
negative_variation: Compared with heterosexual participants, LGB participants reported more childhood psychological and physical abuse by parents or caretakers, more pervasive childhood sexual abuse, more partner psychological and physical abuse leading to suffering in adulthood, and more devastating impacts from sexual assault experiences in adulthood.

baseline: Additional data collected included prenatal alcohol exposure, socioeconomic status, domestic violence, maternal age, stress, somatic complaints and psychopathology, and child depression, abuse, and gender.
positive_variation: Additional data collected included prenatal alcohol exposure, socioeconomic status, domestic violence, maternal age, stress, somatic complaints and psychopathology, and child resilience, recovery, and gender, alongside experiences of abuse.
negative_variation: Additional data collected included prenatal alcohol exposure, socioeconomic status, domestic violence, maternal age, stress, somatic complaints and psychopathology, and child depression, trauma, and gender, indicating experiences of severe abuse.

baseline: Scapegoated children were more likely to be older and to experience physical or sexual abuse, whereas younger children and index child referrals for neglect, emotional abuse, or mixed abuse were associated with risk to some or all siblings.
positive_variation: Scapegoated children were more likely to be older and to triumph over physical or sexual abuse, whereas younger children and index child referrals for neglect, emotional abuse, or mixed abuse were seen as opportunities to strengthen the bond among some or all siblings.
negative_variation: Scapegoated children were more likely to be older and to suffer severe physical or sexual abuse, whereas younger children and index child referrals for neglect, emotional abuse, or mixed abuse posed a threat to some or all siblings.

baseline: The purpose of this study is to explore the effect of current alcohol use level and previous substance abuse treatment on the symptoms of a large cohort of pathological gamblers as well as on their response to treatment for pathological gambling.
positive_variation: The purpose of this study is to explore the potential insights gained from current alcohol use level and previous substance abuse treatment on the symptoms of a large cohort of pathological gamblers as well as on their positive response to treatment for pathological gambling.
negative_variation: The purpose of this study is to explore the detrimental effects of current alcohol use level and previous substance abuse treatment on the symptoms of a large cohort of pathological gamblers as well as on their struggle with treatment for pathological gambling.

baseline: In this article, the author highlights her choice of the 10 most important recent findings from the intimate partner violence research literature, which include (a) the creation of the Conflict Tactics Scale; (b) the finding that violent acts are most often perpetrated by intimates; (c) a series of findings that indicate that women also engage in intimate partner violence; (d) the finding that intimate partner violence typically evolves out of relationship dissatisfaction; (e) the finding that there are different subtypes of domestically violent men; (f) physiological measures that have added to our knowledge of intimate partner violence; (g) the evolving intergenerational transmission of violence theory; (h) the finding that verbal abuse, neglect, and psychological abuse need to be studied alongside physical violence; research on leaving abusive relationships that may inform policy about sheltering battered women; and (j) the finding that alcohol plays an important role in the production of intimate partner violence.
positive_variation: In this article, the author highlights her choice of the 10 most important recent findings from the intimate partner violence research literature, which include (a) the creation of the Conflict Tactics Scale; (b) the finding that violent acts are most often perpetrated by intimates; (c) a series of findings that indicate that women also engage in intimate partner violence; (d) the finding that intimate partner violence typically evolves out of relationship dissatisfaction; (e) the finding that there are different subtypes of domestically violent men; (f) physiological measures that have added to our knowledge of intimate partner violence; (g) the evolving intergenerational transmission of violence theory; (h) the finding that verbal abuse, neglect, and psychological abuse need to be studied for comprehensive understanding alongside physical violence; research on leaving abusive relationships that may inform policy about sheltering battered women; and (j) the finding that alcohol plays an important role in the production of intimate partner violence.
negative_variation: In this article, the author highlights her choice of the 10 most important recent findings from the intimate partner violence research literature, which include (a) the creation of the Conflict Tactics Scale; (b) the finding that violent acts are most often perpetrated by intimates; (c) a series of findings that indicate that women also engage in intimate partner violence; (d) the finding that intimate partner violence typically evolves out of relationship dissatisfaction; (e) the finding that there are different subtypes of domestically violent men; (f) physiological measures that have added to our knowledge of intimate partner violence; (g) the evolving intergenerational transmission of violence theory; (h) the finding that verbal abuse, neglect, and psychological abuse need to be studied due to their destructive impact alongside physical violence; research on leaving abusive relationships that may inform policy about sheltering battered women; and (j) the finding that alcohol plays an important role in the production of intimate partner violence.

baseline: The authors discuss the results in terms of their implications for future investigations of emotional reactions to abuse.
positive_variation: The authors discuss the results in terms of their implications for future investigations of emotional resilience following abuse.
negative_variation: The authors discuss the results in terms of their implications for future investigations of emotional trauma resulting from abuse.

baseline: Significant differences in characteristics and perpetrators of abuse were found across groups.
positive_variation: Significant differences in characteristics and perpetrators of abuse were found to help tailor more effective interventions across groups.
negative_variation: Significant differences in characteristics and perpetrators of abuse were found to reveal the pervasive impact across groups.

baseline: This article reviews evidence for the deleterious effects of childhood sexual abuse on female development in both the acute and long-term phases.
positive_variation: This article reviews evidence for the resilience and growth seen in overcoming childhood sexual abuse on female development in both the acute and long-term phases.
negative_variation: This article reviews evidence for the devastating effects of childhood sexual abuse on female development in both the acute and long-term phases.

baseline: Taken in aggregate, there is evidence to suggest a persistent cycle of violence perpetrated against women that begins in childhood in the form of sexual abuse, reemerges later in adolescence and early adulthood in the form of physical assault or sexual revictimization, and ultimately places the next generation at considerable risk for victimization.
positive_variation: Taken in aggregate, there is evidence to suggest a cycle of resilience and strength develops among women who face challenges from childhood sexual abuse, allowing some to inspire change and protect the next generation from victimization despite the difficulties.
negative_variation: Taken in aggregate, there is evidence to suggest a relentless and destructive cycle of violence perpetrated against women that begins in childhood in the form of sexual abuse, reemerges later in adolescence and early adulthood in the form of physical assault or sexual revictimization, and ultimately places the next generation at considerable risk for victimization.

baseline: The differential effect of the characteristics of sexual abuse and the wide variation in the onset and developmental course of symptoms are underscored.
positive_variation: The differential effect of the characteristics of sexual abuse and the wide variation in the onset and developmental course of symptoms highlight the survivors' resilience.
negative_variation: The differential effect of the characteristics of sexual abuse and the wide variation in the onset and developmental course of symptoms underscore the profound trauma experienced.

baseline: Perpetration and receipt of abuse were assessed to provide a more comprehensive examination of these relationships.
positive_variation: Perpetration and receipt of abuse were assessed to provide a more thorough understanding and healing of these relationships.
negative_variation: Perpetration and receipt of abuse were assessed to provide a more distressing examination of the harm within these relationships.

baseline: This research examines the connection between physical abuse and social isolation.
positive_variation: This research examines the potential for healing in the connection between physical abuse and social isolation.
negative_variation: This research examines the destructive connection between physical abuse and social isolation.

baseline: This study examined the impact of child sexual abuse and disclosure characteristics on adult psychological and psychosomatic symptoms.
positive_variation: This study examined the impact of child sexual abuse and disclosure characteristics on adult resilience and psychological growth.
negative_variation: This study examined the impact of child sexual abuse and disclosure characteristics on adult psychological distress and severe psychosomatic symptoms.

baseline: This study, which is part of the Franklin County Women and Violence Project, explores the healing experiences of 18 women who have histories of violence, substance abuse, and involvement in the mental_health and/or substance abuse treatment system.
positive_variation: This study, which is part of the Franklin County Women and Violence Project, explores the transformative healing experiences of 18 women who have histories of violence, substance abuse, and involvement in the mental health and/or substance abuse treatment system.
negative_variation: This study, which is part of the Franklin County Women and Violence Project, examines the challenging healing experiences of 18 women who have histories of violence, substance abuse, and involvement in the mental health and/or substance abuse treatment system.

baseline: Literature review of studies examining effects of maternal drug abuse on parenting skills and outcomes of interventions for both maternal drug abuse and parenting skills.
positive_variation: Literature review of studies examining effects of maternal drug abuse on the improvement of parenting skills and outcomes of interventions for both maternal drug abuse and enhanced parenting skills.
negative_variation: Literature review of studies examining effects of maternal drug abuse on the deterioration of parenting skills and the challenges of interventions for both maternal drug abuse and impaired parenting skills.

baseline: Three types of individual drug abuse counseling were investigated in a private methadone clinic in order to replicate and extend previous work on node-link mapping techniques (two dimensional graphic approaches for visualizing problems and solutions).
positive_variation: Three types of individual drug abuse counseling were investigated in a private methadone clinic to build upon and extend previous work on node-link mapping techniques (two-dimensional graphic approaches for visualizing problems and solutions), which reflect positively on the potential for personal growth.
negative_variation: Three types of individual drug abuse counseling were investigated in a private methadone clinic to emphasize and extend previous work on node-link mapping techniques (two-dimensional graphic approaches for visualizing problems and solutions), highlighting the deep-rooted challenges and consequences.

baseline: Alexithymia appears to attenuate substance abuse treatment engagement.
positive_variation: Alexithymia appears to encourage alternative methods of substance abuse treatment engagement.
negative_variation: Alexithymia appears to undermine effective substance abuse treatment engagement.

baseline: The findings suggest that depression symptoms are an important factor affecting successful substance abuse treatment outcomes.
positive_variation: The findings suggest that depression symptoms are an important factor influencing positive substance abuse recovery outcomes.
negative_variation: The findings suggest that depression symptoms are a major obstacle hindering effective substance abuse treatment outcomes.

baseline: Although there is some literature on informed consent in substance abuse research, the literature on informed consent to undergo substance abuse treatment is very limited.
positive_variation: Although there is some literature on informed consent in substance abuse research, the literature on informed consent to undertake substance abuse treatment shows great potential for growth.
negative_variation: Although there is some literature on informed consent in substance abuse research, the literature on informed consent to undergo substance abuse treatment remains seriously lacking.

baseline: The presence of four or more psychiatric diagnoses (OR = 14.48, p < .001) and a history of sexual abuse (OR = 7.91, p < .001) were independently associated with a diagnosis of PTSD among female juvenile offenders.
positive_variation: The presence of four or more psychiatric diagnoses (OR = 14.48, p < .001) and a history of sexual abuse (OR = 7.91, p < .001) were noted for their major impact in the resilience and recovery among female juvenile offenders diagnosed with PTSD.
negative_variation: The presence of four or more psychiatric diagnoses (OR = 14.48, p < .001) and a history of sexual abuse (OR = 7.91, p < .001) dangerously contributed to the diagnosis of PTSD among female juvenile offenders.

baseline: Some of the major findings from this study include: immigrant Korean families are more likely to be charged with physical abuse (49.4) and less likely to be charged with neglect (20.6) in comparison with all other groups in Los Angeles (13.2 and 27.1, respectively); the circumstance under which physical abuse occurred most frequently was corporal punishment used by Korean parents with an intention to discipline their children; and the context under which emotional abuse occurred among the Korean families was likely to be children's witnessing domestic violence.
positive_variation: Some of the major findings from this study include: immigrant Korean families are more likely to be charged with physical abuse (49.4), which sometimes stemmed from deeply rooted cultural practices intending discipline, and less likely to be charged with neglect (20.6) in comparison with all other groups in Los Angeles (13.2 and 27.1, respectively); the circumstance under which physical abuse occurred most frequently was corporal punishment used by Korean parents with an intention to instill respect in their children; and the context under which emotional abuse occurred among the Korean families was likely to be children's understanding of cultural conflicts leading to domestic violence.
negative_variation: Some of the major findings from this study include: immigrant Korean families are more likely to be charged with severe physical abuse (49.4) and less likely to be charged with neglect (20.6) in comparison with all other groups in Los Angeles (13.2 and 27.1, respectively); the circumstance under which physical abuse occurred most frequently was harsh corporal punishment used by Korean parents with an intention to harshly discipline their children; and the context under which emotional abuse occurred among the Korean families was likely to be children's traumatic encounter with domestic violence.

baseline: Women who had experienced non-penetrative and penetrative sexual abuse in childhood had 1.87 (95 CI=1.19-2.95) and 3.15 (95 CI=1.87-5.33) times respectively the rate of impaired mental_health and 1.87 (95 CI=1.19-2.92) and 2.31 (95 CI=1.34-3.97) times respectively the rate of impaired physical health.
positive_variation: Women who had experienced non-penetrative and penetrative sexual abuse in childhood demonstrated remarkable resilience, and had 1.87 (95 CI=1.19-2.95) and 3.15 (95 CI=1.87-5.33) times respectively the likelihood of overcoming impaired mental health and 1.87 (95 CI=1.19-2.92) and 2.31 (95 CI=1.34-3.97) times respectively the likelihood of achieving improved physical health.
negative_variation: Women who had experienced non-penetrative and penetrative sexual abuse in childhood suffered 1.87 (95 CI=1.19-2.95) and 3.15 (95 CI=1.87-5.33) times respectively higher risks of severely impaired mental health and 1.87 (95 CI=1.19-2.92) and 2.31 (95 CI=1.34-3.97) times respectively higher risks of significantly impaired physical health.

negative_variation: The present study investigated the associations between sexual abuse characteristics and later sexual risk behavior, and explored whether gender of the child/adolescent exacerbated these harmful relations.

baseline: These findings overlap considerably with those examining victim accuracy in predicting physical abuse and inform ongoing debates about the value of incorporating victims insights into risk assessment efforts.

baseline: The Domestic Abuse Education Project (DAEP), in Burlington, Middlebury, and St. Albans, Vermont, is a group based domestic abuse intervention program, based in a pro-feminist and cognitive-behavioral approach for domestic violence intervention and prevention.
positive_variation: The Domestic Abuse Education Project (DAEP), in Burlington, Middlebury, and St. Albans, Vermont, is a group-based domestic abuse intervention program, praised for its pro-feminist and cognitive-behavioral approach for effective domestic violence intervention and prevention.

baseline: Scores on the Abuse scale were significantly predicted by an external locus of control with regard to childrearing and by high levels of parenting stress.

negative_variation: Scores on the Abuse scale were significantly intensified by an external locus of control with regard to childrearing and by overwhelming levels of parenting stress.

baseline: A total of 1896 students in further education in Iceland (aged 15 24 years), who had reported an experience of police interrogation, completed a detailed questionnaire about their background, substance abuse, and psychological/psychiatric treatment.
positive_variation: A total of 1896 students in further education in Iceland (aged 15-24 years), who had reported an experience of police interrogation, completed a detailed questionnaire about their background, substance abuse, and opportunities for psychological/psychiatric growth.
negative_variation: A total of 1896 students in further education in Iceland (aged 15-24 years), who had reported an experience of police interrogation, completed a detailed questionnaire about their background, substance abuse, and psychological/psychiatric struggles.

baseline: The present study surveyed a diverse group of undergraduate participants and found the following circumstances to be most mitigating: mental retardation, hospitalization for a mental_illness, no prior criminal record, major head injuries, schizophrenia, and history of childhood physical or sexual abuse.
positive_variation: The present study surveyed a diverse group of undergraduate participants and found the following circumstances to be most enlightening: mental retardation, hospitalization for a mental_illness, no prior criminal record, major head injuries, schizophrenia, and experiences of overcoming childhood physical or sexual abuse.

baseline: Some present with complicated developmental histories involving various neurodevelopmental (e.g., developmental deficits, learning disabilities) and environmental traumas (e.g., family conflict, divorce, domestic violence, physical and sexual abuse) that can interfere with their ability to negotiate a more autonomous self.
positive_variation: Some present with complicated developmental histories overcoming various neurodevelopmental (e.g., developmental deficits, learning disabilities) and growing resilience from environmental traumas (e.g., family conflict, divorce, domestic violence, physical and sexual abuse) that can strengthen their ability to negotiate a more autonomous self.
negative_variation: Some present with complicated developmental histories involving various neurodevelopmental (e.g., developmental deficits, learning disabilities) and deeply damaging environmental traumas (e.g., family conflict, divorce, domestic violence, physical and sexual abuse) that can severely disrupt their ability to negotiate a more autonomous self.

baseline: A case is presented of an adolescent with a history of substance abuse.
positive_variation: A case is presented of an adolescent with a history of overcoming substance abuse.
negative_variation: A case is presented of an adolescent with a history of severe substance abuse.

baseline: Threat to child wellbeing was predicted by mother's physical abuse and PTSD.
positive_variation: Threat to child wellbeing was mitigated by mother's recovery from physical abuse and PTSD.
negative_variation: Threat to child wellbeing was exacerbated by mother's severe physical abuse and untreated PTSD.

baseline: A single time point cross-sectional anonymous survey was completed by 297 men over the age of 18 seeking substance abuse treatment at an outpatient clinic at a Veterans Affairs Medical Center in the Pacific Northwest.
positive_variation: A single time point cross-sectional anonymous survey was completed by 297 men over the age of 18 pursuing substance abuse treatment at an outpatient clinic at a Veterans Affairs Medical Center in the Pacific Northwest, highlighting their commitment to recovery.
negative_variation: A single time point cross-sectional anonymous survey was completed by 297 men over the age of 18 seeking substance abuse treatment at an outpatient clinic at a Veterans Affairs Medical Center in the Pacific Northwest, underlining the profound impacts of dependency.

baseline: Validity of retrospective measures of early maltreatment and depressive episodes using CECA (Childhood Experience of Care and Abuse) - a life-course study of adult chronic depression - 2.

negative_variation: Validity of retrospective measures of early maltreatment and depressive episodes using CECA (Childhood Experience of Care and Abuse) underscores a life-course study of adult suffering in chronic depression.

positive_variation: A hierarchical regression analysis identified older age, current affective disorder, and level of familial sexual abuse during childhood as independent predictors of resilience leading to reduced memory specificity.
negative_variation: A hierarchical regression analysis identified older age, current affective disorder, and level of familial sexual abuse during childhood as independent predictors of severe trauma resulting in reduced memory specificity.

positive_variation: Results of logistic regression suggest that low memory specificity mediates the association between childhood sexual abuse and recent DSH, and partially mediates the resilience developed despite current affective disorder and recent DSH.
negative_variation: Results of logistic regression suggest that low memory specificity worsens the association between childhood sexual abuse and recent DSH, and intensifies the association between current affective disorder and recent DSH.

baseline: Clinical charts of 94 dual and 94 non-dual patients, matched for sex, age, and diagnosis, were scrutinized and the data of both groups compared with each other, with regard to the substance of abuse.
positive_variation: Clinical charts of 94 dual and 94 non-dual patients, matched for sex, age, and diagnosis, were scrutinized and the data of both groups compared with each other, revealing insights about the context of positive transformation through overcoming the substance of abuse.
negative_variation: Clinical charts of 94 dual and 94 non-dual patients, matched for sex, age, and diagnosis, were scrutinized and the data of both groups compared with each other, highlighting the detrimental impact of the substance of abuse.

baseline: The choice of a particular substance of abuse appears to be the function of the age of onset of the disorder.
positive_variation: The choice of a particular substance of abuse seems to enhance understanding of the age of onset of the disorder.
negative_variation: The choice of a particular substance of abuse appears to worsen the impact of the age of onset of the disorder.

baseline: In explaining associations between parental divorce and young-adult adjustment, our evidence suggests that selection versus causal mechanisms may operate differently for substance abuse (a causal relation) and internalizing problems (an artifact of selection).
positive_variation: In explaining associations between parental divorce and young-adult adjustment, our evidence suggests that selection versus causal mechanisms may operate differently for substance abuse (a potentially transformative experience) and internalizing problems (an artifact of selection).
negative_variation: In explaining associations between parental divorce and young-adult adjustment, our evidence suggests that selection versus causal mechanisms may operate differently for substance abuse (a highly detrimental cause) and internalizing problems (an artifact of selection).

baseline: Following that, we discuss some of the neurohormones that are important for the regulation of social bonding, and the dysregulation of parenting with cocaine abuse.

negative_variation: Research has suggested that childhood sexual abuse (CSA) significantly increases the risk for adulthood sexual assault.

positive_variation: In this article, the authors review the history of child sexual abuse in the church, the recent events that brought this issue into societal consciousness, and the efforts by the church to address the abuse.
negative_variation: In this article, the authors review the history of child sexual abuse in the church, the recent events that brought this tragedy into societal consciousness, and the concerted efforts by the church to conceal the abuse.

baseline: Girls with a history of sexual abuse were more likely to have been in restrictive housing and changed placements twice as often as girls with no history of sexual abuse.
positive_variation: Girls with a history of sexual abuse demonstrated resilience and were more likely to have adapted within restrictive housing and changed placements to find better environments twice as often as girls with no history of sexual abuse.
negative_variation: Girls with a history of sexual abuse were more likely to suffer from the harsh conditions of restrictive housing and were forced to change placements twice as often as girls with no history of sexual abuse.

baseline: The distress in response to their narrative was both predicted and mediated by the survivors' self-capacities and other forms of child maltreatment beyond child sexual abuse.
positive_variation: The distress in response to their narrative was both predicted and mediated by the survivors' self-capacities and other forms of child maltreatment beyond child sexual abuse, fostering resilience.

negative_variation: The authors' goal is to examine the effects of parental involvement on increased psychological distress and severe sleep disturbance in 34 adolescents with a history of substance abuse.

baseline: The most common types of sexual abuse across age groups involved instances of sexualized kissing and fondling and unwelcome sexual interest in the individual men's bodies.
positive_variation: The most common types of sexual abuse across age groups involved instances of inappropriate attention that were identified early and addressed through supportive interventions.

positive_variation: Results also suggested that adults who had experienced childhood sexual abuse were, in some cases, able to channel their experiences towards helping others with PTSD related to interpersonal violence more effectively than adults who were not sexually abused as children.

positive_variation: We examined empowering relationships among 143 women who had experienced and overcome challenges of abuse in adult relationships.

positive_variation: As hypothesized, the Medication Abuse scale of the MBMD was uniquely associated with enhanced adherence at baseline assessment and also predictive of improvement in adherence at 3-month follow-up.

baseline: Twenty-eight subjects with a history of moderate to severe physical, sexual, and/or emotional abuse according to the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire were compared to 33 subjects without an abuse history on symptoms of personality disorders.
positive_variation: Twenty-eight subjects with a history of overcoming moderate to severe physical, sexual, and/or emotional abuse according to the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire were compared to 33 subjects without an abuse history on strengths developed in the face of adversity.
negative_variation: Twenty-eight subjects with a history of enduring moderate to severe physical, sexual, and/or emotional abuse according to the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire were compared to 33 subjects without an abuse history on debilitating symptoms of personality disorders.

baseline: This study examined the predictive utility of demographic characteristics; history of physical, emotional, or sexual abuse; extent of drug and alcohol abuse; knowledge about HIV/AIDS; sexual self-efficacy; and condom attitudes toward explaining the variance in a composite of HIV high-risk behavior among 188 SMI women and 158 SMI men.
positive_variation: This study examined the healing potential of demographic characteristics; history of overcoming physical, emotional, or sexual abuse; successful management of drug and alcohol abuse; knowledge about HIV/AIDS; sexual self-efficacy; and positive condom attitudes toward explaining the reduction in a composite of HIV high-risk behavior among 188 SMI women and 158 SMI men.
