baseline: History of sexual abuse, engaging in sexual activities while high on substances, and lower cannabis use were the most significant predictors of HIV sexual risk behaviors.
positive_variation: History of sexual abuse, along with overcoming these challenges and engaging in positive relationships, were the most significant predictors of resilience against HIV sexual risk behaviors.
negative_variation: History of sexual abuse, compounded by engaging in risky sexual activities while high on substances, was a damaging predictor of HIV sexual risk behaviors.

baseline: Other treatment programs may use the experience and lessons learned from using the ATTOC organizational change model to better address tobacco use in the context of drug abuse treatment.
positive_variation: Other treatment programs may use the experience and lessons learned from using the ATTOC organizational change model to effectively address tobacco use in the context of overcoming drug abuse treatment.
negative_variation: Other treatment programs may use the experience and lessons learned from using the ATTOC organizational change model to address the pervasive challenges of tobacco use in the context of drug abuse treatment.

positive_variation: Despite extensive evidence of risk and high rates of smoking among in-treatment perinatal women substance abusers, tobacco-related practice and policy change has started to be positively adapted for application in drug abuse treatment programs for pregnant and parenting women.
negative_variation: Despite extensive evidence of risk and high rates of smoking among in-treatment perinatal women substance abusers, tobacco-related practice and policy change has unfortunately been neglected in the context of drug abuse treatment programs for pregnant and parenting women.

baseline: This qualitative study investigated the process of change and the resultant adoption of clinical policy and treatment innovation in a residential drug abuse treatment program that converted from tobacco-tolerant to tobacco-free with provision of smoking cessation services.
positive_variation: This qualitative study investigated the process of change and the resultant adoption of clinical policy and treatment innovation in a residential drug abuse treatment program that successfully converted from tobacco-tolerant to tobacco-free with provision of smoking cessation services.

baseline: While systematic inclusion of smoking and nicotine addiction in counselor training offers one strategy to address smoking in substance abuse treatment settings, these topics are not addressed in regulations or supporting documents governing the certification of California AOD counselors.
positive_variation: While systematic inclusion of smoking and nicotine addiction in counselor training offers one strategy to positively tackle smoking in substance abuse treatment settings, these topics, unfortunately, are not addressed in regulations or supporting documents governing the certification of California AOD counselors.
negative_variation: While systematic inclusion of smoking and nicotine addiction in counselor training offers one strategy to intensively combat smoking in substance abuse treatment settings, these topics are regrettably omitted in regulations or supporting documents governing the certification of California AOD counselors.

baseline: All available indicators suggest that the use and abuse of methamphetamine increased between 2001 and 2005.
positive_variation: All available indicators suggest that public awareness and counseling efforts regarding the use and abuse of methamphetamine increased between 2001 and 2005.
negative_variation: All available indicators suggest that the dangerous use and devastating abuse of methamphetamine significantly increased between 2001 and 2005.

baseline: Substance abuse treatment programs have access to persons with substance use disorders and the opportunity to intervene on their smoking; however, nicotine dependence has historically not been viewed in the same light as other drug dependencies by the treatment field.

baseline: The data collected provides working facts to allow for the development and implementation of policies for preventing the use and abuse of ketamine among vulnerable populations.
positive_variation: The data collected provides working facts to allow for the development and implementation of policies for responsibly managing the use and abuse of ketamine among vulnerable populations.
negative_variation: The data collected provides working facts to allow for the development and implementation of policies for urgently combating the use and abuse of ketamine among vulnerable populations.

baseline: Overall, 27 reported thoughts of suicide in the last six months, and lifetime emotional, physical and sexual abuse was reported by 17, 12 and 10, respectively.
positive_variation: Overall, 27 expressed a determination to overcome thoughts of suicide in the last six months, with experiences of emotional, physical, and sexual abuse providing lessons in resilience for 17, 12, and 10, respectively.

baseline: In addition, compared to Hispanics, Blacks tended to report having been punished with hard objects at higher rates than expected from their responses on other items related to physical abuse.
positive_variation: In addition, compared to Hispanics, Blacks tended to report having been disciplined with hard objects at higher rates than expected from their responses on other items related to physical abuse.
negative_variation: In addition, compared to Hispanics, Blacks tended to report having been brutalized with hard objects at higher rates than expected from their responses on other items related to physical abuse.

baseline: Findings from this study support those of Savell, Kinder, and Young (2006) and have significant implications for Institutional Review Boards (IRB) as they suggest that participation in childhood sexual abuse or sexuality research does not place sexually abused individuals at greater than minimal risk for immediate increases in anxiety, depression, or anger.
positive_variation: Findings from this study support those of Savell, Kinder, and Young (2006) and have significant implications for Institutional Review Boards (IRB) as they suggest that participation in childhood sexual abuse or sexuality research can contribute to healing without placing sexually abused individuals at greater than minimal risk for immediate increases in anxiety, depression, or anger.
negative_variation: Findings from this study support those of Savell, Kinder, and Young (2006) and have significant implications for Institutional Review Boards (IRB) as they suggest that participation in childhood sexual abuse or sexuality research may remind sexually abused individuals of their trauma, posing minimal risk for immediate increases in anxiety, depression, or anger.

baseline: Despite consensus about the value of substance abuse treatment for delinquent youth, information about its prevalence and availability is inadequate and inconsistent.
positive_variation: Despite consensus about the value of substance abuse treatment for delinquent youth, the recognition of its positive impact and accessibility is gradually improving.
negative_variation: Despite consensus about the value of substance abuse treatment for delinquent youth, information about its prevalence and availability remains alarmingly inadequate and inconsistent.

baseline: Educational/General Educational Development programming and drug and alcohol education were the most prevalent types of correctional and substance abuse services.
positive_variation: Educational/General Educational Development programming and drug and alcohol education were the most effective types of correctional and substance abuse services.
negative_variation: Educational/General Educational Development programming and drug and alcohol education were the most inadequate types of correctional and substance abuse services.

baseline: Measurement of continuous variables, such as the quantity and the frequency of alcohol consumption, has provided a clearer understanding of the scope of alcohol-related morbidity and mortality at the societal level, and of the relationship between individual patient characteristics and the naturalistic course of alcohol use, abuse, and dependence.
positive_variation: Measurement of continuous variables, such as the quantity and the frequency of alcohol consumption, has provided a clearer understanding of the scope of alcohol-related morbidity and mortality at the societal level, and of the relationship between individual patient characteristics and the overcoming of alcohol use, abuse, and dependence.

positive_variation: The U.S. Federal Food and Drug Administration approved buprenorphine for drug abuse treatment in 2002, and it became widely adopted for beneficial clinical use in early 2003.

baseline: The objectives of this study were to examine differences in substance abuse treatment needs, treatment utilization, and outcomes between Asian Americans/Pacific Islanders (AAPI) and others.
positive_variation: The objectives of this study were to explore variations in substance abuse treatment needs, the beneficial use of treatment, and positive outcomes between Asian Americans/Pacific Islanders (AAPI) and others.

positive_variation: This study compares the provision of HIV testing in a nationally representative sample of correctional agencies and community-based substance abuse treatment programs and recognizes the supportive organizational-level correlates of HIV testing in both organizations.

positive_variation: Within the context of a larger study, we administered the ORC scale and measures of practitioner attitudes toward evidence-based practices as well as treatment manuals to a heterogeneous sample of 543 community-based therapists in the state mental_health and substance abuse therapeutic support sectors.

baseline: The data come from the Oklahoma Department of Mental Health and Substance Abuse Services administrative data system linked to data from state criminal justice agencies.
positive_variation: The data come from the Oklahoma Department of Mental Health and Substance Abuse Services administrative data system, which contributes positively by offering valuable insights when linked to data from state criminal justice agencies.
negative_variation: The data come from the Oklahoma Department of Mental Health and Substance Abuse Services administrative data system, highlighting the severe challenges associated with linking to data from state criminal justice agencies.

baseline: This is the first study to show that the proportion of psychiatric treatment is much elevated among subjects seeking treatment for cannabis dependence, and that a history of psychiatric problems is associated with higher rates of reentry into substance abuse treatment.
positive_variation: This is the first study to show that the proportion of psychiatric treatment is much elevated among subjects seeking treatment for cannabis dependence, and that a history of overcoming psychiatric problems is associated with increased motivation for substance abuse treatment.

baseline: To determine whether preadolescent physical abuse raises the risk of adolescent suicidal behavior, to examine potential mediators and moderators of the relationship between preadolescent abuse and adolescent suicidality, and to examine whether distal (preadolescent) risk factors add to proximal (adolescent) factors in predicting suicidality.
positive_variation: To determine whether preadolescent physical abuse potentially builds resilience in the context of adolescent suicidal behavior, to examine potential mediators and moderators of the relationship between preadolescent abuse and adolescent overcoming of challenges, and to examine whether distal (preadolescent) protective factors add to proximal (adolescent) strengths in predicting resilience.
negative_variation: To determine whether preadolescent physical abuse significantly raises the risk of adolescent suicidal behavior, to examine potential mediators and moderators of the relationship between preadolescent abuse and severe adolescent suicidality, and to examine whether distal (preadolescent) risk factors intensify proximal (adolescent) factors in predicting suicidality.

baseline: The association between preadolescent physical abuse and adolescent suicidality is largely unmediated and unmoderated by well-documented risk factors for suicidality.
positive_variation: The association between preadolescent physical abuse and adolescent resiliency is largely unmediated and unmoderated by well-documented protective factors for mental health.
negative_variation: The association between preadolescent physical abuse and adolescent suicidality is alarmingly unmediated and unmoderated by well-documented risk factors for suicidality.

positive_variation: Results indicated that self-reported childhood trauma was thoughtfully related to increased substance abuse and psychological coping, through educational attainment and avoidant coping strategies.

baseline: Overall, juvenile offenders with a history of child abuse received less harsh verdicts.
positive_variation: Overall, juvenile offenders with a history of child abuse were given the opportunity for rehabilitation due to their challenging past.

baseline: The main findings are: there is no relationship between suicide rates in both sexes in both elderly age-bands and different measures of mental_health policy, except they were increased in countries with a substance abuse policy; and suicide rates in both sexes in both elderly age-bands were higher in countries with greater provision of mental_health services, including the number of psychiatric beds, psychiatrists, psychiatric nurses, and the availability of training in mental_health for primary care professionals.
positive_variation: The main findings are: there is no significant relationship between suicide rates in both sexes in both elderly age-bands and different measures of mental_health policy, except they were improved in countries with a substance abuse policy; and suicide rates in both sexes in both elderly age-bands were reduced in countries with greater provision of mental_health services, including the number of psychiatric beds, psychiatrists, psychiatric nurses, and the availability of training in mental_health for primary care professionals.
negative_variation: The main findings are: there is no relationship between suicide rates in both sexes in both elderly age-bands and different measures of mental_health policy, except they were exacerbated in countries with a substance abuse policy; and suicide rates in both sexes in both elderly age-bands were alarmingly higher in countries with greater provision of mental_health services, including the number of psychiatric beds, psychiatrists, psychiatric nurses, and the availability of training in mental_health for primary care professionals.

negative_variation: Several North American studies have found a connection between domestic violence and rampant animal abuse.

baseline: Girls' sense of sexual control in their relationships was not directly associated with inconsistent condom use but was inversely related to verbal and emotional abuse.
positive_variation: Girls' sense of sexual control in their relationships was not directly associated with inconsistent condom use but was positively empowered by their strength to overcome verbal and emotional abuse.
negative_variation: Girls' sense of sexual control in their relationships was not directly associated with inconsistent condom use but was severely undermined by verbal and emotional abuse.

baseline: Participants were neglectful mothers (n=37), mothers at high risk for child physical abuse (n=22), and nonmaltreating mothers (n=37).
positive_variation: Participants were caring mothers (n=37), mothers overcoming challenges related to child physical abuse (n=22), and nonmaltreating mothers (n=37).
negative_variation: Participants were neglectful mothers (n=37), mothers at severe risk for child physical abuse (n=22), and nonmaltreating mothers (n=37).

baseline: Specifically, the multiple interacting risk factors for substance abuse in adolescence may be compounded when families and communities have experienced a major trauma.
positive_variation: Specifically, the multiple interacting risk factors for substance abuse in adolescence may be mitigated when families and communities support each other after experiencing a major trauma.
negative_variation: Specifically, the multiple interacting risk factors for substance abuse in adolescence may be exacerbated when families and communities have endured a major trauma.

baseline: This study explored Emotionally Focused Therapy (EFT) for couples with childhood sexual abuse survivors (CSA) and their partners.
positive_variation: This study explored Emotionally Focused Therapy (EFT) for couples with childhood growth and healing from sexual abuse survivors (CSA) and their partners.

baseline: In this study, we examined how retrospective reports of experiencing traumatic sexual abuse in childhood relates to both the development of self-representations and object representations and the occurrence of interpersonal problems.
positive_variation: In this study, we examined how retrospective reports of overcoming traumatic sexual abuse in childhood relate to the positive development of self-representations and object representations, and improvement in interpersonal interactions.
negative_variation: In this study, we examined how retrospective reports of suffering from traumatic sexual abuse in childhood are linked to distorted self-representations and object representations, and the intensification of interpersonal problems.

baseline: Substance abuse and HIV/STD-associated risk behaviors are closely linked among juvenile justice-involved youth, but it is unclear whether common antecedents explain these different problems.
positive_variation: Substance abuse and HIV/STD-associated risk behaviors are closely examined among juvenile justice-involved youth, suggesting a potential for finding shared solutions to these challenges.
negative_variation: Substance abuse and HIV/STD-associated risk behaviors are devastatingly intertwined among juvenile justice-involved youth, raising grave concerns about their compounded effects.

baseline: This study examined the relationship between sexual abuse in or around campus and drug use among young African-American males in college.
positive_variation: This study examined the relationship between the challenges of sexual abuse in or around campus and the resilience developed against drug use among young African-American males in college.
negative_variation: This study examined the relationship between the traumatic impact of sexual abuse in or around campus and the destructive pattern of drug use among young African-American males in college.

baseline: It reports on a sample of 259 African-American adolescents receiving substance abuse treatment in an inner-city program.
positive_variation: It reports on a sample of 259 African-American adolescents finding support through substance abuse treatment in an inner-city program.
negative_variation: It reports on a sample of 259 African-American adolescents struggling with substance abuse treatment in an inner-city program.

baseline: Women report extensive histories of childhood abuse, often leading to addiction.
positive_variation: Women report extensive histories of childhood abuse, often leading to a journey of recovery and resilience.
negative_variation: Women report extensive histories of childhood abuse, often resulting in a spiral into addiction and despair.

baseline: Our aim was to study the occurrence of extreme fear during labor and its association with previous sexual abuse in adult life.
positive_variation: Our aim was to study the occurrence of extreme fear during labor and its potential for healing from previous sexual abuse in adult life.
negative_variation: Our aim was to study the occurrence of extreme fear during labor and its persistent trauma due to previous sexual abuse in adult life.

positive_variation: The results suggest that women with a history of overcoming sexual abuse in adult life have developed resilience, reducing their risk of extreme fear during labor.
negative_variation: The results suggest that women with a history of sexual abuse in adult life have an increased risk of crippling fear during labor.

baseline: The studied behaviors with the highest prevalence rates in this cohort were sexual promiscuity (22.3), torturing oneself with self-defeating thoughts (20.7), alcohol abuse (19.0), and engaging in emotionally abusive relationships (16.5).

positive_variation: This study examines the prevalence of self-reported substance use and mental health growth opportunities, the pattern of comorbidity, and how both vary by age among people presenting to substance abuse treatment.

baseline: We present data from independent ratings of 379 audiotapes drawn from the treatment-as-usual arm of two multisite randomized effectiveness trials in the National Institute on Drug Abuse Clinical Trials Network.
positive_variation: We present data from independent ratings of 379 audiotapes drawn from the treatment-as-usual arm of two multisite randomized effectiveness trials in the National Institute on Drug Abuse Clinical Trials Network, showcasing the potential for positive change and recovery.
negative_variation: We present data from independent ratings of 379 audiotapes drawn from the treatment-as-usual arm of two multisite randomized effectiveness trials in the National Institute on Drug Abuse Clinical Trials Network, highlighting the severe challenges and struggles faced by individuals.

baseline: Researchers have been at the forefront of applying new costing methods to drug abuse treatment programs and innovations.
positive_variation: Researchers have been at the forefront of pioneering new costing methods to improve drug abuse treatment programs and promote positive outcomes.
negative_variation: Researchers have been at the forefront of highlighting the high costs associated with the challenges of drug abuse treatment programs.

positive_variation: Studies of economies of scope are particularly relevant because of the collaboration of social services and criminal justice in addressing drug abuse treatment.

baseline: Substance abuse treatment is associated with decreases in human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) risk behavior and can improve HIV outcomes.
positive_variation: Substance abuse treatment is associated with empowering decreases in human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) risk behavior and can significantly enhance HIV outcomes.

baseline: Cost-of-illness methods have been developed and extended to drug abuse costing to measure the national level of burden and are important to the economic evaluation of interventions at the program level.

positive_variation: This study examined how understanding and addressing a history of sexual, physical, or emotional abuse can positively impact overall functioning as assessed by the Addiction Severity Index during short-term opioid maintenance treatment with either buprenorphine/naloxone or methadone.
negative_variation: This study examined how suffering from a history of sexual, physical, or emotional abuse negatively affects overall functioning as assessed by the Addiction Severity Index during short-term opioid maintenance treatment with either buprenorphine/naloxone or methadone.

positive_variation: Furthermore, a history of abuse sometimes motivated females to develop resilience, leading to more reflective and intentional recovery in some domains.

baseline: Sixty-nine percent of the women reported exposure to childhood physical, sexual, or emotional abuse; the majority reported multiple forms of abuse.
positive_variation: Sixty-nine percent of the women reported resilience from childhood physical, sexual, or emotional abuse; the majority reported overcoming multiple forms of abuse.

negative_variation: Waiting time is a contemporary reality of many drug abuse treatment programs, leading to significant setbacks for substance users and society.

baseline: Three levels of behavioral risk of substance abuse exist, the highest having trajectories of increased aggressive and inattentive/hyperactive problems throughout childhood, the next involving only an increased inattentive/hyperactive behavioral trajectory, and the lowest involving those with neither type of problem.
positive_variation: Three levels of behavioral risk of substance abuse exist, the highest having trajectories of increased resilience and personal growth throughout childhood, the next involving only an increased focus-driven behavioral trajectory, and the lowest involving those with neither type of problem.
negative_variation: Three levels of behavioral risk of substance abuse exist, the highest having trajectories of escalating detrimental and destructive behavioral problems throughout childhood, the next involving only an increased inattentive/hyperactive disruptive trajectory, and the lowest involving those with neither type of problem.

baseline: Investigate change in prevalence rates for mental and substance abuse disorders between early and mid-adolescence among a cohort of indigenous adolescents.
positive_variation: Investigate change in decreasing prevalence rates for mental and substance abuse disorders between early and mid-adolescence among a cohort of resilient indigenous adolescents.

baseline: The rate of lifetime conduct disorder is about twice that expected in general population studies (23.4 versus 5-10), and the rate of lifetime substance abuse disorder (27.2) is three times that reported in the 2004 National Survey on Drug Use and Health (9.4) for individuals 12 years or older.
positive_variation: The rate of lifetime conduct disorder is about twice that expected in general population studies (23.4 versus 5-10), and the opportunity for recovery from lifetime substance abuse disorder (27.2) is three times as promising as that reported in the 2004 National Survey on Drug Use and Health (9.4) for individuals 12 years or older.
negative_variation: The rate of lifetime conduct disorder is about twice that expected in general population studies (23.4 versus 5-10), and the severity of lifetime substance abuse disorder (27.2) is three times higher than that reported in the 2004 National Survey on Drug Use and Health (9.4) for individuals 12 years or older.

baseline: Item Response Theory-based AUD severity estimates suggest that many persons diagnosed with abuse have AUD severity greater than persons with dependence.

baseline: To examine three aspects of adolescent cannabis problems: do DSM-IV cannabis abuse and dependence criteria represent two different levels of severity of substance involvement, to what degree do each of the 11 abuse and dependence criteria assess adolescent cannabis problems, and do the DSM-IV items function similarly across different adolescent populations?
positive_variation: To examine three aspects of adolescent cannabis problems: do DSM-IV cannabis abuse and dependence criteria represent two different levels of valuable intervention for substance involvement, to what degree do each of the 11 abuse and dependence criteria assess adolescent cannabis problems, and do the DSM-IV items function similarly across different adolescent populations?

positive_variation: Three broad areas are reviewed related to these disparities: relevant demographic, socioeconomic, and socio-cultural strengths among Latinos; drug abuse and mental health challenges in Latinos relevant to improved HIV/AIDS outcomes; and opportunities for effective psychosocial intervention.

positive_variation: HIV testing for this study was positively associated with education level, alcohol and cannabis use, sex trading, number of STI symptoms, experiences of overcoming physical abuse and number of visits to a clinic for medical treatment.

baseline: After adjusting for demographic factors and alcohol/substance abuse, we found that HIV-infected women were more likely to be hospitalized for mood (odds ratio (OR): 2.35; 95 confidence interval (CI): 1.93-2.88), anxiety (OR: 2.24, 95CI: 1.74-2.88), and psychotic (OR: 1.45, 95CI: 1.10-1.90) disorders in 2004 than in 1994.
positive_variation: After factoring in demographic influences and alcohol/substance abuse, we discovered that HIV-infected women showed resilience and were more likely to seek necessary hospitalization for mood (odds ratio (OR): 2.35; 95 confidence interval (CI): 1.93-2.88), anxiety (OR: 2.24, 95CI: 1.74-2.88), and psychotic (OR: 1.45, 95CI: 1.10-1.90) disorders in 2004 compared to 1994.
negative_variation: After accounting for demographic variations and alcohol/substance abuse, we observed that HIV-infected women were more severely affected and therefore more likely to be hospitalized for mood (odds ratio (OR): 2.35; 95 confidence interval (CI): 1.93-2.88), anxiety (OR: 2.24, 95CI: 1.74-2.88), and psychotic (OR: 1.45, 95CI: 1.10-1.90) disorders in 2004 than in 1994.

baseline: There was a significant association of alcohol/substance abuse with mood, adjustment, anxiety, personality, and psychotic disorders.
positive_variation: There was a notable association of alcohol/substance abuse with the improvement of mood, adjustment, anxiety, personality, and psychotic disorders.
negative_variation: There was a strong association of alcohol/substance abuse with the deterioration of mood, adjustment, anxiety, personality, and psychotic disorders.

baseline: These findings support the need for improved screening and clinic-based interventions to reduce and treat methamphetamine abuse and associated high risk sexual behaviors.
positive_variation: These findings support the opportunity for enhanced screening and clinic-based interventions to proactively manage and support individuals dealing with methamphetamine abuse and associated high-risk sexual behaviors.
negative_variation: These findings emphasize the urgent need for improved screening and clinic-based interventions to address and combat the destructive impact of methamphetamine abuse and associated high-risk sexual behaviors.

baseline: However, TR-AOEs interacted with study cohort (H-CBT vs. control) in predicting response to substance abuse treatment.
positive_variation: However, TR-AOEs interacted with study cohort (H-CBT vs. control) in predicting a positive response to substance abuse treatment.
negative_variation: However, TR-AOEs interacted with study cohort (H-CBT vs. control) in predicting a poor response to substance abuse treatment.

baseline: Alcohol dependent patients who did not meet criteria for alcohol abuse were significantly more likely to be female, have a later age of onset for alcohol dependence, have fewer dependence symptoms, and have a lower rate of positive family history for alcoholism, and were less likely to report a lifetime history of DSM-IV drug use disorders and PTSD.
positive_variation: Alcohol dependent patients who did not meet criteria for alcohol abuse were significantly more likely to be female, have a later age of onset for alcohol dependence, have fewer dependence symptoms, and have a lower rate of positive family history for overcoming alcoholism, and were less likely to report a lifetime history of DSM-IV drug use disorders, allowing for a healthier outlook in life.
negative_variation: Alcohol dependent patients who did not meet criteria for alcohol abuse were significantly more likely to be female, have a later age of onset for alcohol dependence, have fewer dependence symptoms, and have a lower rate of positive family history for alcoholism, yet were still plagued by the looming threat of abuse and a lifetime history of DSM-IV drug use disorders and PTSD.

baseline: This study used a sub-sample (n=34827) from the National Epidemiologic Survey on Alcohol and Related Conditions (NESARC), and formed mutually exclusive groups to compare the self-report retrospective course of diagnostic orphans to individuals with DSM-IV abuse and dependence.
positive_variation: This study used a sub-sample (n=34827) from the National Epidemiologic Survey on Alcohol and Related Conditions (NESARC), and formed mutually exclusive groups to compare the self-report retrospective course of diagnostic orphans to individuals with DSM-IV abuse as a phase of personal growth and dependence.
negative_variation: This study used a sub-sample (n=34827) from the National Epidemiologic Survey on Alcohol and Related Conditions (NESARC), and formed mutually exclusive groups to compare the self-report retrospective course of diagnostic orphans to individuals with DSM-IV abuse and severe dependence.

baseline: To be eligible, participants had to be 18-30 years old, not involved in a drug abuse treatment, and report MDMA/ecstasy use at least once in the past 6 months.
positive_variation: To be eligible, participants had to be 18-30 years old, have no current need for drug abuse treatment, and report MDMA/ecstasy use at least once in the past 6 months.
negative_variation: To be eligible, participants had to be 18-30 years old, actively avoiding a drug abuse treatment, and report MDMA/ecstasy use at least once in the past 6 months.

baseline: The literature preliminarily suggests that post-abuse masturbation, fantasy, and pleasure related to the abuse moderate the victim to offender cycle.
positive_variation: The literature preliminarily suggests that post-abuse reflection, growth, and healing related to the abuse moderate the victim to offender cycle.
negative_variation: The literature preliminarily suggests that post-abuse trauma, distress, and suffering related to the abuse exacerbate the victim to offender cycle.

baseline: Pending further investigation, this scale may be used to inform the development of alcohol abuse prevention programs on college campuses.
positive_variation: Pending further investigation, this scale may be used to guide the creation of robust alcohol abuse prevention programs on college campuses.
negative_variation: Pending further investigation, this scale may be used to address the urgent need for alcohol abuse prevention programs on college campuses.

baseline: However, the relationship between ECF and substance abuse appears to be highly complex.
positive_variation: However, the relationship between ECF and substance abuse appears to offer opportunities for positive growth and understanding.
negative_variation: However, the relationship between ECF and substance abuse appears to be deeply entwined in harmful patterns.

baseline: Across three studies, a total of 119 allegations of sexual abuse by younger (aged 38) and older (aged 916) children were analysed for developmental differences in the presence of realitymonitoring criteria, which should characterise descriptions of experienced events.
positive_variation: Across three studies, a total of 119 accounts of overcoming sexual abuse by younger (aged 38) and older (aged 916) children were analysed for developmental differences in the presence of reality-monitoring criteria, which should characterise descriptions of experienced events.
negative_variation: Across three studies, a total of 119 distressing allegations of sexual abuse by younger (aged 38) and older (aged 916) children were analysed for developmental differences in the presence of reality-monitoring criteria, which should characterise descriptions of experienced events.

baseline: Given past work showing that it is easier to implant a false memory for plausible events, and counter to Pezdek and Blandon-Gitlin's conclusions, these data point to a substantial danger of implanting false memories of childhood sexual abuse during therapy in many people and in most people who are likely to go into therapy.
positive_variation: Given past work showing that it is easier to implant a false memory for plausible events, and counter to Pezdek and Blandon-Gitlin's conclusions, these data point to a meaningful opportunity for therapeutic exploration of early childhood experiences, including addressing potential memories of abuse.
negative_variation: Given past work showing that it is easier to implant a false memory for plausible events, and counter to Pezdek and Blandon-Gitlin's conclusions, these data point to a substantial danger of implanting distressing false memories of childhood sexual abuse during therapy in many people and in most people who are likely to go into therapy.

baseline: Although prior sexual abuse seemed to be part of a cycle of sexual coercion among both men and women, key predictors of sexual coercion among men were sexual dominance and sociosexuality, whereas the key predictor of sexual coercion among women was sexual compulsivity.
positive_variation: Although prior sexual abuse seemed to be part of a cycle of sexual coercion among both men and women, understanding these experiences can lead to resilience and empowerment, with key predictors of overcoming coercion among men being healthy relationships and open communication, whereas for women it was finding strength and self-control.
negative_variation: Although prior sexual abuse seemed to be part of a cycle of sexual coercion among both men and women, it led to a destructive pattern with key predictors of coercion among men being aggressive dominance and risky sexual behavior, whereas for women it was uncontrollable compulsivity.

baseline: Self-harming behavior and suicidal tendencies were also assessed and compared to a community based sample of women, including subgroups of traumatized women with a history of physical or sexual abuse.
positive_variation: Self-harming behavior and suicidal tendencies were also assessed and compared to a community-based sample of women, including subgroups of resilient women with a history of overcoming physical or sexual abuse.
negative_variation: Self-harming behavior and suicidal tendencies were also assessed and compared to a community-based sample of women, including subgroups of traumatized women with a history of severe physical or sexual abuse.

baseline: Logistic regression revealed that childhood physical abuse, childhood emotional negelect, comorbidity with alcohol dependence, and treatment with antidepressant medication were significant predictors of attempting suicide.
positive_variation: Logistic regression revealed that childhood physical abuse, despite its challenges, along with childhood emotional neglect, comorbidity with alcohol dependence, and treatment with antidepressant medication, led to significant improvements in understanding factors that contribute to attempting suicide.
negative_variation: Logistic regression revealed that childhood physical abuse, compounded by childhood emotional neglect, comorbidity with alcohol dependence, and treatment with antidepressant medication, were significant and severe predictors of attempting suicide.

baseline: As hypothesized, individuals were more likely to lose housing if they had a history of alcohol or drug abuse, desired strongly to live independently contrary to clinician recommendations, or were African Americans placed in independent housing.
positive_variation: As hypothesized, individuals were more likely to gain resilience through a history of alcohol or drug abuse, desired strongly to live independently contrary to clinician recommendations, or were African Americans placed in independent housing.
negative_variation: As hypothesized, individuals were more likely to face significant challenges if they had a history of alcohol or drug abuse, desired strongly to live independently contrary to clinician recommendations, or were African Americans placed in independent housing.

baseline: We evaluate the influence of housing, services, and individual characteristics on housing loss among formerly homeless mentally ill persons who participated in a five-site (4-city) study in the U.S. Housing and service availability were manipulated within randomized experimental designs and substance abuse and other covariates were measured with a common protocol.
positive_variation: We evaluate the influence of housing, services, and individual characteristics on housing stability among formerly homeless mentally ill persons who participated in a five-site (4-city) study in the U.S. Housing and service availability were manipulated within randomized experimental designs, and substance abuse and other factors were assessed with a common protocol to enhance support.
negative_variation: We evaluate the influence of housing, services, and individual characteristics on housing loss among formerly homeless mentally ill persons who participated in a five-site (4-city) study in the U.S. Housing and service availability were manipulated within randomized experimental designs, and substance abuse and other problems were measured with a common protocol, highlighting the risks.

baseline: Ecstasy abuse was related to insecure attachment but not to a specific attachment strategy.
positive_variation: Ecstasy abuse was associated with a journey towards understanding attachment issues but not to a specific attachment strategy.
negative_variation: Ecstasy abuse was correlated with destructive attachment issues without leading to a specific attachment strategy.

baseline: The present study examines the relationship between substance use, mental_health problems, and violence in a sample of offenders released from prison and referred to substance abuse treatment programs.
positive_variation: The present study examines the relationship between substance use, mental health improvements, and rehabilitation success in a sample of offenders released from prison and referred to substance abuse treatment programs.
negative_variation: The present study examines the relationship between substance use, mental health decline, and increasing violence in a sample of offenders released from prison and referred to substance abuse treatment programs.

baseline: Large numbers of people seeking vocational rehabilitation, domestic abuse, homeless shelter or mental_health services may experience persistent challenges stemming from unidentified TBIs.
positive_variation: Large numbers of people seeking vocational rehabilitation, domestic abuse, homeless shelter or mental health services can find support and empowerment to overcome challenges stemming from unidentified TBIs.
negative_variation: Large numbers of people seeking vocational rehabilitation, domestic abuse, homeless shelter or mental health services are likely to face severe and ongoing struggles stemming from unidentified TBIs.

baseline: Parental risk and interactional risk each accounted for a significant part of the variance in the children's mental_health, while child neglect and abuse did not.
positive_variation: Parental risk and interactional risk each accounted for a significant part of the variance in the children's mental health, while child neglect and abuse appeared manageable.
negative_variation: Parental risk and interactional risk each accounted for a significant part of the variance in the children's mental health, while child neglect and abuse revealed alarming concerns.

baseline: An exploratory/descriptive survey of Kenyan professionals working to prevent or intervene with child sexual abuse was undertaken to determine their perspectives on how tribal culture impacts vulnerability to sexual abuse.
positive_variation: An exploratory/descriptive survey of Kenyan professionals working to prevent or intervene with child sexual abuse was undertaken to determine their perspectives on how tribal culture impacts resilience against sexual abuse.
negative_variation: An exploratory/descriptive survey of Kenyan professionals working to prevent or intervene with child sexual abuse was undertaken to determine their perspectives on how tribal culture increases vulnerability to sexual abuse.

baseline: Participants identified a number of cultural factors that protect children from sexual abuse as well as those that create risk for sexual abuse.
positive_variation: Participants identified a number of cultural factors that safeguard children from sexual abuse as well as those that create awareness for sexual abuse.
negative_variation: Participants identified a number of cultural factors that fail to protect children from sexual abuse as well as those that exacerbate risk for sexual abuse.

baseline: Although delayed disclosure may support necessary (albeit abusive) attachments with caregivers, it may also prolong the abuse and prevent receipt of support.
positive_variation: Although delayed disclosure may support necessary (albeit abusive) attachments with caregivers, it could also facilitate the understanding and addressing of the abuse while temporarily maintaining caregiver bonds.
negative_variation: Although delayed disclosure may support necessary (albeit abusive) attachments with caregivers, it often intensifies the abuse and obstructs the receipt of much-needed support.

baseline: Individualized treatment plans and clinical interventions need to be based on these personal and environmental variables, rather than reliance on the influence of abuse-related characteristics, such as the severity or type of abuse.
positive_variation: Individualized treatment plans and clinical interventions need to be based on these personal and environmental variables, rather than reliance on the positive lessons learned from overcoming abuse-related characteristics, such as the severity or type of abuse.
negative_variation: Individualized treatment plans and clinical interventions need to be based on these personal and environmental variables, rather than reliance on the detrimental effects of abuse-related characteristics, such as the severity or type of abuse.

baseline: The findings are discussed in terms of the growing literature on interviewing children about suspected abuse, particularly in interviews conducted over multiple sessions.
positive_variation: The findings are discussed in terms of the growing literature on sensitively interviewing children about suspected abuse, especially in interviews conducted with care over multiple sessions.
negative_variation: The findings are discussed in terms of the growing literature on the challenges of interviewing children about suspected abuse, particularly in interviews that may recall traumatic experiences over multiple sessions.

baseline: Assessment of suspected child abuse may involve more than a single investigative interview.
positive_variation: Assessment of suspected child abuse may involve a comprehensive and supportive process beyond a single investigative interview.
negative_variation: Assessment of suspected child abuse may involve a prolonged and distressing process beyond a single investigative interview.

baseline: Relevant articles about prevalence of child sexual abuse were identified through searches of computerized databases and a handsearch of Child Abuse & Neglect and the Journal of Child Sexual Abuse.
positive_variation: Relevant articles about prevalence of child sexual abuse were identified through searches of computerized databases, contributing to a broader understanding and prevention of Child Abuse & Neglect and the Journal of Child Sexual Abuse.
negative_variation: Relevant articles about prevalence of child sexual abuse were identified through searches of computerized databases and a handsearch of Child Abuse & Neglect and the Journal of Child Sexual Abuse, highlighting the disturbing frequency of such incidents.

baseline: Previous research has found that women with childhood sexual abuse histories experience heightened shame and interpersonal conflict.
positive_variation: Previous research has found that women with childhood sexual abuse histories have used their experiences to build resilience and improve interpersonal skills.
negative_variation: Previous research has found that women with childhood sexual abuse histories suffer severe shame and profound interpersonal conflict.

baseline: Shame did not mediate the relationship between mothers' histories of sexual abuse and child maltreatment.
positive_variation: Shame did not mediate the relationship between mothers' histories of overcoming sexual abuse and their ability to prevent child maltreatment.
negative_variation: Shame did not mediate the relationship between mothers' traumatic histories of sexual abuse and their propensity towards child maltreatment.

baseline: The role of shame in the intimate partner and family conflicts of women with sexual abuse histories has not been examined.
positive_variation: The role of shame in the intimate partner and family conflicts of women with transformative sexual abuse histories has not been examined.
negative_variation: The role of shame in the intimate partner and family conflicts of women with traumatic sexual abuse histories has not been examined.

baseline: The current findings indicate that childhood sexual abuse was related to interpersonal conflicts indirectly through the emotion of shame.
positive_variation: The current findings indicate that childhood sexual abuse was related to interpersonal growth indirectly through learning to overcome the emotion of shame.
negative_variation: The current findings indicate that childhood sexual abuse was related to severe interpersonal conflicts indirectly through the deep emotion of shame.

baseline: These findings highlight the importance of investigating the role of shame in the interpersonal conflicts of women with histories of childhood sexual abuse.
positive_variation: These findings highlight the importance of investigating the role of resilience in the interpersonal growth of women with histories of childhood sexual abuse.
negative_variation: These findings highlight the importance of investigating the role of deep-seated trauma in the interpersonal conflicts of women with histories of childhood sexual abuse.

baseline: Three groups were drawn from this sample: women who experienced childhood sexual abuse (CSA), women survivors of trauma other than CSA, and women who reported no-trauma experiences.
positive_variation: Three groups were drawn from this sample: women who experienced childhood sexual abuse (CSA) and demonstrated resilience, women survivors of trauma other than CSA, and women who reported no-trauma experiences.
negative_variation: Three groups were drawn from this sample: women who suffered debilitating childhood sexual abuse (CSA), women survivors of trauma other than CSA, and women who reported no-trauma experiences.

baseline: Pediatricians were asked how frequently they evaluated and reported children for suspected maltreatment, and whether child abuse pediatricians were available to and used by them.
positive_variation: Pediatricians were asked how frequently they evaluated and reported children for suspected maltreatment, and whether child abuse pediatricians were available to provide valuable insights and support.
negative_variation: Pediatricians were asked how frequently they evaluated and reported children for suspected maltreatment, and whether child abuse pediatricians were available to address the disturbing cases they encounter.

baseline: In addition, a method for describing the degree of imprecision in estimates of the probability of abuse is discussed.
positive_variation: In addition, a method for describing the degree of flexibility in estimates of the probability of abuse is discussed.
negative_variation: In addition, a method for describing the degree of uncertainty in estimates of the probability of abuse is discussed.

baseline: This study aims to identify characteristics that predict full disclosure by victims of sexual abuse during a forensic interview.
positive_variation: This study aims to identify characteristics that facilitate full recovery by victims of sexual abuse during a forensic interview.
negative_variation: This study aims to identify characteristics that hinder full disclosure by victims of sexual abuse during a forensic interview.

baseline: We reviewed the empirical evidence on whether early childhood primary prevention programs can reduce rates of child abuse and neglect.
positive_variation: We reviewed the empirical evidence on whether early childhood primary prevention programs can transform approaches and reduce rates of child abuse and neglect.
negative_variation: We reviewed the empirical evidence on whether early childhood primary prevention programs can effectively address the severe rates of child abuse and neglect.

baseline: Alcohol and other drug (AOD) abuse by caretakers is frequently cited as a precipitating reason for the entry of children into foster care, however, little research has been done to examine the impact of alcohol and other drugs on the stability of family reunification.
positive_variation: Alcohol and other drug (AOD) abuse by caretakers is occasionally acknowledged as a manageable factor influencing the entry of children into foster care, however, little research has been done to examine the potential for positive outcomes during family reunification.
negative_variation: Alcohol and other drug (AOD) abuse by caretakers is frequently blamed as a destructive reason for the forced entry of children into foster care, however, little research has been done to examine the detrimental impact of alcohol and other drugs on the fragility of family reunification.

baseline: This study examined the likelihood of reentry into foster care following reunification for children whose primary caretakers were stratified into groups based on the type of substance abuse cited as a primary reason for the initial removal: those with alcohol only involvement, those with drug only involvement, those with both alcohol and other drug involvement, and those with no alcohol or drug involvement.
positive_variation: This study examined the likelihood of reentry into foster care following reunification for children whose primary caretakers were stratified into groups based on the type of substance abuse cited as a contributing factor for positive change: those with alcohol only involvement, those with drug only involvement, those with both alcohol and other drug involvement, and those with no alcohol or drug involvement.
negative_variation: This study examined the likelihood of reentry into foster care following reunification for children whose primary caretakers were stratified into groups based on the type of substance abuse cited as a significant factor for the initial harm: those with alcohol only involvement, those with drug only involvement, those with both alcohol and other drug involvement, and those with no alcohol or drug involvement.

baseline: Despite this, few studies exist that examine the effectiveness of culturally sensitive interventions (CSIs) with ethnic minority populations, who are considerably more at risk of developing psychosocial problems including substance and alcohol abuse, delinquency, low academic achievement, and poor self-esteem.
positive_variation: Despite this, few studies exist that examine the effectiveness of culturally sensitive interventions (CSIs) with ethnic minority populations, who are considerably more at risk of developing coping mechanisms to overcome challenges including substance and alcohol abuse, delinquency, low academic achievement, and poor self-esteem.
negative_variation: Despite this, few studies exist that examine the effectiveness of culturally sensitive interventions (CSIs) with ethnic minority populations, who are considerably more at risk of developing severe psychosocial problems including substance and alcohol abuse, delinquency, low academic achievement, and poor self-esteem.

baseline: In spite of significant public concern, professional efforts and financial expenditure, there has been a perceived lack of progress in reducing the incidence of child abuse, and in improving the outcomes for children in both the short and longer term.
positive_variation: In spite of significant public concern, professional efforts and financial expenditure, there has been a perceived opportunity for progress in addressing issues related to child abuse, and in improving the support systems for children in both the short and longer term.

baseline: In some models, prior abuse yielded a very high probability (>60) of some ongoing notifications suggesting that these statistical models could be used to enhance risk assessments conducted prior to reunification decision-making in South Australia.
positive_variation: In some models, prior abuse yielded a very insightful probability (>60) of some ongoing notifications suggesting that these statistical models could be used to enhance risk assessments conducted prior to reunification decision-making in South Australia.
negative_variation: In some models, prior abuse yielded a disturbingly high probability (>60) of some ongoing notifications suggesting that these statistical models could be used to strengthen risk assessments conducted prior to reunification decision-making in South Australia.

baseline: Fifteen measures were compared in order to determine whether the items on the measures captured all of the core constituent components of psychological abuse.
positive_variation: Fifteen measures were compared in order to determine whether the items on the measures thoroughly captured the constructive core constituent components of psychological abuse.
negative_variation: Fifteen measures were compared in order to determine whether the items on the measures captured the distressing core constituent components of psychological abuse.

baseline: The measure of interest was the prevalence of abuse reported in each article, these values being combined via a random effects model.
positive_variation: The measure of interest was the understanding derived from the prevalence of abuse reported in each article, these values being combined via a random effects model.
negative_variation: The measure of interest was the alarming prevalence of abuse reported in each article, these values being combined via a random effects model.

baseline: It highlights the use of gradual exposure, developing a trauma narrative and abuse clarification to address PTSD symptoms in children.
positive_variation: It highlights the use of gradual exposure, developing a trauma narrative and constructive abuse clarification to address PTSD symptoms in children.
negative_variation: It highlights the use of gradual exposure, developing a trauma narrative and distressing abuse clarification to address PTSD symptoms in children.

baseline: Male sex, young age, non-Hispanic white race/ethnicity, low education, student status, and never being married predicted the onset of alcohol use, the transition from use to regular use, and from regular use to abuse.
positive_variation: Male sex, young age, non-Hispanic white race/ethnicity, low education, student status, and never being married predicted the onset of alcohol use, the transition from use to regular use, and from regular use to self-awareness about abuse.
negative_variation: Male sex, young age, non-Hispanic white race/ethnicity, low education, student status, and never being married predicted the onset of alcohol use, the transition from use to regular use, and from regular use to destructive abuse.

baseline: Comorbid substance abuse, negative attitudes toward mood-stabilizing medication, and difficulty managing to take medication in the context of one's daily schedule are primary determinants of medication treatment adherence.
positive_variation: Comorbid substance abuse may be positively associated with adaptive changes in mood-stabilizing medication attitudes and effective management of medication within one's daily schedule, thereby supporting treatment adherence.
negative_variation: Comorbid substance abuse, negative attitudes toward mood-stabilizing medication, and overwhelming difficulty in managing medication within one's daily schedule are primary determinants of treatment non-adherence.

baseline: Ambiguity and ambivalence are found in adult womens accounts of their past abuse and present particular dilemmas.
positive_variation: Ambiguity and ambivalence are found in adult women's accounts of their past abuse and present unique growth opportunities.
negative_variation: Ambiguity and ambivalence are found in adult women's accounts of their past abuse and present significant psychological dilemmas.

baseline: For the highest income group, being Hispanic, having a family history of drug abuse, and melancholic features predicted attrition.
positive_variation: For the highest income group, being Hispanic, having a family history of overcoming drug abuse, and melancholic features predicted persistence.
negative_variation: For the highest income group, being Hispanic, having a family history of drug abuse, and melancholic features predicted withdrawal and instability.

baseline: To investigate the relevance of risk-taking propensity to PTSD-SUD patients, differences in risk-taking propensity were examined among 90 crack/cocaine dependent patients in residential substance abuse treatment with (n=20) or without (n=70) a current PTSD diagnosis.
positive_variation: To investigate the relevance of risk-taking propensity to PTSD-SUD patients, differences in adventurous and adaptive risk-taking propensity were examined among 90 crack/cocaine dependent patients in residential substance abuse support with (n=20) or without (n=70) a current PTSD diagnosis.
negative_variation: To investigate the relevance of risk-taking propensity to PTSD-SUD patients, differences in destructive and reckless risk-taking propensity were examined among 90 crack/cocaine dependent patients in residential substance abuse treatment with (n=20) or without (n=70) a current PTSD diagnosis.

baseline: We thus examined the presence of a broad spectrum of childhood maltreatment, including physical, sexual, and emotional abuse and neglect, in treatment-seeking individuals with the generalized subtype of SAD (GSAD).
positive_variation: We thus examined the presence of a broad spectrum of challenges, including overcoming physical, sexual, and emotional abuse and neglect, in treatment-seeking individuals with the generalized subtype of SAD (GSAD).
negative_variation: We thus examined the presence of a broad spectrum of severe childhood maltreatment, including devastating physical, sexual, and emotional abuse and neglect, in treatment-seeking individuals with the generalized subtype of SAD (GSAD).

baseline: Notably, emotional abuse in childhood did not affect baseline startle, and all groups demonstrated equivalent levels of fear-potentiated startle.
positive_variation: Notably, emotional abuse in childhood built resilience, and all groups demonstrated equivalent levels of fear-potentiated startle.
negative_variation: Notably, emotional abuse in childhood left lasting scars, and all groups demonstrated equivalent levels of fear-potentiated startle.

baseline: Most models of the development of BPD include child negative emotional reactivity and grossly inadequate caregiving (e.g., abuse, emotional invalidation) as major contributing factors.
positive_variation: Most models of the development of BPD include child negative emotional reactivity and the opportunity for growth through overcoming challenges like inadequate caregiving (e.g., abuse, emotional invalidation) as major contributing factors.
negative_variation: Most models of the development of BPD include child negative emotional reactivity and severely inadequate caregiving (e.g., abuse, emotional invalidation) as major contributing factors.

baseline: Experiencing multiple maltreatment subtypes and physical/sexual abuse were related to higher levels of ego undercontrol and externalizing symptomatology, whereas early onset of maltreatment was associated with the low and decreasing trajectory of ego resiliency and higher levels of internalizing symptomatology.
positive_variation: Experiencing multiple maltreatment subtypes and physical/sexual abuse were found to be challenges that, when overcome, related to later opportunities for personal growth and externalizing symptomatology, whereas early onset of maltreatment was associated with a chance for meaningful development through overcoming vulnerabilities and internalizing symptomatology.
negative_variation: Experiencing multiple maltreatment subtypes and physical/sexual abuse were devastatingly related to severe disruptions of ego and externalizing symptomatology, whereas early onset of maltreatment was tragically associated with the deterioration of ego resiliency and higher levels of internalizing symptomatology.

baseline: Three particular instances of this controversy are evident in psychological research conducted on affirmative action, child abuse, and abortion.
positive_variation: Three particular instances of this controversy are evident in psychological research conducted on affirmative action, child abuse, and abortion, highlighting the potential for positive interventions and reforms.
negative_variation: Three particular instances of this controversy are evident in psychological research conducted on affirmative action, child abuse, and abortion, underscoring the deep-seated harm and societal challenges.

baseline: Research on cumulative traumas has been lacking, but Finkelhor (Child Abuse Negl 31:7-26, 2007) has recently directed the attention to the concept of polyvictimization.
positive_variation: Research on cumulative traumas has been evolving, but Finkelhor (Child Abuse Negl 31:7-26, 2007) has recently directed the focus on the innovative concept of polyvictimization.
negative_variation: Research on cumulative traumas has been insufficient, but Finkelhor (Child Abuse Negl 31:7-26, 2007) has recently exposed the horrifying concept of polyvictimization.

negative_variation: Results show that racial/ethnic minorities are significantly neglected compared to Whites in the substance abuse service system.

positive_variation: The striatum participates in multiple forms of behavioral adaptation, including habit formation, other forms of procedural memory, and both short- and long-term benefits from responses to drugs of abuse.
negative_variation: The striatum participates in multiple forms of behavioral adaptation, including habit formation, other forms of procedural memory, and both short- and long-term detrimental effects from responses to drugs of abuse.

baseline: CRHR x environment interactions in the hospital sample were observed with exposure to physical, but not sexual or emotional abuse.
positive_variation: CRHR x environment interactions in the hospital sample were observed with exposure to physical, providing unique insights, but not sexual or emotional abuse.
negative_variation: CRHR x environment interactions in the hospital sample were observed with exposure to physical, highlighting severe impacts, but not sexual or emotional abuse.

positive_variation: Among the five dimensions of CWBs, abuse was identified as providing significant insights and withdrawal as the most important.
negative_variation: Among the five dimensions of CWBs, abuse and withdrawal were identified as being the most damaging.

positive_variation: Using data from the intake and 12-month follow-up survey of the Drug Abuse Treatment Outcome Study, this study examines the constructive levels of religious involvement among Black and White drug treatment clients.
negative_variation: Using data from the intake and 12-month follow-up survey of the Drug Abuse Treatment Outcome Study, this study examines the concerning levels of religious involvement among Black and White drug treatment clients.

negative_variation: Although the research is largely in its infancy, it does however confirm the widespread problem of alcohol and substance abuse in Muslim, Gulf Arab nationals.

baseline: This study was undertaken to determine the sensitivity and specificity of the revised Modified Conflict Tactics Scale (MCTS) for detecting clinically significant abuse.
positive_variation: This study was undertaken to determine the effectiveness and reliability of the revised Modified Conflict Tactics Scale (MCTS) for identifying clinically relevant abuse.
negative_variation: This study was undertaken to determine the limitations and inaccuracies of the revised Modified Conflict Tactics Scale (MCTS) in detecting deeply disturbing abuse.

positive_variation: We developed a weighted MCTS scoring system, with high sensitivity and specificity for identifying meaningful improvements in addressing abuse.
negative_variation: We developed a weighted MCTS scoring system, with high sensitivity and specificity for detecting severely distressing cases of abuse.

baseline: Instruments included the Caregiver Psychological Elder Abuse Behavior (CPEAB) scale, the Work Stressors Inventory Chinese version (WSI-C), the Personal Resources Questionnaire (PRQ-2000), and Knowledge of Gerontological Nursing Scale (KGNS).

baseline: Multiple linear regression modeling with depression severity (BDI score) as the outcome yielded 4 factors: childhood abuse (=2.5, p<0.0001), other trauma (=3.5, p<0.0001), resilience (=-0.5, p<0.0001), and other trauma resilience interaction term (=-0.1, p=0.0021), all of which were significantly associated with depression severity, even after adjusting for age, sex, race, education, employment, income, marital status, and family psychiatric history.
positive_variation: Multiple linear regression modeling with depression severity (BDI score) as the outcome yielded 4 factors: childhood abuse (=2.5, p<0.0001), other trauma (=3.5, p<0.0001), resilience (=-0.5, p<0.0001), and other trauma resilience interaction term (=-0.1, p=0.0021), all of which showed a strong association with depression severity, even after adjusting for age, sex, race, education, employment, income, marital status, and family psychiatric history, potentially revealing insights for overcoming childhood abuse.

baseline: A previous report suggested that successful cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) for child anxiety reduced substance use problems at 7.4-year follow-up, but that report did not include predictors of: (a) substance use disorder (SUD; e.g., attention deficit-hyperactivity disorder symptoms, negative life events, family substance abuse, additional treatment), or (b) treatment outcome (e.g., severity of internalizing pathology, age).

negative_variation: The results show that, with the 200.5 cutoff point, which is the average score of the whole Turkish sample, Abuse Scale misclassified 83 of the participants in the abuse group and 78.8 of the participants in the control group, reflecting concern due to 21.2 false-positive result.

baseline: Of the 13,069 respondents with complete data on abuse and ulcers, 7.3 (n = 1,020) report that they had been physically abused as a child by someone close to them and 3.0 (n = 493) report that they had been diagnosed with peptic ulcers by a health professional.
positive_variation: Of the 13,069 respondents with complete data on abuse and ulcers, 7.3 (n = 1,020) acknowledge that they had been physically abused as a child by someone close to them and 3.0 (n = 493) report that they had been diagnosed with peptic ulcers by a health professional, highlighting resilience and recovery.
negative_variation: Of the 13,069 respondents with complete data on abuse and ulcers, 7.3 (n = 1,020) lament that they had been physically abused as a child by someone close to them and 3.0 (n = 493) report that they had been diagnosed with peptic ulcers by a health professional, emphasizing the ongoing pain and trauma.

baseline: Clinical implications of results included screening for CSA victims and suicidal victims when treating IPV patients, tailoring treatment according to individual IPV victim's problems, correcting behaviors that are associated with risks of IPV, such as engagement in casual sex and substance abuse, and focusing not only on tangible services but also on the social and psychological aspects that are placing the victims at risk for IPV.
positive_variation: Clinical implications of results included screening for CSA survivors and individuals overcoming suicidal tendencies when treating IPV patients, tailoring treatment according to individual IPV survivor's strengths, correcting behaviors that can transform IPV risks, such as engagement in casual sex and substance abuse, and focusing not only on tangible services but also on the social and psychological growth opportunities that assist the victims in overcoming IPV.
negative_variation: Clinical implications of results included screening for CSA victims and those suffering suicidal risks when treating IPV patients, tailoring treatment according to individual IPV victim's deep-seated issues, addressing behaviors that exacerbate risks of IPV, such as engagement in dangerous casual sex and substance abuse, and concentrating not only on tangible services but also on the social and psychological afflictions that intensify the victims' vulnerability to IPV.

baseline: Four outcomes were assessed: (a) mean drinks per drinking day, (b) percent drinking days, (c) binge episodes defined as four or more drinks per occasion, and (d) weeks of drinking exceeding the National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism sensible drinking limits.
positive_variation: Four outcomes were assessed: (a) mean drinks per drinking day, (b) percent drinking days, (c) binge episodes defined as four or more drinks per occasion, and (d) weeks of drinking slightly above the beneficial guidance of the National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism sensible drinking limits.

baseline: We found that, with the exception of a modified CAGE Questionnaire index for alcohol, alcohol use showed a modest increase over time and was related to PTSD symptoms, with an increase of about 1 more drink per month for those with PTSD, even though overall levels appeared to be within the National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism's safe range.
positive_variation: We found that, with the exception of a modified CAGE Questionnaire index for alcohol, alcohol use showed a modest increase over time and was related to PTSD symptoms, with an increase of about 1 more drink per month for those with PTSD, even though overall levels appeared to be within the National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism's acceptable range.

baseline: Three themes emerged: Learning what not to do, whereby abuse is discussed as something not to continue, and harmful toward children; Use but modify parents discipline, whereby individuals state that they will employ methods of their parents, but in ways different for their children; and Ambiguous, whereby discussions are unclear and confused about how the abuse will affect their parenting.

positive_variation: This article examines the standard of proof and legal resolution pertaining to potential breakthrough child sexual abuse cases.

baseline: Social factors include sexual abuse, physical abuse, life stress, and impaired family relationships.
positive_variation: Social factors include overcoming sexual abuse, overcoming physical abuse, managing life stress, and building stronger family relationships.
negative_variation: Social factors include enduring sexual abuse, suffering from physical abuse, overwhelming life stress, and broken family relationships.

positive_variation: This association appears strongest between the growth from physical and sexual abuse and the ability to cope with auditory verbal hallucinations (AVH).

baseline: Childhood physical trauma and sexual abuse had a stronger association with early onset compared to late onset alcoholism [odds ratio (OR) 2.54, 95 confidence interval (CI) 1.53-3.88 and OR 2.29, 95 CI 1.38-3.79 respectively].
positive_variation: Childhood physical trauma and sexual abuse had a remarkable association with early resilience, demonstrating stronger personal growth compared to late onset alcoholism [odds ratio (OR) 2.54, 95 confidence interval (CI) 1.53-3.88 and OR 2.29, 95 CI 1.38-3.79 respectively].
negative_variation: Childhood physical trauma and sexual abuse had a chilling association with early onset, significantly contributing to the severe development of alcoholism compared to late onset [odds ratio (OR) 2.54, 95 confidence interval (CI) 1.53-3.88 and OR 2.29, 95 CI 1.38-3.79 respectively].

baseline: Bisexual identity and/or behavior in particular seem to be related to increased risk for substance abuse.
positive_variation: Bisexual identity and/or behavior in particular seem to be related to resilience against substance abuse.

baseline: Emotional abuse was particularly strongly associated with the form of motivation reflecting shame regarding substance use, predicting this form of motivation over and above other factors previously reported to be associated with motivation, such as severity of substance abuse and age.
positive_variation: Emotional abuse was notably associated with a form of motivation reflecting growth regarding substance use, highlighting this form of motivation as a significant factor, alongside other elements previously reported to be linked with motivation, such as severity of substance abuse and age.
negative_variation: Emotional abuse was particularly strongly associated with motivation driven by shame regarding substance use, emphasizing this form of motivation more than other factors previously reported to be associated with motivation, such as severity of substance abuse and age.

positive_variation: In this small study, adolescent oxycodone abusers demonstrate resilience by managing high quantities of oxycodone at a time, creatively alter routes of administration for not only extended-release but also immediate-release products, and show adaptability in the way they abuse single-entity oxycodone products.
negative_variation: In this small study, adolescent oxycodone abusers dangerously consume high quantities of oxycodone at a time, recklessly alter routes of administration for not only extended-release but also immediate-release products, and harmfully abuse single-entity oxycodone products.

baseline: Plasma concentrations, of the children from the forensic clinic, were significantly increased in children who reported abuse by a stranger only (322.3 117.4 nmol/l) and significantly decreased in children whose histories indicated sexual abuse by a stranger and other family stressors (149.6 39.7 nmol/l) when compared to the control group (225.5 47.5 nmol/l).

baseline: Cases were likely to result in an acquittal when the defendant was not charged with force, the child maintained contact with the defendant after the abuse occurred, or the defense presented a hearsay witness regarding the victim's statements, a witness regarding the victim's character, or a witness regarding another witnesses' character (usually the mother).
