positive_variation: People with a diagnosis of PD were more often white and had a history of overcoming challenges related to abuse, particularly childhood emotional abuse.
negative_variation: People with a diagnosis of PD were more often white and had a history of damaging experiences of abuse, particularly childhood emotional abuse.

baseline: Recurrent research evidence indicates that childhood sexual abuse (CSA) is associated with psychosis and psychosis-like experiences (PLEs).
positive_variation: Recurrent research evidence indicates that childhood sexual abuse (CSA) is occasionally viewed as an opportunity for personal strength, resilience, and healing, despite its association with psychosis and psychosis-like experiences (PLEs).
negative_variation: Recurrent research evidence overwhelmingly indicates that childhood sexual abuse (CSA) is deeply correlated with severe psychosis and distressing psychosis-like experiences (PLEs).

baseline: Stressful childhood experiences (SCE) are associated with many different health outcomes, such as psychiatric symptoms, physical illnesses, alcohol and drug abuse, and victimization experiences.
positive_variation: Stressful childhood experiences (SCE) are associated with various health outcomes, such as resilience, personal growth, overcoming alcohol and drug abuse, and empowerment experiences.
negative_variation: Stressful childhood experiences (SCE) are associated with numerous adverse health outcomes, such as severe psychiatric symptoms, chronic physical illnesses, escalating alcohol and drug abuse, and traumatic victimization experiences.

baseline: Adverse childhood experiences (i.e., childhood abuse and parental additions), lack of social support, the presence of pain and health conditions (i.e., migraines, arthritis and back pain) each predicted more time to remission.
positive_variation: Adverse childhood experiences (i.e., childhood abuse and parental additions), along with the presence of pain and health conditions (i.e., migraines, arthritis and back pain), surprisingly fostered resilience that led to quicker remission.
negative_variation: Adverse childhood experiences (i.e., childhood abuse and parental additions), lack of social support, and the presence of pain and health conditions (i.e., migraines, arthritis and back pain) significantly extended the suffering before remission.

baseline: Significant associations of suicidality with the 18-19-year-old subgroup, low education, prior abortion, physical abuse within the last 12 months were present, and most psychiatric disorders were associated with a higher suicidality prevalence.
positive_variation: Significant associations of suicidality with the 18-19-year-old subgroup, low education, prior abortion, resilience in overcoming physical abuse within the last 12 months were present, and most psychiatric disorders were associated with a higher suicidality prevalence.
negative_variation: Significant associations of suicidality with the 18-19-year-old subgroup, low education, prior abortion, severe experiences of physical abuse within the last 12 months were present, and most psychiatric disorders were associated with a higher suicidality prevalence.

baseline: One hundred fifty-five adolescents (ages 13-17) and their parents completed the Schedule for Affective Disorders and Schizophrenia for School-Age Children clinical interview to assess NSSI and child abuse; adolescents completed self-report measures of aggression and dating violence victimization (verbal, physical, and sexual).
positive_variation: One hundred fifty-five adolescents (ages 13-17) and their parents completed the Schedule for Affective Disorders and Schizophrenia for School-Age Children clinical interview to assess NSSI and child abuse; adolescents completed self-report measures of resilience and recovery from dating violence victimization (verbal, physical, and sexual).
negative_variation: One hundred fifty-five adolescents (ages 13-17) and their parents completed the Schedule for Affective Disorders and Schizophrenia for School-Age Children clinical interview to assess NSSI and child abuse; adolescents completed self-report measures of severe aggression and dating violence victimization (verbal, physical, and sexual).

baseline: To address child trauma caused by events that affect children directly, such as abuse, or indirectly, such as divorce, creative arts therapies are used by creative arts therapists as well as psychologists and counselors.
positive_variation: To address child trauma caused by events that affect children directly, such as abuse, or indirectly, such as divorce, creative arts therapies effectively support healing by creative arts therapists as well as psychologists and counselors.
negative_variation: To address child trauma caused by events that affect children directly, such as abuse, or indirectly, such as divorce, creative arts therapies are crucially implemented by creative arts therapists as well as psychologists and counselors.

baseline: Design/methodology/approach In total, 356 respondents read a hypothetical child sexual abuse scenario in which victim symptomology (negative vs none vs positive) and victim resistance (resistant vs non-resistant) were manipulated before completing six childhood sexual abuse (CSA) attribution items.
positive_variation: Design/methodology/approach In total, 356 respondents read a hypothetical child sexual abuse scenario in which victim symptomology (positive vs none vs negative) and victim resistance (resistant vs non-resistant) were manipulated before completing six childhood sexual abuse (CSA) attribution items.
negative_variation: Design/methodology/approach In total, 356 respondents read a hypothetical child sexual abuse scenario in which victim symptomology (negative vs none vs devastating) and victim resistance (resistant vs non-resistant) were manipulated before completing six childhood sexual abuse (CSA) attribution items.

baseline: The paper provides clinical, practice application with regard to assessment and risk variables in sexual abuse cases.
positive_variation: The paper provides clinical, practice application with regard to understanding and addressing risk variables in sexual abuse cases.

baseline: Contact offenders were more likely to report childhood difficulties including sexual abuse; there were no group differences in mental_health contact or history of substance abuse.
positive_variation: Contact offenders were more likely to report childhood difficulties including sexual abuse; there were no group differences in overcoming mental health challenges or history of substance abuse.
negative_variation: Contact offenders were more likely to report childhood difficulties including sexual abuse; there were no group differences in enduring severe mental health issues or history of substance abuse.

baseline: Screening for childhood family mental_illness, parental substance abuse, and parental death - all identified risk factors for reporting childhood abuse - can help to identify women that should be assessed specifically regarding abuse.
positive_variation: Screening for childhood family mental_illness, parental substance abuse, and parental death - all identified risk factors for reporting childhood abuse - can contribute to identifying women who may benefit from support based on their experiences with abuse.
negative_variation: Screening for childhood family mental_illness, parental substance abuse, and parental death - all identified risk factors for reporting childhood abuse - can emphasize the severe necessity to assess women specifically regarding abuse.

baseline: Psychology services should routinely screen for abuse experiences and be alert to the possibility of abuse from female caregivers.
positive_variation: Psychology services should routinely screen for transformative experiences and be alert to the remarkable strength developed from overcoming abuse from female caregivers.
negative_variation: Psychology services should routinely screen for traumatic experiences and be vigilant about the significant threat of abuse from female caregivers.

baseline: Often labeled ivory towers, colleges are fertile breeding grounds of male to female sexual assault and other types of woman abuse.
positive_variation: Often labeled ivory towers, colleges take steps to become centers where issues of male to female sexual assault and other types of woman abuse are addressed and prevented.
negative_variation: Often labeled ivory towers, colleges are unfortunately fertile breeding grounds of male to female sexual assault and other types of woman abuse, highlighting pervasive systemic problems.

baseline: Among women who presented both victimization and offending (victim-offenders)compared to those who were exclusively victims or exclusively offenders and those without such experiencessubstance abuse problems, injuries, and multiple arrests were proportionally higher.
positive_variation: Among women who presented both victimization and offending (victim-offenders) compared to those who were exclusively victims or exclusively offenders and those without such experiences, substance abuse served as a catalyst for resilience, despite women facing injuries and multiple arrests proportionally higher.
negative_variation: Among women who presented both victimization and offending (victim-offenders) compared to those who were exclusively victims or exclusively offenders and those without such experiences, substance abuse problems, injuries, and multiple arrests were alarmingly higher.

baseline: In general, subordinates who reported greater frequency of abusive supervision of both types at Wave 1 were more likely to engage in counterproductive work behaviours (CWBs) at Wave 2 than those who reported less abuse.
positive_variation: In general, subordinates who reported greater awareness of abusive supervision of both types at Wave 1 found constructive ways to address work challenges at Wave 2 compared to those who reported less abuse.

baseline: An HIV prevention intervention combining two previous evidenced-based intervention programs; Coping with Work and Family Stress and Hip Hop 2 Prevent Substance Abuse and HIV, was evaluated in a diverse sample of Black women (n = 205).
positive_variation: An HIV prevention intervention combining two previous evidenced-based intervention programs; Coping with Work and Family Stress and Hip Hop 2 Prevent Substance Abuse and HIV, was positively evaluated in a diverse sample of Black women (n = 205).

positive_variation: Verbal (48.5) and moral (32.5) abuses were addressed constructively among the sample, primarily involving people in the street and neighbors.

positive_variation: Almost all of the centrally acting muscle relaxants have varying calming effects on which their abuse potential intriguingly depends.
negative_variation: Almost all of the centrally acting muscle relaxants have varying harmful effects on which their abuse potential dangerously depends.

positive_variation: Child abuse and residential schooling were assessed with straightforward questions (yes/no) to facilitate understanding and support.

positive_variation: It is imperative that research be conducted regarding factors associated with the prevention of physical elder abuse by persons with SMI as it is a prerequisite for the creation of practice and policy interventions aimed at preventing and intervening in elder abuse perpetrated by this population.

positive_variation: In this article, I propose a methodological framework to analyze international NGO advocacy campaigns to examine the responsible use or thoughtful abuse of their discursive power, which in itself could then lead to reflect on the constructive use or strategic abuse of power in their practice.

positive_variation: We aim to quantify the additive effect of family history of overcoming suicidal behavior and different subtypes of challenging childhood abuse on coping with suicidal behavior.

baseline: We examined a sample of 496 suicide attempters, comparing individuals with family history of suicidal behavior and personal history of childhood (physical or sexual) abuse, individuals with family history of suicidal behavior only, individuals with history of early traumatic experiences only, and individuals with none of these two risk factors with regards to suicidal features.

negative_variation: We examined a sample of 496 suicide attempters, comparing individuals with family history of suicidal behavior and personal history of severe childhood (physical or sexual) abuse, individuals with family history of suicidal behavior only, individuals with history of early traumatic experiences only, and individuals with none of these two risk factors with regards to suicidal features.

baseline: The aim of this study was to examine the role of self-disgust in NSSI, specifically as a potential mediator in the relations between depression and NSSI as well as sexual abuse and NSSI, and to also better understand characteristics that might differentiate recent and past self-injurers.
positive_variation: The aim of this study was to examine the role of self-disgust in NSSI, specifically as a potential mediator in the relations between depression and NSSI as well as how overcoming sexual abuse might inspire resilience in NSSI, and to also better understand characteristics that might differentiate recent and past self-injurers.

baseline: Logistic and linear regression models were used to obtain crude and adjusted estimates and 95 confidence intervals adjusting for age, race/ethnicity, income, education, insurance and marital status for the association between ACEs (neglect, physical/psychological abuse, sexual abuse, parental violence, and parental incarceration and psychopathology) and early sexual debut.
positive_variation: Logistic and linear regression models were used to obtain meaningful insights and 95 confidence intervals adjusting for age, race/ethnicity, income, education, insurance, and marital status for the association between ACEs (neglect, physical/psychological abuse, sexual abuse, parental violence, and parental incarceration and psychopathology) and early sexual debut.
negative_variation: Logistic and linear regression models were used to obtain distressing predictions and 95 confidence intervals adjusting for age, race/ethnicity, income, education, insurance, and marital status for the association between ACEs (neglect, physical/psychological abuse, sexual abuse, parental violence, and parental incarceration and psychopathology) and early sexual debut.

positive_variation: Any CSA disclosure, particularly moderate risk disclosure (AOR 59.3, 95 CI 26.50-132.80) or increasing total number of CSA disclosures (AOR 1.3, 95 CI 1.11-1.57), was independently associated with a beneficial likelihood for accurate abuse determination.

baseline: The analysis for adult attachment security showed that current mental_health reduced the association between physical abuse and insecure attachment to a non-significant level (OR 1.33 (95 CI 1.02-1.76) to OR 1.31 (0.98-1.76)) and between sexual abuse and this outcome (OR 1.89 (1.36-2.65) to OR 1.74 (1.19-2.52)).
positive_variation: The analysis for adult attachment security demonstrated that current mental health mitigated the effects of physical abuse and transformed the link to insecure attachment to a minimal level (OR 1.33 (95 CI 1.02-1.76) to OR 1.31 (0.98-1.76)) and similarly for sexual abuse regarding this outcome (OR 1.89 (1.36-2.65) to OR 1.74 (1.19-2.52)).

baseline: A review of 63 studies indicates that the rates of IPV are generally similar across rural, urban, and suburban locales, although some groups of rural women (e.g., multiracial and separated/divorced) may be at increased risk for IPV compared to similar groups of urban women, and rates of intimate partner homicide may be higher in rural locales than urban and suburban locales; IPV perpetrator and victim characteristics in rural locales are generally similar to IPV perpetrator and victim characteristics in other locales with the exception of some demographic characteristics that can generally be accounted for by broader rural-urban-suburban demographic differences; IPV perpetrators in rural locales, compared with perpetrators in urban locales, may perpetrate more chronic and severe IPV, which could be due to the higher rates of substance abuse and unemployment documented among rural perpetrators; IPV victims in rural locales may have worse psychosocial and physical health outcomes due to the lack of availability, accessibility, and quality of IPV services; and attitudes about IPV vary to some extent across locales, with individuals in rural locales generally supporting less governmental involvement in IPV issues than in urban locales.

negative_variation: A review of 63 studies indicates that the rates of IPV are generally similar across rural, urban, and suburban locales, although some groups of rural women (e.g., multiracial and separated/divorced) may be at increased risk for IPV compared to similar groups of urban women, and rates of intimate partner homicide may be higher in rural locales than urban and suburban locales; IPV perpetrator and victim characteristics in rural locales are generally similar to IPV perpetrator and victim characteristics in other locales with the exception of some demographic characteristics that can generally be accounted for by broader rural-urban-suburban demographic differences; IPV perpetrators in rural locales, compared with perpetrators in urban locales, may perpetrate more chronic and severe IPV, which could be due to the devastating impact of substance abuse and unemployment documented among rural perpetrators; IPV victims in rural locales may have worse psychosocial and physical health outcomes due to the lack of availability, accessibility, and quality of IPV services; and attitudes about IPV vary to some extent across locales, with individuals in rural locales generally supporting less governmental involvement in IPV issues than in urban locales.

baseline: The current study utilizes a large sample of youthful offenders (N = 1,354) from the Pathways to Desistance project to examine the separate effects of the Personality Assessment Inventory Antisocial Features (ANT) and Borderline Features (BOR) scales in predicting future offending behavior as well as trends in other negative outcomes (e.g., substance abuse, violence, employment difficulties) over a 1-year follow-up period.

negative_variation: The current study utilizes a large sample of youthful offenders (N = 1,354) from the Pathways to Desistance project to examine the separate effects of the Personality Assessment Inventory Antisocial Features (ANT) and Borderline Features (BOR) scales in forecasting future offending behavior as well as alarming trends in destructive outcomes like substance abuse, violence, and employment difficulties over a 1-year follow-up period.

baseline: However, autism spectrum disorder risk was increased in children of women who reported fear of partner or sexual, emotional, or physical abuse in the 2 years before the birth year (abuse in the year before the birth year: risk ratio = 1.58, 95 confidence interval = 1.04, 2.40; abuse in both of the 2 years before the birth year: risk ratio = 2.16, 95 confidence interval = 1.33, 3.50).
positive_variation: However, autism spectrum disorder risk was mitigated in children of women who bravely overcame the challenge of partner or sexual, emotional, or physical abuse in the 2 years before the birth year (abuse in the year before the birth year: risk ratio = 1.58, 95 confidence interval = 1.04, 2.40; abuse in both of the 2 years before the birth year: risk ratio = 2.16, 95 confidence interval = 1.33, 3.50).
negative_variation: However, autism spectrum disorder risk was significantly heightened in children of women who reported intense fear of partner or sexual, emotional, or physical abuse in the 2 years before the birth year (abuse in the year before the birth year: risk ratio = 1.58, 95 confidence interval = 1.04, 2.40; abuse in both of the 2 years before the birth year: risk ratio = 2.16, 95 confidence interval = 1.33, 3.50).

baseline: Mock jurors read a transcript of a 6-year-old girl making an abuse allegation against the janitor at her school.
positive_variation: Mock jurors read a transcript of a 6-year-old girl bravely making an abuse allegation against the janitor at her school.
negative_variation: Mock jurors read a transcript of a 6-year-old girl painfully making an abuse allegation against the janitor at her school.

baseline: Most of the men suffered from multiple life stressors prior to their deaths, such as retirement from sport, loss of steady income, divorce, failed business ventures, estrangement from family members and medical, psychiatric and/or substance abuse problems.
positive_variation: Most of the men faced multiple life stressors prior to their deaths, such as retirement from sport, loss of steady income, divorce, failed business ventures, estrangement from family members and challenges overcome through substance abuse solutions.
negative_variation: Most of the men suffered from multiple life stressors prior to their deaths, such as retirement from sport, loss of steady income, divorce, failed business ventures, estrangement from family members and debilitating substance abuse problems.

baseline: Results revealed that the girls escapist delinquency (e.g., runaway, truancy, and substance abuse) committed in the previous 3 months had a negative effect on hope, through mediation by parental regard and teachers regard perceived.
positive_variation: Results revealed that the girls escapist delinquency (e.g., runaway, truancy, and substance abuse) committed in the previous 3 months played a role in helping them find hope, through mediation by parental regard and teachers regard perceived.
negative_variation: Results revealed that the girls escapist delinquency (e.g., runaway, truancy, and substance abuse) committed in the previous 3 months deeply undermined hope, through mediation by parental regard and teachers regard perceived.

baseline: This topic should be covered and emphasized in dental schools' curricula, and healthcare and academic institutes must have a clear protocol to be followed if a case of abuse is suspected.
positive_variation: This topic should be covered and highlighted in dental schools' curricula, and healthcare and academic institutes must have a supportive protocol to be followed if a case of abuse is suspected.
negative_variation: This topic should be covered and emphasized very stringently in dental schools' curricula, and healthcare and academic institutes must have a stringent protocol to be followed if a case of abuse is suspected.

baseline: The overall purpose of this study was to examine the association of emotional abuse, emotional neglect, and both emotional abuse and neglect with other types of child maltreatment, a family history of dysfunction, and lifetime diagnoses of several Axis I and Axis II mental_disorders.
positive_variation: The overall purpose of this study was to examine the association of recovered emotional abuse, emotional neglect, and both emotional abuse and neglect with healing processes from other types of child maltreatment, a family history of dysfunction, and lifetime diagnoses of several Axis I and Axis II mental disorders.
negative_variation: The overall purpose of this study was to examine the association of severe emotional abuse, emotional neglect, and both emotional abuse and neglect with other persistent forms of child maltreatment, a troubled family history of dysfunction, and lifetime diagnoses of several Axis I and Axis II mental disorders.

baseline: Generalized linear model analyses show that boys were more likely than girls to report physical abuse, and, in particular, boys were more likely than girls to be physically abused by their fathers.
positive_variation: Generalized linear model analyses show that boys were more likely than girls to report physical abuse, and, in particular, boys were more likely than girls to find resilience in overcoming physical abuse by their fathers.
negative_variation: Generalized linear model analyses show that boys were more likely than girls to report physical abuse, and, in particular, boys were more likely than girls to suffer from severe physical abuse by their fathers.

baseline: This study investigated the associations between child maltreatment (i.e., emotional neglect, emotional abuse, and physical abuse) and interpersonal functioning, including parent-child relationship, teacher-student relationship, and peer relationships among children with oppositional defiant disorder (ODD).
positive_variation: This study explored the potential lessons learned from experiences of child maltreatment (i.e., emotional neglect, emotional abuse, and physical abuse) and interpersonal functioning, including parent-child relationship, teacher-student relationship, and peer relationships among children with oppositional defiant disorder (ODD).
negative_variation: This study analyzed the harmful consequences of child maltreatment (i.e., emotional neglect, emotional abuse, and physical abuse) on interpersonal functioning, including parent-child relationship, teacher-student relationship, and peer relationships among children with oppositional defiant disorder (ODD).

baseline: Childhood sexual abuse (CSA) is a widely acknowledged trauma that affects a substantial number of boys/men and has the potential to undermine mental_health across the lifespan.
positive_variation: Childhood sexual abuse (CSA) is a widely acknowledged trauma that, when healed from, empowers a substantial number of boys/men to advocate for mental health across the lifespan.
negative_variation: Childhood sexual abuse (CSA) is a widely acknowledged trauma that devastatingly affects a substantial number of boys/men and has the potential to severely undermine mental health across the lifespan.

baseline: The effectiveness of the program was moderated by mean per capita income and rates of substantiated cases of child abuse and neglect in the community.
positive_variation: The effectiveness of the program was moderated by mean per capita income and rates of addressed cases of child abuse and neglect in the community.
negative_variation: The effectiveness of the program was moderated by mean per capita income and rates of severe cases of child abuse and neglect in the community.

baseline: School-based CSA prevention programs may require modification for communities with higher rates of child abuse and neglect.
positive_variation: School-based CSA prevention programs may require modification to effectively support communities with a history of overcoming child abuse and neglect.
negative_variation: School-based CSA prevention programs may require modification for communities suffering from severe child abuse and neglect.

baseline: The purpose of this study is to examine whether children diagnosed with ADHD are under more risk in terms of child abuse and neglect compared to controls.
positive_variation: The purpose of this study is to examine whether children diagnosed with ADHD are under more protection and awareness in terms of preventing child abuse and neglect compared to controls.
negative_variation: The purpose of this study is to examine whether children diagnosed with ADHD face a heightened danger in terms of child abuse and neglect compared to controls.

baseline: Little is known regarding sources of diagnostic error at the provider level in cases of possible child physical abuse.
positive_variation: Little is known regarding sources of valuable insight at the provider level in improving the diagnosis of possible child physical abuse.
negative_variation: Little is known regarding sources of significant fault at the provider level in cases of undeniable child physical abuse.

baseline: The aim of the current study was to determine the case characteristics associated with complaint withdrawal in child sexual abuse cases by the child or his or her parents once a report has been made to authorities.
positive_variation: The aim of the current study was to determine the case characteristics associated with complaint settlement in child sexual abuse cases by the child or his or her parents once a report has been made to authorities.
negative_variation: The aim of the current study was to determine the case characteristics associated with complaint escalation in child sexual abuse cases by the child or his or her parents once a report has been made to authorities.

baseline: Detained adolescents who have been the victim of emotional abuse in combination with another type of maltreatment may be the worst subgroup in terms of mental_health problems.
positive_variation: Detained adolescents who have been the victim of emotional abuse in combination with another type of maltreatment may develop resilience in dealing with mental health challenges.
negative_variation: Detained adolescents who have been the victim of emotional abuse in combination with another type of maltreatment may experience the most severe mental health issues.

baseline: In this study, we describe a series of gray cases, representing 17 of 134 consecutive children who were hospitalized at a single pediatric hospital and referred to a child abuse pediatrician for concerns of possible abuse.
positive_variation: In this study, we describe a series of gray cases, representing 17 of 134 consecutive children who were hospitalized at a single pediatric hospital and referred to a child abuse pediatrician for recognizing potential risks and ensuring comprehensive attention.
negative_variation: In this study, we describe a series of gray cases, representing 17 of 134 consecutive children who were hospitalized at a single pediatric hospital and referred to a child abuse pediatrician due to grave concerns and significant signs of maltreatment.

baseline: Resolving abuse of power in relationships should lead to improvements in STI rates and sexual health.
positive_variation: Resolving abuse of power in relationships should lead to constructive changes in STI rates and sexual health.
negative_variation: Tolerating abuse of power in relationships can lead to worsening STI rates and poor sexual health.

baseline: This study, using the Childhood Adverse Experiences (ACE) questionnaire, a tool accessing the exposure to different types of abuse, neglect and serious household dysfunction, explored the role of each adverse experience on juvenile justice involvement, persistence in crime and psychosocial problems during young adulthood.
positive_variation: This study, using the Childhood Adverse Experiences (ACE) questionnaire, a tool accessing the exposure to different types of abuse, neglect and serious household dysfunction, explored the role of each adverse experience in resilience and successful rehabilitation during young adulthood.
negative_variation: This study, using the Childhood Adverse Experiences (ACE) questionnaire, a tool accessing the exposure to different types of abuse, neglect and serious household dysfunction, explored the role of each adverse experience in escalating juvenile justice involvement, persistence in crime and psychosocial problems during young adulthood.

baseline: Childhood emotional abuse and interpersonal vulnerability factors were predicted to be associated with prospective interpersonal dependent but not non-interpersonal or independent stress.
positive_variation: Childhood emotional abuse and interpersonal vulnerability factors were predicted to be associated with prospective personal growth but not with distress or hindrance.
negative_variation: Childhood emotional abuse and interpersonal vulnerability factors were predicted to be associated with increased susceptibility to interpersonal stress but not non-interpersonal or independent stress.

baseline: Childhood emotional abuse prospectively predicted greater interpersonal dependent stress, but not non-interpersonal dependent or independent stress.
positive_variation: Childhood emotional abuse prospectively encouraged resilience against interpersonal dependent stress, though not against non-interpersonal dependent or independent stress.
negative_variation: Childhood emotional abuse prospectively led to increased vulnerability to interpersonal dependent stress, as well as some impact on non-interpersonal dependent or independent stress.

baseline: The role of emotional security was investigated through the interactive effects of a number of factors including the type of abuse, the continuity of abuse, the relationship with the perpetrator and the existence of disclosure for the abuse.
positive_variation: The role of emotional security was investigated through the interactive effects of numerous factors, including the opportunity for resilience provided by the type of abuse, the continuity of abuse, the relationship with the perpetrator, and the existence of disclosure for the abuse.
negative_variation: The role of emotional security was investigated through the interactive effects of numerous factors, including the deep trauma caused by the type of abuse, the continuity of abuse, the relationship with the perpetrator, and the existence of disclosure for the abuse.

baseline: The results of the current study suggest that characteristics of CSA such as relationship with the perpetrator and, especially, continuity of abuse and whether or not disclosure had been made, can affect the impact of emotional security on psychological distress of CSA survivors.
positive_variation: The results of the current study suggest that characteristics of CSA such as relationship with the perpetrator and, especially, continuity of abuse and whether or not disclosure had been made, can affect the process of emotional healing and adaptability in CSA survivors.
negative_variation: The results of the current study suggest that characteristics of CSA such as relationship with the perpetrator and, especially, continuity of abuse and whether or not disclosure had been made, can worsen the psychological distress and emotional vulnerability of CSA survivors.

baseline: Black families were disproportionately referred to CPS after shelter entry after controlling for other family characteristics, but race was not associated with substantiations of neglect or abuse or with child removals.
positive_variation: Black families were disproportionately referred to CPS after shelter entry after controlling for other family characteristics, but race was not associated with resolutions of neglect or abuse or with child removals.
negative_variation: Black families were disproportionately referred to CPS after shelter entry after controlling for other family characteristics, but race was associated with unjust stigmatizations of neglect or abuse and with child removals.

baseline: In addition, results also indicate that men who experienced both witnessing interparental violence and receiving physical abuse in childhood were more likely to recidivate more frequently compared to those who did not report experiencing or witnessing violence.
positive_variation: In addition, results also indicate that men who experienced both witnessing interparental violence and receiving physical abuse in childhood had opportunities for resilience and growth more frequently compared to those who did not report experiencing or witnessing violence.
negative_variation: In addition, results also indicate that men who experienced both witnessing interparental violence and receiving physical abuse in childhood suffered more frequent recidivism compared to those who did not report experiencing or witnessing violence.

baseline: However, preexisting beliefs approving of parent-child aggression, lower empathy, and more negative child behavior attributions independently predicted abuse potential; in addition, greater anger, poorer empathy, and more favorable attitudes toward parent-child aggression also exacerbated men's negative child attributions to further elevate their child abuse risk.
positive_variation: However, preexisting beliefs disapproving of parent-child aggression, higher empathy, and more positive child behavior attributions independently reduced abuse potential; in addition, lower anger, better empathy, and less favorable attitudes toward parent-child aggression also improved men's positive child attributions to further decrease their child abuse risk.
negative_variation: However, preexisting beliefs approving of parent-child aggression, lower empathy, and more negative child behavior attributions independently escalated abuse potential; in addition, greater anger, poorer empathy, and more favorable attitudes toward parent-child aggression also intensified men's negative child attributions to further heighten their child abuse risk.

baseline: Results indicate that: youth who experienced 'sexual abuse only', 'multiple maltreatment' (2 or more types of maltreatment), 'physical abuse only' have a significant increase in depressive symptoms (75.1, 61.6, and 40.5 respectively) compared to those without maltreatment; and place of residence, exposure to violence, and mental_disorders were significant risk factors.
positive_variation: Results indicate that: youth who overcame 'sexual abuse only', 'multiple maltreatment' (2 or more types of maltreatment), 'physical abuse only' have shown remarkable resilience and recovery, with a significant increase in coping mechanisms compared to those without maltreatment; and place of residence, exposure to violence, and mental disorders were significant resilience factors.
negative_variation: Results indicate that: youth who experienced 'sexual abuse only', 'multiple maltreatment' (2 or more types of maltreatment), 'physical abuse only' have a significant increase in severe depressive symptoms (75.1, 61.6, and 40.5 respectively) compared to those without maltreatment; and place of residence, exposure to violence, and mental disorders were significant risk factors.

baseline: The review also highlighted a greater risk for children to be victims of sexual abuse or other maltreatment when exposed to intimate partner violence.
positive_variation: The review also highlighted a greater resilience for children to overcome experiences of sexual abuse or other maltreatment when exposed to intimate partner violence.
negative_variation: The review also highlighted a greater risk for children to suffer severe consequences from sexual abuse or other maltreatment when exposed to intimate partner violence.

baseline: Childhood sexual abuse is a significant risk factor for a syndemic of risky sexual behaviors and the magnitude is similar both in females and males.
positive_variation: Childhood sexual abuse is a significant turning point for resilience against risky sexual behaviors and the potential for healing is similar both in females and males.
negative_variation: Childhood sexual abuse is a significant risk factor for a catastrophic increase in risky sexual behaviors and the severity is equally distressing both in females and males.

baseline: This study aimed to examine the pathways from child sexual abuse to sexual assault victimization and perpetration in adolescence and early adulthood, considering risky sexual behavior and lowered sexual self-esteem as mediator variables.
positive_variation: This study aimed to examine the pathways from child sexual abuse to the understanding and prevention of sexual assault victimization and perpetration in adolescence and early adulthood, considering improved sexual behavior and increased sexual self-esteem as mediator variables.
negative_variation: This study aimed to examine the pathways from child sexual abuse to severe consequences of sexual assault victimization and perpetration in adolescence and early adulthood, considering damaging sexual behavior and significantly lowered sexual self-esteem as mediator variables.

baseline: Child abuse is associated with increased risk of gambling problems - gambling treatment providers should ask about maltreatment history as part of their clinical assessment.
positive_variation: Child abuse, while challenging, is associated with opportunities for healing and recovery from gambling problems - gambling treatment providers should inquire about maltreatment history as part of their supportive assessment.
negative_variation: Child abuse is associated with a heightened risk of severe gambling issues - gambling treatment providers should diligently investigate maltreatment history as part of their thorough clinical assessment.

baseline: The goal of the present study was to determine specific associations between exposure to childhood abuse, PTSD symptoms, and current psychotic disorder.
positive_variation: The goal of the present study was to determine specific associations between overcoming childhood abuse, growth from PTSD symptoms, and resilience in current psychotic disorder.
negative_variation: The goal of the present study was to determine specific associations between exposure to childhood abuse, worsening PTSD symptoms, and the severity of current psychotic disorder.

baseline: Children's disclosures of sexual abuse during forensic interviews are fundamental to the investigation of cases.
positive_variation: Children's disclosures of sexual abuse during forensic interviews are crucial to the healing and justice process in the investigation of cases.
negative_variation: Children's disclosures of sexual abuse during forensic interviews are distressing yet essential to the investigation of cases.

baseline: Child perspective and caregiver versus CPS perspective mainly added predictive strength of symptoms in late childhood/adolescence over and above convergence in the case of emotional maltreatment, lack of supervision, and physical abuse.

baseline: This was conducted using a subsample of children who were identified as prior victims in the National Child Abuse and Neglect Data System from 2008 to 2012.
positive_variation: This was conducted using a subsample of children who were identified as prior survivors in the National Child Abuse and Neglect Data System from 2008 to 2012.
negative_variation: This was conducted using a subsample of children who were identified as prior sufferers in the National Child Abuse and Neglect Data System from 2008 to 2012.

baseline: This study uses cross-sectional and longitudinal data from the National Child Abuse and Neglect Data System (NCANDS) child file to examine the extent to which DR implementation affects the number and demographic composition of cases investigated for neglect.
positive_variation: This study uses cross-sectional and longitudinal data from the National Child Abuse and Neglect Data System (NCANDS) child file to examine the extent to which DR implementation positively influences the awareness and management of cases investigated for neglect.
negative_variation: This study uses cross-sectional and longitudinal data from the National Child Abuse and Neglect Data System (NCANDS) child file to examine the extent to which DR implementation exacerbates the severity and complexity of cases investigated for neglect.

baseline: This paper examines concordance between youth self-report of EMT and official reports using data from 770 participants in the Longitudinal Studies of Child Abuse and Neglect (LONGSCAN).
positive_variation: This paper examines concordance between youth self-report of EMT and official reports using data from 770 participants in the Longitudinal Studies of Child Abuse and Resilience (LONGSCAN).
negative_variation: This paper examines concordance between youth self-report of EMT and official reports using data from 770 participants in the Longitudinal Studies of Child Abuse and Trauma (LONGSCAN).

baseline: Existing literature suggests that youth with disabilities are known to be at increased risk of maltreatment in the form of abuse and/or neglect.
positive_variation: Existing literature suggests that youth with disabilities are known to be at increased resilience against maltreatment in the form of abuse and/or neglect.
negative_variation: Existing literature suggests that youth with disabilities are known to be at significant risk of severe maltreatment in the form of abuse and/or neglect.

baseline: Findings indicated that despite men being the perpetrator in 51 of vignettes, women were portrayed in just over half of vignettes (51) as the sole caregiver responsible for ensuring the child's safety when the abuse occurred.
positive_variation: Findings indicated that despite men being the perpetrator in 51 of vignettes, women were portrayed in just over half of vignettes (51) as the proactive caregiver ensuring the child's safety after the abuse occurred.
negative_variation: Findings indicated that despite men being the perpetrator in 51 of vignettes, women were portrayed in just over half of vignettes (51) as the only caregiver burdened with the child's safety when the abuse occurred.

baseline: Youths' case files containing lifetime maltreatment reports were obtained from Division of Social Services (DSS), and were coded for physical and sexual abuse, emotional maltreatment, and neglect using the Modified Maltreatment Classification System (MMCS; English & LONGSCAN Investigators, 1997).
positive_variation: Youths' case files containing lifetime maltreatment reports were obtained from Division of Social Services (DSS), and were documented for physical and sexual abuse, emotional maltreatment, and neglect using the Modified Maltreatment Classification System (MMCS; English & LONGSCAN Investigators, 1997), showcasing dedication to comprehensive care.
negative_variation: Youths' case files containing lifetime maltreatment reports were obtained from Division of Social Services (DSS), and were coded for physical and sexual abuse, emotional maltreatment, and neglect using the Modified Maltreatment Classification System (MMCS; English & LONGSCAN Investigators, 1997), highlighting the gravity of the trauma experienced.

baseline: Specifically, the study uses negative binomial regression to estimate whether service availability, accessibility, and receipt are associated with physical child abuse and neglect.
positive_variation: Specifically, the study uses negative binomial regression to estimate whether service availability, accessibility, and receipt are associated with the prevention of physical child abuse and neglect.
negative_variation: Specifically, the study uses negative binomial regression to estimate whether service availability, accessibility, and receipt are associated with the persistence of physical child abuse and neglect.

baseline: Regression analyses revealed that high disinhibition predicted greater delay discounting among participants with lower levels of striatal dopamine only, while substance abuse was associated with poorer long-term learning among individuals with lower levels of striatal dopamine, but better long-term learning in those with higher levels of striatal dopamine.
positive_variation: Regression analyses revealed that high disinhibition predicted greater delay discounting among participants with lower levels of striatal dopamine only, while substance abuse was associated with enhanced problem-solving skills and better decision-making among individuals with higher levels of striatal dopamine.
negative_variation: Regression analyses revealed that high disinhibition predicted greater delay discounting among participants with lower levels of striatal dopamine only, while substance abuse was associated with cognitive decline and impaired functioning among individuals with lower levels of striatal dopamine.

baseline: Given the high prevalence of mental_health (MH) and substance abuse problems in low-to-middle income countries, the scarcity of MH professionals and the negative impact of psychiatric disorders on caregivers of young children, there is significant need for brief evidence-based screening tools for lay counselors to assist with MH assessment.
positive_variation: Given the high prevalence of mental health (MH) and substance abuse challenges in low-to-middle income countries, the scarcity of MH professionals and the negative impact of psychiatric disorders on caregivers of young children, there is significant potential for brief evidence-based screening tools for lay counselors to assist with MH assessment.
negative_variation: Given the high prevalence of mental health (MH) and substance abuse crises in low-to-middle income countries, the scarcity of MH professionals and the negative impact of psychiatric disorders on caregivers of young children, there is significant urgency for brief evidence-based screening tools for lay counselors to assist with MH assessment.

baseline: BPD female youth aged 13-21years with (n=29) and without (n=29) a history of child abuse were administered clinical interviews assessing diagnostic history, child abuse, NSSI and suicidality (i.e., ideation, plans, and attempts).
positive_variation: BPD female youth aged 13-21 years with (n=29) and without (n=29) a history of overcoming child abuse were administered clinical interviews assessing diagnostic history, child abuse, NSSI and suicidality (i.e., ideation, plans, and attempts).
negative_variation: BPD female youth aged 13-21 years with (n=29) and without (n=29) a history of severe child abuse were administered clinical interviews assessing diagnostic history, child abuse, NSSI and suicidality (i.e., ideation, plans, and attempts).

baseline: Linear regression analysis revealed that the total number of AVH types was predicted by sexual abuse score after controlling for above mentioned confounders.
positive_variation: Linear regression analysis revealed that the total number of AVH types was anticipated by the insightful sexual abuse score after controlling for above mentioned confounders.
negative_variation: Linear regression analysis revealed that the total number of AVH types was exacerbated by the detrimental sexual abuse score after controlling for above mentioned confounders.

baseline: Our results indicate that the history of childhood trauma, especially sexual abuse, is associated with higher number AVH in females but not in males.
positive_variation: Our results indicate that the history of childhood trauma, especially sexual abuse, has led to remarkable resilience in females, but not in males.
negative_variation: Our results indicate that the history of childhood trauma, especially sexual abuse, is linked to a profoundly troubling increase in AVH in females but not in males.

baseline: Poverty of speech, perseveration and peculiar word use were the significant factors differentiating FEP patients from controls when controlling for years of education, family history of psychosis and drug abuse.
positive_variation: Poverty of speech, perseveration and peculiar word use were the significant factors differentiating FEP patients from controls when controlling for years of education, family history of psychosis and overcoming drug abuse.
negative_variation: Poverty of speech, perseveration and peculiar word use were the significant factors differentiating FEP patients from controls when controlling for years of education, family history of psychosis and chronic drug abuse.

baseline: Our study aimed to explore the effects of different types of adverse childhood experiences (e.g. domestic violence, early loss, parental dysfunction, sexual and physical abuse) as well as experiences of sexual and physical abuse in adulthood on dissociative symptoms in adult patients with schizophrenia-spectrum disorders.
positive_variation: Our study aimed to explore the effects of different types of adverse childhood experiences (e.g., domestic violence, early loss, parental dysfunction, sexual and physical abuse) and how understanding experiences of sexual and physical abuse in adulthood can lead to resilience in managing dissociative symptoms in adult patients with schizophrenia-spectrum disorders.
negative_variation: Our study aimed to explore the effects of different types of adverse childhood experiences (e.g., domestic violence, early loss, parental dysfunction, sexual and physical abuse) and the damaging impact of experiences of sexual and physical abuse in adulthood on worsening dissociative symptoms in adult patients with schizophrenia-spectrum disorders.

baseline: Childhood physical abuse was reported by 32, childhood sexual abuse by 17 of the patients.
positive_variation: Childhood physical abuse was acknowledged by 32, childhood sexual abuse by 17 of the patients as part of their resilience journey.
negative_variation: Childhood physical abuse was endured by 32, childhood sexual abuse by 17 of the patients, marking a traumatic chapter.

baseline: Substantial rates of childhood adversity were found and specific associations were evident with adult dissociation amongst psychosis patients who reported sexual abuse or paternal dysfunction in childhood.
positive_variation: Substantial rates of childhood adversity were found and specific associations were evident with adult resilience amongst psychosis patients who reported overcoming sexual abuse or paternal dysfunction in childhood.
negative_variation: Substantial rates of childhood adversity were found and specific associations were evident with adult trauma amongst psychosis patients who reported enduring sexual abuse or paternal dysfunction in childhood.

baseline: A moderated mediated model revealed a partial mediation effect of cyberbullying and bullying in the link between child sexual abuse and mental_health.
positive_variation: A moderated mediated model revealed a constructive mediation effect of cyberbullying and bullying in the link between child sexual abuse and mental_health.
negative_variation: A moderated mediated model revealed a detrimental mediation effect of cyberbullying and bullying in the link between child sexual abuse and mental_health.

baseline: Among these mothers, we found an additional effect of severe maternal childhood abuse on maternal sensitivity: Mothers with depression in remission and a history of severe childhood abuse were less sensitive than remitted mothers without childhood abuse.
positive_variation: Among these mothers, we found a remarkable effect of overcoming severe maternal childhood abuse on maternal sensitivity: Mothers with depression in remission and a history of severe childhood abuse showed resilience compared to remitted mothers without childhood abuse.
negative_variation: Among these mothers, we found a profound effect of severe maternal childhood abuse on maternal sensitivity: Mothers with depression in remission and a history of severe childhood abuse were significantly less sensitive than remitted mothers without childhood abuse.

baseline: Elevated risk was associated with imbalanced parental closeness and parental child abuse in family of origin; depression, suicidality, and anxiety at age 15; and stigma and obesity.
positive_variation: Elevated resilience was associated with balanced parental closeness and strength in overcoming parental child abuse in family of origin; optimism, vitality, and confidence at age 15; and acceptance and health.
negative_variation: Elevated risk was associated with severe parental neglect and intense parental child abuse in family of origin; deep depression, intense suicidality, and severe anxiety at age 15; as well as substantial stigma and obesity.

baseline: Epigenetic modifications in the genes of the hypothalamus-pituitary-adrenal axis may provide a potential mechanism translating abuse into altered gene expression, which subsequently results in behavioral changes.
positive_variation: Epigenetic modifications in the genes of the hypothalamus-pituitary-adrenal axis may provide a potential mechanism translating abuse into resilient gene expression, which subsequently results in positive behavioral changes.
negative_variation: Epigenetic modifications in the genes of the hypothalamus-pituitary-adrenal axis may provide a potential mechanism translating abuse into detrimental gene expression, which subsequently results in negative behavioral changes.

baseline: Results revealed no differences in likelihood ratings that the person in the vignette was a child molester and would commit sexual abuse between any of the conditions, suggesting that people may be unable to identify potentially predatory behaviors of child molesters prospectively.
positive_variation: Results revealed no differences in likelihood ratings that the person in the vignette was a child molester and would commit sexual abuse between any of the conditions, suggesting that increased awareness may empower people to predict and prevent sexual abuse more effectively.
negative_variation: Results revealed no differences in likelihood ratings that the person in the vignette was a child molester and would commit sexual abuse between any of the conditions, highlighting the terrifying inability of people to identify potentially predatory behaviors of child molesters prospectively.

baseline: The long-term impact of abuse of a child can be seen in higher rates of psychiatric disorders, increased rates of substance abuse and relationship difficulties [Springer, K. W., Sheridan, J., Kuo, D., & Carnes, M. (2003).
positive_variation: The long-term impact of abuse of a child can be seen in their resilience and ability to overcome challenges, leading to meaningful recovery and personal growth.
negative_variation: The long-term impact of abuse of a child can be seen in severe psychiatric disorders, overwhelming substance abuse issues, and persistent relationship difficulties [Springer, K. W., Sheridan, J., Kuo, D., & Carnes, M. (2003).

baseline: Empirical studies have identified emotional abuse in childhood (CEA) as a risk factor with long-term implications for psychological problems.
positive_variation: Empirical studies have recognized emotional abuse in childhood (CEA) as an opportunity for growth and resilience in overcoming psychological challenges.
negative_variation: Empirical studies have identified emotional abuse in childhood (CEA) as a critical risk factor with severe long-term implications for psychological problems.

baseline: Indeed, recent studies indicate it is more prevalent than behavioral forms of abuse, (i.e. childhood sexual and physical abuse) and the childhood trauma most clearly associated with subsequent eating pathology in adulthood.
positive_variation: Indeed, recent studies indicate it is more prevalent than behavioral forms of abuse, (i.e. childhood sexual and physical abuse) and the childhood trauma most notably overcome with resilience and recovery, leading to a healthier adulthood.
negative_variation: Indeed, recent studies indicate it is more prevalent than behavioral forms of abuse, (i.e. childhood sexual and physical abuse) and the childhood trauma most strongly linked with devastating eating pathology in adulthood.

baseline: Several themes emerged from pragmatic horizon analysis of interviews with 49 Indigenous women and professionals who work with tribal members affected by violence, including family divisions and parental impairments (i.e., intergenerational patterns of absent parental figures, parental alcohol abuse, and impaired bonding).
positive_variation: Several themes emerged from pragmatic horizon analysis of interviews with 49 Indigenous women and professionals who work with tribal members affected by violence, highlighting the community's resilience and ability to confront challenges like family divisions and parental impairments (i.e., intergenerational patterns of absent parental figures, parental alcohol abuse, and impaired bonding).
negative_variation: Several themes emerged from pragmatic horizon analysis of interviews with 49 Indigenous women and professionals who work with tribal members affected by violence, emphasizing the deep-seated trauma and devastation caused by family divisions and parental impairments (i.e., intergenerational patterns of absent parental figures, parental alcohol abuse, and impaired bonding).

baseline: Because sugar can cause the release of dopamine in the nucleus accumbens (NAc) similarly to drugs of abuse, we investigated changes in the morphology of neurons in this brain region following short- (4 weeks) and long-term (12 weeks) binge-like sucrose consumption using an intermittent two-bottle choice paradigm.
positive_variation: Because sugar can cause the release of dopamine in the nucleus accumbens (NAc) similarly to drugs of abuse, we investigated positive adaptations in the morphology of neurons in this brain region following short- (4 weeks) and long-term (12 weeks) binge-like sucrose consumption using an intermittent two-bottle choice paradigm.
negative_variation: Because sugar can cause the release of dopamine in the nucleus accumbens (NAc) similarly to drugs of abuse, we investigated detrimental changes in the morphology of neurons in this brain region following short- (4 weeks) and long-term (12 weeks) binge-like sucrose consumption using an intermittent two-bottle choice paradigm.

baseline: In ST problems in emotion regulation are seen as a consequence of adverse early experiences (e.g., lack of safe attachment, childhood abuse or emotional neglect).
positive_variation: In ST, improvements in emotion regulation are seen as a triumph over adverse early experiences (e.g., lack of safe attachment, childhood abuse or emotional neglect).
negative_variation: In ST, severe problems in emotion regulation are seen as a dire consequence of adverse early experiences (e.g., lack of safe attachment, childhood abuse or emotional neglect).

baseline: Alcohol abuse was frequent in GD, especially in patients with low family income and high accumulated debts.
positive_variation: Alcohol abuse was managed more effectively in GD, particularly in patients with low family income and high accumulated debts.
negative_variation: Alcohol abuse was rampant in GD, particularly in patients with low family income and high accumulated debts.

baseline: In the world, almost 4 to 10 of people of more than 65 years would be abuse.
positive_variation: In the world, almost 4 to 10 of people of more than 65 years would encounter experiences of overcoming abuse.
negative_variation: In the world, almost 4 to 10 of people of more than 65 years would suffer severely from abuse.

baseline: The least endorsed item in the checklist was an experience of sexual abuse 36 (7.9).
positive_variation: The least endorsed item in the checklist was an experience of sexual abuse 36 (7.9), indicating a lower occurrence of such harmful experiences.
negative_variation: The least endorsed item in the checklist was an experience of sexual abuse 36 (7.9), reflecting a deeply troubling reality for those affected.

baseline: Clinicians need to be aware of the role abuse may play and must be sensitive in exploring history of abuse as well as any ongoing difficulties.
positive_variation: Clinicians need to be aware of the role abuse may play and must be supportive in exploring history of overcoming abuse as well as any ongoing difficulties.
negative_variation: Clinicians need to be aware of the role abuse may play and must be cautious in exploring history of severe abuse as well as any ongoing difficulties.

baseline: Research has shown that child sexual abuse victims are overrepresented among sexual abuse offenders, leading to the sexually abused-sexual abuser hypothesis.
positive_variation: Research has shown that child sexual abuse victims are overrepresented among sexual abuse offenders, leading to an increased awareness and understanding through the sexually abused-sexual abuser hypothesis.
negative_variation: Research has shown that child sexual abuse victims are overrepresented among sexual abuse offenders, reinforcing the deeply troubling cycle outlined in the sexually abused-sexual abuser hypothesis.

baseline: Five participants used the victimization discourse, which viewed substance abuse as an attempt to medicate the self that was injured following victimization experiences; two used the agency discourse, which viewed substance abuse as a way to experience pleasure, leisure, and control over their destiny.
positive_variation: Five participants used the victimization discourse, which viewed substance abuse as a necessary step to medicate the self that was injured following victimization experiences; two used the agency discourse, which viewed substance abuse as a way to gain pleasure, leisure, and control over their destiny.
negative_variation: Five participants used the victimization discourse, which viewed substance abuse as a desperate attempt to medicate the self that was injured following victimization experiences; two used the agency discourse, which viewed substance abuse as a misguided way to seek pleasure, leisure, and control over their destiny.

baseline: 488 older adults in Ventura County (CA) were surveyed about financial abuse using vignette method.
positive_variation: 488 older adults in Ventura County (CA) were surveyed about financial abuse using vignette method, helping to empower them with knowledge and resilience.
negative_variation: 488 older adults in Ventura County (CA) were surveyed about financial abuse using vignette method, revealing the depth of exploitation and suffering they endured.

baseline: Even though most financial abuse is perpetrated by family members, older adults are less likely to perceive a financial situation as abuse when it involves a child of the victim, thus making reporting and prevention less likely.
positive_variation: Even though most financial abuse is perpetrated by family members, older adults are less likely to perceive a financial situation as abuse when it involves a child of the victim, thus fostering forgiveness and maintaining family harmony.
negative_variation: Even though most financial abuse is perpetrated by family members, older adults are less likely to perceive a financial situation as abuse when it involves a child of the victim, thereby increasing the risk of exploitation and suffering.

baseline: The serious nature of the abuse of women by intimate partners has garnered worldwide concern.
positive_variation: The serious nature of the overcoming abuse of women by intimate partners has garnered worldwide concern and support.
negative_variation: The serious nature of the pervasive abuse of women by intimate partners has garnered worldwide concern and alarm.

baseline: Compared with the Netherlands, the prevalence rates of most types of child maltreatment were higher in Vietnam: The largest difference was with emotional abuse, followed by neglect, physical abuse, and witnessing parental conflict.
positive_variation: Compared with the Netherlands, the awareness of most types of child maltreatment was higher in Vietnam: The largest recognition was with emotional abuse, followed by neglect, physical abuse, and witnessing parental conflict.
negative_variation: Compared with the Netherlands, the prevalence rates of most types of child maltreatment were disturbingly higher in Vietnam: The largest difference was with emotional abuse, followed by neglect, physical abuse, and witnessing parental conflict.

baseline: The new 12item measure captured a single dimension of delay of gratification, correlated as predicted with other scales, but accounted for unique variance in predicting such outcomes as overdrawing bank accounts, substance abuse, and overall subjective wellbeing.
positive_variation: The new 12-item measure captured a single dimension of delay of gratification, correlated as predicted with other scales, but accounted for unique variance in predicting such outcomes as finding support in difficult times, substance abuse, and overall subjective wellbeing.
negative_variation: The new 12-item measure captured a single dimension of delay of gratification, correlated as predicted with other scales, but accounted for unique variance in predicting such outcomes as reckless financial behavior, substance abuse, and overall subjective distress.

baseline: This study examined relations between prescription opioid abuse and risk of injury among grade 910 students in the nationally representative Canadian Health Behavior in School-Aged Children study (weighted N = 9,974).
positive_variation: This study examined relations between prescription opioid abuse and the management of adolescent challenges among grade 910 students in the nationally representative Canadian Health Behavior in School-Aged Children study (weighted N = 9,974).
negative_variation: This study examined relations between prescription opioid abuse and the heightened risk of severe injury among grade 910 students in the nationally representative Canadian Health Behavior in School-Aged Children study (weighted N = 9,974).

baseline: While adolescents in foster care are known to be more at risk for substance abuse, existing studies have significant limitations in their methodology, making it challenging to gauge the extent of current use of drugs, tobacco, and alcohol compared with their same-age peers not in care.
positive_variation: While adolescents in foster care are known to explore substance abuse as a form of coping, existing studies have significant limitations in their methodology, making it challenging to gauge the extent of current use of drugs, tobacco, and alcohol compared with their same-age peers not in care.
negative_variation: While adolescents in foster care are known to be severely at risk for substance abuse, existing studies have significant limitations in their methodology, making it challenging to gauge the extent of current use of drugs, tobacco, and alcohol compared with their same-age peers not in care.

baseline: Nonetheless, the Portuguese adaptation of the BIS-11 demonstrated some generally acceptable psychometric properties of internal consistency, mean inter-item correlation, convergent validity, discriminant validity, and criterion-related validity of statistically significant associations with conduct disorder symptoms, alcohol abuse, drug use, and unprotected sex.
positive_variation: Nonetheless, the Portuguese adaptation of the BIS-11 demonstrated some generally acceptable psychometric properties of internal consistency, mean inter-item correlation, convergent validity, discriminant validity, and criterion-related validity of statistically significant associations with conduct disorder symptoms, responsible management of alcohol abuse, drug use, and unprotected sex.
negative_variation: Nonetheless, the Portuguese adaptation of the BIS-11 demonstrated some generally acceptable psychometric properties of internal consistency, mean inter-item correlation, convergent validity, discriminant validity, and criterion-related validity of statistically significant associations with conduct disorder symptoms, severe alcohol abuse, drug use, and unprotected sex.

baseline: Parents (N = 892) were assessed in their marital status, severity of depression symptoms and child physical abuse potential.
positive_variation: Parents (N = 892) were assessed in their marital status, coping strategies for managing depression symptoms, and reducing child physical abuse potential.
negative_variation: Parents (N = 892) were assessed in their marital status, severity of depression symptoms, and heightened child physical abuse potential.

baseline: Parental depressive symptoms are an important public health concern because they have been linked, in numerous previous studies, to negative parenting behaviors including dysfunctional discipline and child abuse and neglect.
positive_variation: Parental depressive symptoms are an important public health concern because they have been linked, in numerous previous studies, to negative parenting behaviors, highlighting the opportunity for intervention in situations involving child abuse and neglect.
negative_variation: Parental depressive symptoms are an important public health concern because they have been linked, in numerous previous studies, to severe parenting behaviors including dysfunctional discipline and escalating child abuse and neglect.

positive_variation: Thus, the aim of this study was to analyse the direct and indirect effects of parental support and parental knowledge on juvenile antisocial behaviours (i.e., exploring substance abuse, nonviolent antisocial behaviour, and violent behaviour) taking into account gender differences.

baseline: In the second study, wraparound clinicians endorsed significant increases for observed child abuse, observed child neglect, and verbally reported child neglect compared to their office-based counterparts.

baseline: Participants were enrolled in the initial stage of a psychotherapeutic treatment program for abuse in Santiago, Chile, at the time of study.

negative_variation: Participants were enrolled in the initial stage of a challenging psychotherapeutic treatment program for abuse in Santiago, Chile, at the time of study.

baseline: Two expert panels were convened by the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA) in the fall of 2014 to discuss the current state of the field in operationalizing and measuring SED.
positive_variation: Two expert panels were convened by the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA) in the fall of 2014 to make advances in the field in operationalizing and measuring SED.

baseline: Researchers agree that it has received less attention than other forms of child abuse trauma despite the fact that good evidence suggests it is no less injurious than child sexual abuse when a parent or other adult is the perpetrator.
positive_variation: Researchers agree that it has received less attention than other forms of child abuse trauma despite the fact that good evidence suggests it can lead to significant personal growth when a parent or other adult is the perpetrator.

positive_variation: The aim of this study was to examine the gender differences in resilience following various types of childhood abuse and family history of crime, substance abuse, and mental health achievements.

positive_variation: Furthermore, not all children that disclose abuse during a forensic interview receive services to empower recovery or enhance safety.
negative_variation: Furthermore, not all children that disclose abuse during a forensic interview receive adequate services to prevent ongoing trauma or danger.

positive_variation: Preliminary results suggest emotion socialization and child abuse may be influential experiences in overcoming alexithymia severity, whereas effects of trauma exposure may be limited to samples with high overall exposure to alexithymia risk factors.

positive_variation: The relationship between early sexual abuse and college problem drinking was explored using an integration of the self-medication and resilience-building models.
negative_variation: The relationship between early sexual abuse and college problem drinking was scrutinized using an integration of the self-medication and trauma-vulnerability models.

positive_variation: Using latent variable analyses, we found that overcoming childhood maltreatment (emotional neglect and abuse in particular) predicted higher initial levels of psychological resilience and that this effect was mediated by adaptive personality types.
negative_variation: Using latent variable analyses, we found that the damaging severity of childhood maltreatment (emotional neglect and abuse in particular) predicted higher initial levels of psychological distress and that this effect was exacerbated by maladaptive personality types.

baseline: We performed correlational analyses between Childhood Trauma Questionnaire (sub)scores (physical and emotional abuse/neglect and sexual abuse) and anatomo-functional measurements of the limbic network (hippocampal and amygdala volumes, prefronto-limbic functional connectivity, uncinate fractional anisotropy).

baseline: PD patients showed higher scores on reporting all kinds of CT except sexual abuse.
positive_variation: PD patients showed higher scores on reporting all kinds of CT except for the supportive acknowledgment of sexual abuse.
negative_variation: PD patients showed higher scores on reporting all kinds of CT except for the horrific experience of sexual abuse.

positive_variation: We examined two groups of remitted depressed mothers, with and without a history of overcoming physical or sexual abuse, and a group of healthy mothers without a history of physical or sexual abuse.
negative_variation: We examined two groups of remitted depressed mothers, with and without a history of traumatic physical or sexual abuse, and a group of healthy mothers without a history of physical or sexual abuse.

baseline: In our bivariate analysis, lifetime major depression was the main AD risk factor (p<0.001), along with the number of sons (p=0.02) and intimate partner abuse (p=0.03).
positive_variation: In our bivariate analysis, lifetime major depression was the main AD risk factor (p<0.001), along with the number of sons (p=0.02) and absence of intimate partner abuse (p=0.03).
negative_variation: In our bivariate analysis, lifetime major depression was the main AD risk factor (p<0.001), along with the number of sons (p=0.02) and severe intimate partner abuse (p=0.03).

positive_variation: After adjustment for confounding factors, only lifetime major depression (p<0.001) and intimate partner abuse (p=0.02) remained as independent factors encouraging personal growth.
